Ms. Célestine, who is at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is the group's representative. She is a widow, 47 years old, and the mother of four children, including three girls. She has been active in selling vegetables and mangos for over six years. She is going to use the money requested to purchase mangos and vegetables. The profits will be used for savings and for covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase mangos and vegetables

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de deux membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été  le 22 décembre 2012. Il regroupe des femmes du même village qui ont de bonnes relations et qui s'activent principalement dans le commerce, l'embouche et l'agriculture.
BOUSSO debout a droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter des moutons et fait aussi parallèlement du commerce de savon a base de produits locaux. Avec son crédit elle va acheter des moutons et de l'aliment de bétail pour les emboucher. 
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes, et rembourser son prêt.
texts.en:
This group of two members is part of the 'banc villageois' created on December 22, 2012. It is composed of women from the same village who get along well with one another and who are active mainly in commerce, livestock farming, and agriculture. BOUSSO, who is standing at the right of the photo with her left hand raised, is 41 years old and a married mother of six children.

With this loan, she is going to purchase sheep and at the same time sell soap made from local products. She will also purchase some animal feed to fatten the animals. The profits will enable her to help cover family expenses and to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and some soap

loans.name: Purita

texts.en: Purita lives in Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental and supports her three children through her farming business. She is also a public school teacher in one of the secondary schools in Plaridel. She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy building material, and paint, and to pay her workers. This time, she is taking another loan of PHP 35,000.00 to pay for processing of land titles.

loans.use: to pay for processing of land titles.

loans.name: Djiguipoune Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 06 juin 2001. Ce groupe est composé de 11 femmes qui exercent le commerce et qui se soutiennent solidairement dans leurs activités. Elles prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Dienaba Omar qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 35 ans et mère de sept enfants dont quatre garçons et trois filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de diverses produits comme: poisson fumé, huile, patte d'arachide, sucre et thé depuis plus de dix ans chez elle et dans les villages environnants. Avec le prêt sollicité, elle va acheter une soixantaine de kilogramme de poissons fumés, deux bidons de vingt litres d'huile, dix sacs de cinquante kilogramme d'arachides. Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge en nourriture et en habillement de la famille.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was inaugurated on June 06, 2001. This group is composed of eleven women who work in commerce and who support with solidarity one another’s work. Ms. Dienaba Omar, who is at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 35 years old, and the mother of seven children, of whom four are boys, and three are girls. She has been active in selling a variety of products, such as: smoked fish, oil, peanut butter, sugar, and tea, for over ten years in her home and in nearby villages. 

With the loan requested, she is going to purchase about 60 kg of smoked fish, two 20-liter containers of oil, and ten 50-kg sacks of peanuts. The profits will be used to cover food and clothing for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Hector Daniel

texts.es: Héctor de 37 años de edad, vive en casa de su propiedad a lado de su esposa y de sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 5 años de edad. Héctor  es una persona dedicada a su familia por lo que siempre busca la manera  de que no les falte nada en el hogar, él se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de maíz y frijol los cuales luego de cosechar los distribuye en diferentes zonas de su municipio, además para mejorar sus ingresos también desempeña la labor de albañil. Héctor con el deseo de mejorar su vivienda y brindar a  su familia una vivienda más digna ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder comprar: ladrillo, arena, cemento, hierro, lámina, etc., para la construcción de paredes y colocar techo.
texts.en:
Héctor is 37 years old. He lives in a house that is his property along with his wife and three children aged 15, 13 and 5 years old. Héctor is dedicated to his family and is always looking for a way to have everything they need in their house. He works in agriculture growing corn and beans which he distributes in different parts of his municipality after the harvest. And he also works as a bricklayer to improve his income .

With the desire to improve his house and provide his family with a more dignified house Hector has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI. He will use it to buy bricks, sand, cement, re-bar, laminate sheeting, etc. to construct walls and put up the roof.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, re-bar, laminate sheeting, etc. to construct walls and put up the roof.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting to earning income as well. Marcelina has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Marcelina has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Marcelina hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate, which will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson desde niño conoció el negocio de venta de pescado, su familia ha sido comerciante de diferentes clases de pescado y él desde sus 15 años de edad se incorporó a esta actividad, hoy en día ofrece pescado en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de Cartagena de Indias y el fruto de su trabajo ha sido el sustento de sus hijos y cónyuge todos estos años.  El ofrece a partir de las 6 a.m. hasta las 9 a.m. pescado fresco a los transeúntes del sector y en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar mojarras, jurel, bocachico, sierra y demás. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio y vivir cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Since he was young, Nelson learned the fish selling business. His family has been selling different types of fish and, when he was 15 years old, Nelson joined the business. He currently offers fish at a stand located in the market in Cartagena de Indias. The fruit of his work has provided for his children and spouse all of these years. 

Between 6 AM and 9 AM he sells fresh fish to the passersby of the sector and is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy bream, horse mackerel, bocachico, swordfish and other types of fish. His goal for the future is to expand his business and live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy bream, horse mackerel, bocachico, swordfish and other types of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de hilos poliester el cuando vende por libras, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como puede salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir su casa pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón eta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated is 22 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He sells polyester thread by the pound. With the income he earns from his sales, the borrower is able to get ahead. The young man lives in his own home along with his life companion.

He wants to improve his living situation by finishing the construction of his house, but he does not earn enough from his sales to accomplish this goal. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials and pay for labor. As a result, he will be able to have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Bignona Chateau D Eau Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 28 Mars 2002. Ce groupe est composé de vingt femmes qui remboursent leur prêt sans difficulté. Madame Yaye qui est la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire, âgée de 45 ans et mère de deux enfants dont une fille et un garçon. Elle s'active dans la vente des produits électro ménagers depuis plus de dix ans. Le prêt sollicité va lui permettre de renforcer son activité qui marche à merveille. Les bénéfices vont servir à soutenir sa famille.
texts.en: The 'banc villageois' was inaugurated on March 28, 2002. This group is composed of twenty women who pay back their loans without difficulty. Ms. Yaye, who is at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is unmarried, 45 years old, and the mother of two children (a boy and a girl). She has been active in selling household appliances for over ten years. The loan is going to enable her to bolster her business, which is going very well. The profits will be used to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances to resell

loans.name: Boucotte Peyrissac Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été le 22 Mars 2001. Le groupe est composé de onze femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce et qui remboursent leurs prêts sans difficulté. Madame Binta qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et âgée de 20 ans. Elle s'active dans la vente de mangues depuis cinq ans. Le crédit sollicité va renforcer son activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en: The 'banc villageois' was inaugurated on March 22, 2001. This group is composed of eleven women who are active in commerce and who pay back their loans without difficulty. Ms. Binta, who is at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. Unmarried and without children, she is 20 years old and has been active in selling mangos for five years. The loan requested is going to bolster her business. The profits will be used to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase mangos

loans.name: Mtvarisa

texts.en:
Mtvarisa is a pensioner woman from Tkibuli district. She has only one son who works at the local factory and gets a fixed salary. Mtvarisa has a great desire to add her bit to the family's welfare and somehow improve the living conditions. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category.

Mtvarisa has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Mtvarisa will purchase stock of clothing and various kinds of textiles at wholesale prices in Turkey and will sell at the local market with increased prices. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase significantly. Mtvarisa and her son will be able to create better living conditions.

loans.use: To trade in clothing and textiles.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es una persona que está luchando, trabaja y actualmente está cursando el último año de la carrera Ingeniería Agro forestal. Proviene de una familia muy trabajadora y es una persona con deseos de superación.
Cesar lucha y se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y ser una persona de bien que ayude a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
César is someone who is striving. He works and is currently in the last year of his program in agroforestry engineering. He comes from a very hardworking family and wants to improve himself.

César is striving and making an effort to be able to get ahead and be an honorable person who helps other people.

He's requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for his program so he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Boucotte Peyrissac Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 22 Mars 2001. Le groupe qui constitue ce dossier est composé de vingt femmes travailleuses qui ont les mêmes objectifs. Madame Combe qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 58 ans et mère de six enfants dont quatre garçons. Elle s'active depuis plus de cinq ans dans la vente de petit déjeuner et de crème glace. Le prêt sollicité va lui permettre de renforcer son activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en: The 'banc villageois' was inaugurated on March 22, 2001. This group, which constitutes this file, is composed of twenty hard-working women with the same goals. Ms. Combe, who is at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 58 years old, and the mother of six children, including four boys. She has been active in selling breakfasts and ice cream, for five years. The loan requested is going to enable her to bolster her business. The profits will be used to meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making breakfasts to sell

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Orn, 38, lives in a community of Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. She has three children in total. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale and is a fisherwoman who can earn, on average, an income of USD 5.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for seven years. 

Her current boat is pretty old and she wants to replace a new one but she cannot afford it. That is why she is applying for Kiva loan to buy a new boat.  This loan will make a great contribution to develop her career as well as her living standard. She is thankful for the all lender for their kindly financial support.

loans.use: to buy a new boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on hair products such as shampoo, massages, dyes and other products necessary to provide her services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: brick, a toilet, laminate, wood, etc. to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La señora Francisca de estado civil casada, alcanzó a estudiar  hasta  primaria, ella vive en el área rural junto a su esposo en una casa de adobe que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a su esposo para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura,  en esta actividad lleva muchos años, donde produce y comercializa sus producción. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, maíz, avena, cebada y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Francisca se ve la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos, de esta manera poder ampliar su producción, continuar con su comercialización y obtener ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisca is married. She was able to go to primary school. She lives in a rural area with her husband in an adobe house that lacks basic services. She is a hardworking person and with much optimism she works day to day with her husband to obtain income to support themselves. She works mainly in agriculture. She has worked at this activity for several years, and she produces and sells her products. What they are able to grow is taken to sell in the provincial markets in the area and in nearby towns. The main products they grow are potatoes in large quantities, corn, oatmeal, barley and other products in smaller quantities for their own consumption. Francisca needs to ask for a loan to buy materials to increase production, continue selling, and obtain more income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand production of potatoes, corn, oatmeal, barley) and continue selling and obtain income to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El señor David de 28 años de edad vive y trabaja actualmente en domicilio y terreno de su padres, no tiene hijos que depende de el, actualmente no  es casado, solo vive con su padre que es de la tercera edad ya que su madre ya dejó de existir hace muchos años, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán. Su principal actividad del señor David es la producción de miel de abejas. Es por eso que el señor David requiere el préstamo que será destinado para la compra  de materiales y equipamiento para la apicultura, con la compra de la misma empezara su actividad ya que tiene la necesidad de facilitar su trabajo con la producción de miel por lo tanto podrá generar buenos ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar y su diario vivir con su padre ya que esta actividad requiere de mayor inversión y dedicación.
texts.en:
David is 28 years old and currently lives and works in his father's home and on his land. He does not have any dependant children and is not currently married. He only lives with his elderly father as his mother passed away many years ago. He lives in the state of Chuquisaca in the town of Villa Vaca Guzmán. 
David's main activity is the production of honey from bees. This is why David needs the loan. It will be used for buying agricultural materials and equipment. With these he will begin the work that is needed to facilitate the production of honey. Making honey will generate a good income and improve the quality of life in their home. David's daily life with his father requires great investment and dedication.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials and equipment to produce honey.

loans.name: Florame

texts.en:
Florame is 22 years old and married with two children.

Florame is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain it. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Florame would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Miguel  Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel es un señor de 56 años, vive junto a su esposa y su hija en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, habitan en casa arrendada en donde además tiene su negocio.
Él se dedica a la cerrajería varios años, tiene mucha experiencia en esto, él elabora protecciones para ventanas, puertas y escaleras, es muy conocido en el sector porque es un señor muy responsable con la entrega de sus trabajos.
Miguel Ángel es cliente de la fundación, este es su segundo crédito, con el primero pudo hacer el cerramiento de su casa que tiene en otro sector de la ciudad, ahora con este crédito desea mejorar la vivienda para ya poder ir a vivir allá y adecuarla para en un futuro poner su negocio en un local propio.
Está muy agradecido porque invertido muy bien el dinero, está feliz porque puede palpar su progreso.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is 56 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the city of Santo Domingo. They live in a rented house where he also has his business. He has worked as a metal worker for many years and has a lot of experience in this field. He creates window guards, doors, and staircases and is well known in his area because he is a responsible man when it comes to completing his work.

Miguel Angel is a client of the Foundation and this is his second loan. With the first, he was able to make an enclosure for his home that he has in another part of the city. With this loan, he hopes to improve the house in order to go live there and adapt it to be able to install his business in it’s own storefront.

He is thankful because he well invested the money and is happy because he can feel his progress.

loans.use: to adapt the house he currently lives in and, in the future, install his business in it's own storefront.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a 53-year-old married woman with eleven children, two of whom are in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elma has been in this business for 21 years, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elma would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Kuña Pyapy Mbarete está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, el nombre quiere decir, mujer con brazo fuerte, ya que ellas están poniendo su esfuerzo incansable para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elena se dedica a las ventas en su despensa en su casa, ella es muy sacrificada, ya que todos los días desde muy tempranas horas empieza su trabajo, y se gana la vida de esta forma, digna y sencilla. Comenta que poco a poco se fue abriendo camino y ya es muy conocida en su comunidad, por ser una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada. 
Elena solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos varios de primera necesidad, harina, aceite, yerba, azúcar, leche entre otros, para poder surtir su despensa, y continuar con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Pyapy Mbarete is in its 6th cycle of its women's committee. The name means woman with strong arm, now that they are exerting their untiring effort to be able to grow and get ahead. 

One of the members is Elena. She makes a living selling from her pantry in her house. She sacrifices a lot, since every day she starts her work in the early morning hours, and she earns a living in this way, dignified and straightforward. She says that little by little she is making a way for herself and she is very well known in her community for being a hard working and sacrificing woman. 

Elena is asking for this loan to buy various staple products: flour, oil, yerba, sugar, milk, among other things, to be able to stock her pantry, and continue with her sales like she has been doing.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, yerba, sugar, milk, and other products to stock a pantry

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.es:
Nehemias tiene 25 años, es conviviente, Vive en casa familiar con cónyuge y 02 hijos de 03 años y 01 año respectivamente, en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Comunidad se dedicada a la pesca, a la ganadería y agricultura.

Nehemias se dedica a prestar servicio como ayudante de albañilería y construcción, desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. Adicionalmente trabaja cuando está en temporada como pescador artesanal. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de nuevas herramientas de trabajo para cumplir con contratos que tiene pendientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
25-year-old Nehemias is in a common law relationship. He lives his with partner and 2 children ages 2 and 1 in a community within the district of Lagunas, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, north coast of Peru. The main activities in his community are fishing, cattle-raising and agriculture. 

Nehemias has worked in construction for approximately 5 years. He also works as an artisanal fisherman during the fishing season. He requires a loan to invest in the purchase of new work tools to finish his pending contracts. This will allow him to improve his income in the short term and therefore improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new work tools to finish his pending contracts.

loans.name: Edgar Gabriel

texts.es:
Edgar es un joven estudiante que vive en el Distrito de Jacobo Hunter, ubicado en Arequipa la cual se encuentra en la parte Sierra Sur del Perú. Edgar se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Electrotecnia Industrial, decidió estudiar esa carrera porque en su escuela secundaria, ingresó al taller de electrónica y le gustó mucho ver como los circuitos y la electricidad, también por la gran demanda laboral que existe de electricistas.
Le beneficiaría mucho porque así podrá trabajar en cualquier empresa y apoyar a sus padres, correspondiendo así al gran apoyo que le brindaron por el gran sacrificio que están haciendo para poder pagar sus estudios.
Él va estudiando un año, aún le faltan 2 años más para terminar su carrera. Le dedica 9 horas diarias a sus estudios, salvo los días en los cuales tenga exámenes, porque ahí si está tiempo completo.
Él está solicitando el apoyo de KIVA ya que sus padres no cuentan con los recursos económicos para poder solventar sus estudios. Edgar utilizará este préstamo para pagar las pensiones de su carrera y continuar estudiando. Este préstamo le permitirá a su familia disminuir sus problemas económicos, habrán muchos cambios porque tendrá un título profesional como Técnico Industrial y trabajar en grandes empresas. Al haber logrado este préstamo, Edgar se siente aliviado ya que por el momento se encuentra en una situación muy crítica por el pago de sus pensiones.
El mayor sueño que tiene en la vida es brindarle a sus padres las comodidades que nunca tuvieron por el sacrificio que tuvieron que hacer para brindarle una profesión.
Él se siente completamente agradecido y quiere expresarles unas palabras:"Gracias KIVA por el apoyo que me están brindando, les corresponderé siendo una persona de bien y no los defraudaré".
texts.en:
Edgar is a young student who lives in the District of Jacobo Hunter. It is located in Arequipa, which is in the Southern Sierra region of Peru. Edgar is studying for a degree in Electrical Industrial Engineering. He decided to study for this degree because he was enrolled in the electrical workshop in secondary school, and he liked seeing how circuits and electricity worked; and also because of the high demand for electrical professionals. 

It would benefit him very much, because in this way, he will be able to work in any company and support his parents. Thus, he will pay them back for the great support that they have given him through the great sacrifices they are making in order to pay for his studies.

He has been studying for one year, and he has two years remaining to complete his degree. He devotes nine hours a day to his studies, except for the days that he has exams, because he is there full-time.

He is requesting the support of Kiva, as his parents don’t have the financial resources to pay for his studies. Edgar will use this loan to pay for his tuition and continue studying. This loan will allow his family to lessen their financial problems, and there will be many changes, because he will have a professional degree as an industrial engineer and will work in large companies. Edgar feels relieved by having attained this loan, as he finds himself in a very critical situation regarding his tuition payments.

The biggest dream that he has in life is to give his parents the comforts that they never had because of the sacrifices that they had to make in order to give him a profession.

He feels totally thankful, and he wants to say these words: “Thank you Kiva, for the support that you are giving me. I will repay you, being a good person, and I won’t let you down”.

loans.use: to pay off the outstanding debt and continue studying Electrical Industrial Engineering, in order to become an excellent professional.

loans.name: Eufrasia

texts.en:
Eufrasia is a 57-year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eufrasia runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and  other groceries.

Eufrasia has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Eufrasia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and  other groceries

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 66-year-old woman with four children.

Florencia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Florencia has been in this business for 26 years, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Qiyun

texts.en:
Qiyun is a 32 years old man who is working in the construction field. Qiyun has two children, and one is attending school. His wife didn’t find a job, as she needs to take care of their children and support their elderly parents.

Last year, because of his parent's illness, Qiyun returned to his hometown and started selling vegetables and fruits with his wife. They spent almost their savings for treating his parent’s illness, which increase the burden of the family. 

Qiyun and his wife have been running their own business for just 7 month so not much profit has been made. Recently, Qiyun intends to purchase a motor tricycle, when summer arrived, when fruit is easy to sell. 

Qiyun requested 15,000 from Microcred.  They will use part of the money to purchase a motor tricycle, and the rest of the money will be spent on the registration of his little son at the local police station.  

Qiyun has a dream to open a supermarket where could sell different kinds of fruits and goods. Qiyun believes that hardworking and diligence will make his dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase a motor tricycle for selling fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona es una mujer muy sacrificada, que lucha por salir adelante, a la vez que estudia también trabaja.
Está en el primer año de la carrera de ciencias contables, se está esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y seguir luchando cada día.
texts.en:
Ramona is a sacrificing woman, who fights to get ahead; at the same time that she's studying she also works.

She is in her first year of her accounting science degree. She is working to be able to be someone in life and get ahead.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her degree, and to continue fighting every day.

loans.use: To pay university fees

loans.name: Las Puntualitas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PUNTUALITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elba, la socia continua con su  negocio de cultivo de frutas como naranjas, plátanos entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de animales, agricultura.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir  con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the "Las Puntualitas" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, province of La Convencion, region of Cusco. 

One of the partners, Elba, continues with her fruit-growing business. She grows fruits such as oranges and plantains among others. She has been in this business for quite some time and is successful thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She is a responsible and hardworking person and this allows her to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers among other products.

The other partners work selling fruits, animals and in agriculture. They all generally thank the loans obtained and promise to pay at the established times.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers among other products.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a 52-year-old widowed woman with one child.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Herminia has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Herminia has been in this business for 2 years, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Herminia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of ingredients such as spices, vegetables, meat, etc.

Rose Marie has been in this business for 14 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ingredients, such as spices, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijas en el distrito de Huarmaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Huancabamba, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Mauricio se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza hace años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona; además se dedica a la venta de ganado caprino. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado y mejorar la infraestructura de su corral de chivos, con esto Mauricio espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 43 years old and lives with his spouse and two daughters in the district of Huarmaca, located in the province of Huancabamba, in the region of Piura, in the northern coast of Peru. Life in this community is calm and the residents primarily work raising and selling small livestock.

Mauricio works providing transportation services to passengers in his vehicle (a motorcycle taxi); a job he has done for years. He has experience in this sector and has good personal and professional references in the area. He also works selling goats. The loan will be used to repair and maintain his vehicle as it is currently in poor condition and to improve the infrastructure of his goat corral. With this, Mauricio hopes to offer better services to his clients, which will earn him greater profits and therefore improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle which is currently in poor condition and to improve the infrastructure of his goat corral.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay university fees

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a 41-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Fe has a business buying and selling home care products in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as soap, etc. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as soap, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 34 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, beverages, home care product, and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Narcizo Antonio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Antonio, un señor de 33 años, comparte su vida junto a su esposa y sus tres hijas.
Antonio trabaja en las ferias de ganado, va a las fincas y vende los animales, este negocio lo aprendió de su padre y está agradecido porque gracias a estos ingresos él ha podido mantener a su familia y darles la educación a sus hijas. Antonio también además de este negocio él trabaja dos días en el terminal terrestre vendiendo boletos de transporte. 
Antonio es nuevo para la institución, vino referido por una muy buena clienta da la Fundación, con este crédito él podrá comprar más animales y así podrá fortalecerse en el negocio. Se siente muy agradecido con las personas de Kiva ya que permiten que el microempresario se supere y fortalezca sus negocios.
texts.en:
Antonio lives in the city of Santo Domingo. He is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters. Antonio works in the livestock markets and he goes to farms and sells the animals. He learned this business from his father. Antonio is grateful because thanks to his income, he has been able to support his family and provide an education for his daughters. Antonio also, aside from this business, works two days in the bus terminal selling tickets.

Antonio is new to the institution and came recommended by a very good client of the Foundation. With this loan, he will be able to buy more animals and therefore strengthen his business. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because they allow microentrepreneurs to overcome and strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more animals and therefore strengthen his business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Divina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her business.

Divina has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Divina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: block, gravel, sand, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Germelinda

texts.en: Germelinda is a 72-year-old widow who has 3 adult children. She lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She owns a sari-sari store (convenience store) which is operated by her children now. She is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC where she uses programs & services, especially insurance products. Right now, she requests another loan of PHP 15,000.00 to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase her medications.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up & to purchase her medictions

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a businesswoman from Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a 52-year-old widow, and has expertise in selling. 

Flordeliza runs a mini grocery store, and earns an income that sufficiently supports her family. She is a full fledged member of PMPC, and has taken  several loans in the past. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default. She has now applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Flordeliza continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Los Amautas Pan De Azucar Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS AMAUTAS PAN DE AZUCAR,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate,provincia de La Convención.
La socia Alejandrina tiene 60 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la venta de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the communal bank Los Amautas Pan De Azucar. It is located in the Echarate district in the province La Convención. Alejandrina is 60 years old, has five children, and is married.

She alternates her daily tasks, and earns a living selling fruit. She has been in the business for some time now and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and compost. The members in general are thankful for the loan, and commit to making the established payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Ruth Viviana

texts.es:
En Santo Domingo vive Ruth una señora de 28 años, habita junto a sus dos hijas y su esposo.
Ruth y su esposo trabajan en su finca, ambos se dan el apoyo para mantener limpia sus tierras, se dedican a la producción de yuca, cacao y plátano, todos los días le dan mantenimiento para cuidar de su producción.
Juntos han trabajado duro desde hace varios años, comenzaron de a poco, ahora con el esfuerzo que han realizado pudieron también comprar vacas, chanchos y pollos. Todo esto para mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar a sus pequeñas en la educación que ellos no pudieron tener.
Ruth es clienta nueva de la institución, se siente muy feliz y muy agradecida con KIVA porque con este crédito ella con su esposo podrán comprar abonos y otros insumos para poderle seguir dando mantenimiento a la finca.
texts.en:
28-year-old Ruth lives in Santo Domingo with her two daughters and her husband. Ruth and her husband work on their farm. They both provide support in order to keep their land clean. They grow yucca, cacao and plantains. Every day they maintain and care for their yield.

Together they have worked hard for many years. They started with little and now, with the work they have done, were also able to buy cows, pigs and chickens; all to improve their income and support their small daughters in their education, which they could never have.

Ruth is a new client of the institution. She is very happy and thankful for Kiva because with this loan, she and her husband will be able to buy fertilizers and other supplies to continue maintaining the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies to be able to keep her farm productive.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 57 years old and has six children. Marina is a married woman.

Marina is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Marina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marina has been in this business for 29 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 49 years old and married with two children. For the past three years she has operated a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Narcisa has applied for a 6,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy groceries to sell like canned goods, eggs and home care products, among other things. She is working to save enough money to enlarge her shop.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her sari-sari, or general store.

loans.name: Tilene Centrale 2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 11 Mai 2001. Les trois femmes qui composent ce groupe qui porte le nom usoforal(solidarité)s'entraident mutuellement et remboursent leur prêt sans difficulté. Madame Marie Augustine qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de 73 ans et mère de neuf enfants dont cinq garçons. Elle s'active dans l'embouche porcine depuis plus de dix ans. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
This banc villageois has been launched on May 11, 2001. The three women who belong to a group named "Usoforal" (Solidarity) help each other and repay their loans without issues. Ms. Marie Augustine, the one on the right raising her hand in the photo, is the group's representative. She is a widow, 73 years old, and the mother of nine children, five of them sons. She has been raising pigs for over ten years. 

She is requesting this loan to bolster her business. Her revenues will help provide for the household needs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal fodder.

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
Mirabel, 33, is married and has five children ranging in age from nine down to one year. The family lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol where for the past three years she has earned a living by farming rice. She also fishes and sells her catch to the local population.

Mirabel is applying for a 9,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides. These inputs will enable her to achieve a bountiful harvest. In this way she could continue providing nutritious food for and finance the schooling of her children.

Mirabel has two goals: to develop her farmland and open up a sari-sari, or small general store in the future.

loans.use: to buy  rice seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Raziya

texts.ru: Разия, 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругой воспитывают 2 детей, уже есть внуки. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Разии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, а также земельный надел размером 0,30 ГА, на котором выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Разия обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Разия планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Raziya is 49 years old and married. She and her husband [have brought up] two children; they are already grandparents. Raziya has received secondary education. As a source of income for her family, Raziya raises livestock and grows farm crops, having launched this business 20 years ago by purchasing cattle for 10,000 soms (KGS). Thanks to Raziya's hard work, her farm at present includes two cows and a field of 0.3 ha [0.7 acres], where she grows potatoes. Her monthly revenue is about 6,000 KGS. 

In order to develop her business further, Raziya has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy a cow. She plans to use her revenues for an additional increase of livestock and for building a cattle shed.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase the livestock headcount.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with eight children.

She is requesting a loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and re-paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Boucotte Centre Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 11 Juillet 2002. Ce groupe est composé de deux femmes qui exercent toutes deux le commerce. Elles sont solidaires et se soutiennent mutuellement, et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Montang qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de 61 ans et mère de six enfants dont trois filles et trois garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de beignets et de produits divers depuis plus de quinze ans. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité trois sacs de farine, vingt litres d'huile et trois sacs de mil et divers produits. Elle n'est pas la seule qui dans cette activité, mais elle a une clientèle potentielle. Avec ses bénéfices elle compte acheter un lit, une armoire et participer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This banc villageois has been launched on July 11, 2002. This group is composed of two women, both of whom work as vendors. They show solidarity and help each other, taking out loans and repaying them on time. Ms. Montang, the one on the right raising her hand, is the group's representative. She is a widow, 61 years old, and the mother of six: three daughters and three sons. She has been selling fritters and miscellaneous items for over 15 years. 

With this new loan she will buy three bags of flour, 20 liters [5 gallons] of oil, three bags of millet and miscellaneous products. She is not the only one offering these goods for sale, but she has a good customer base. Thanks to her revenues, she plans to buy a bed and a closet as well as contribute to everyday household expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil and millet.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
La señora Placida, es una persona humilde y respetuosa en su comunidad donde trabaja, por lo dedicado al trabajo agrícola, con lo cual saca a su familia adelante para así mantener y cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos, como madre quiere lo mejor para sus hijos. 
La señora Placida, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada con el señor Severo tiene tres hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, vive en una comunidad rural muy alejada al área urbano. La señora Placida, se dedica a la agricultura porque es lo único que aprendió con sus progenitores.
El año 2014 sufrió una disminución en sus ingresos económicos por los bajos precios que atravesó los productos agrícolas y también por las lluvias y heladas que le echaron a perder su producción de papa, perdió parte de su cultivo de papa. La comunidad entera sufrió los daños.
Por estos motivos mencionados su estabilidad económica ha sufrido un desequilibrio, afectando directamente en la adquisición de sus insumos agrícolas que se requieren para la producción y para la alimentación de sus hijos. La señora Placida, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar semilla de papa e insumos agrícolas de esta manera mejorar su economía y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Placida is a humble lady who is respected in the community where she works. She does farming work, which helps her to support her family and cover the expenses for her children’s education. As a mother, she wants the best for her children.

Placida is 50 years old. Her husband’s name is Severo and they have three children who are dependent on them. They live in a rural community that is very remote. Placida works in agriculture because it is the only thing she learnt from her parents.

In 2014 there was a decrease in her earnings due to the low prices fetched by her produce. The rains and frost also caused a loss in her potato production; she lost part of her potato crop. The entire community suffered from these circumstances.

For the aforementioned reasons, her economic stability has decreased, which has directly affected her ability to acquire the agricultural supplies she needs for her crops so she can feed and clothe her children. Placida is requesting the loan so she can buy potato seed and agricultural supplies in order to improve her finances and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seed and agricultural supplies so she can improve her finances and her family's quality of life

loans.name: Mayra Amparo

texts.es:
Mayra es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 22 años, vive en casa familiar con sus padres y sus hermanos, es soltera y no tiene hijos.
Actualmente trabaja  en una empresa, cosiendo prendas de vestir, lo hace desde hace 2 años  atrás es su único ingreso, con lo que ayuda a su familia en los gastos de hogar y sus propios gastos. Pero desea iniciar su propio negocio, se trata de un gabinete de belleza, es algo que le gusta hacer y además tiene el título de maestra en belleza, además tiene experiencia ya que ella corta el cabello a sus familiares y amigos  que viven cerca de su domicilio, también ofrece el servicio de manicure y pedicura, pero no cuenta con todos los materiales para poder brindar un buen servicio, ya que hasta hoy lo viene realizando solo en un cuarto de su domicilio, y como cada vez tiene más demanda desea tener su propio negocio y ofrecerles a sus clientes un buen servicio.
Vive en Gangotena que pertenece  a la ciudad de Atuntaqui, en la zona las personas se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura. Atuntaqui es muy reconocida por sus fábricas textiles y además por su plato típico que es la fritada.
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de un esterilizador, un sillón de peluquería, sillas, espejos, una máquina para depilar en cera, entre otros. El negocio a emprender lo aprendió en sus estudios y con la práctica con sus familiares y vecinos. Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Mayra is a hardworking young woman. She is 22 years old and lives in her family’s home with her parents and siblings. She is single and does not have children.

She currently works in a business sewing clothing garments. She has done this for the last two years and it is her only income, with which she helps her family with the household expenses and her own expenses. However, she wants to start her own business, which is a beauty salon. It is something that she likes to do and she also has a beauty degree and experience, since she cuts hair for her family and friends who live near her home. She also offers manicure and pedicure services, but she does not have all of the materials to be able to provide a good service, since to this day she has only been carrying it out in a room in her home. As she gets more demand, she wants to have her own business and offer her customers good service.

She lives in Gangotena, which belongs to the city of Atuntaqui. In the zone, people work raising animals and in agriculture. Atuntaqui is very well known for its textile fabrics and also for its traditional plate, which is the fritada.

She is going to invest the loan into buying a sterilizer, a hairdressing chair, chairs, mirrors, and a machine to remove hair by wax, among other things. She learned about the business in her studies and with practice with her family and neighbors. She is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the help provided.

loans.use: to launch her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily operates a motor transport business, a car wash, and a boarding house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 8,000.00 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales each day. In order to continue her business, Lily availed a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams of expanding her business and car wash service to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repair

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en: Gaudiosa is 55 years old, married, and has nine children. Two her children are school age and seven are adult age. She has a rice farm that she has been operating for 30 years. This enables her to send her children to school to finish their courses up to college. Gaudiosa is also a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC. Recently, she borrowed PHP 50,000 to purchase bags of fertilizer and bottles of pesticide.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and bottles of pesticide.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en: Almira is 51 years old, married, has five children who are of adult age and lives in Tambulig-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a full-fledged member of Paglaum MPC and had availed various loan products from the cooperative. Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase bags of fertilizer and pesticide. Almira is hopeful that she will have a good harvest this cropping season so that she can continuously provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 61 years old, married, has one child of adult age and lives in Dumingag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a farmer who owns and operates a rice field at her place. She earns PHP 50,000 per cropping period, which enables her to send her only child to school. Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is 31 years old and lives in Liloan, Bonifacio-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with two children who are of school age. Emelia has been engaged in managing a car radiator repair shop together with her husband as the repairman for five years already and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional bronze rods, flux, copper and other accessories and materials for their radiator repair shop business. Emelia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Emelia hopes to expand their radiator repair shop business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bronze rods, flux, copper and other accessories and materials.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 40 years old, married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Emely requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Emely has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Emely would like to save money to buy another boat for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en: Jefferson is 44 years old, married, has four school-age children and lives in Tambulig-Molave, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a furniture shop at his place. He is also a farmer antd tills his own farm during his vacant period. Jefferson is a member in good standing with the cooperative without records of default payments. Recently, he availed a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more wood for his furniture-making business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his furniture-making business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 44 years old and has six children. Rosemarie is married and has five children who are in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 7 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 48 years old and married with one child in school. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosita has been in this business for 13 years. 

In the future, Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO PROGRESO DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Luisa ella es soltera y tiene 28 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “NUEVO PROGRESO DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; This bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.

The member is Maria Luisa. She is single and 28 years old. She works in her grocery store business. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm. She has had this business for five years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. Maria Luisa requests the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The members that are pasted to the group photo had their photo taken after the meeting because they asked permission due to work reasons.

The other members work in candy sales, clothing sales, a grocery store business, and a bookstore business.

Maria Luisa is grateful to those who form part of this dream through these means, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Sorita

texts.en:
Sorita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sorita is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Sorita has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Sorita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to dried and sell.

Sorita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Sorita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Unice Joy

texts.en:
Unice Joy is 27 years old and has three children. Unice Joy is married and has three children who are in school.

Unice Joy is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Unice Joy requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Unice Joy has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 1 time in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Unice Joy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel works hard to support her family. Ritchel is married and runs a general store business in the Philippines.  She has been in business for the past 3 years.

Ritchel has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like chips, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as chips, soap, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 38 years old and is from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Emmanuel, a businessman, and has four children: One child is in high school, two are in the elementary level, and the youngest is not yet in school. Alma and her husband manage their household together and also partner to run her business. The earnings from her business are a great help in meeting her family's daily needs.

Alma buys fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since she assures their freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

She hopes that you will grant her a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy barrels of Milkfish. Alma has sold fish for the past four years. Business has been good, since Milkfish is a favorite among Filipinos for its sweet taste and low price.  She truly values her business because it's a good source of income to make ends meet and send her children to school.

Alma dreams of her business flourishing. She hopes she can save enough money to improve her family's house and send her children to college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. At these meetings, she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for barrels of Milkfish to sell

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Yoeun, 50, lives in Kampong Thom Province. She has only one child. To make a living, she prepares some Khmer food and corn for sale. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $2.50 per day. So far, she has been in this business for five years. 

She is applying for a Kiva loan now to buy a plot of land to build a house and a store. This loan will make a great contribution to improve her business and allow her to experience living in a proper house. She is thankful for all lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to build a house and a store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 49 years old and has four children. Victoria is married, and two of here children are in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Victoria has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 78 years old, widowed, has 3 children of adult age, and lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a member of Paglaum MPC. She is thankful to the cooperative because it is always there whenever she needs financial assistance for her business. Now that she is getting older, Anecita is grateful because she can ask for assistance to help pay for her medication. Currently, she avails a loan of 25,000 PHP to pay for for medical check-ups and to purchase maintenance medicine.

loans.use: to pay for medical check-ups and maintenance medicine

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is a 59-year-old married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Porferia has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Porferia requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy Nipa leaves and other supplies for her business.

Porferia has been in the weaving business for 10 years. In the future, Porferia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy Nipa leaves and other supplies for her weaving business

loans.name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 2 D

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Min (pictured center) is 37 years old, married, and supports a family of three (one child). He wants to send his child through school till graduation. He owns 5 acres of crop farm and a duck farm. 

Proximity's loan will let him purchase the necessary farming supplies. He hopes to expand his crop farm, boost his income, and buy his own farm machines. He also hopes to buy a boat so he can travel and sell throughout the whole village. 

Pictured above are the members from Hta Ni Pat Village Group 2 D, named Min, Hla, Tun, Ko and Thu. A CBO leader oversees the group, and the fund will help each member purchase fertilizer and crop seeds. 

Hta Ni Pat Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary farming supplies

borrowers.first_name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 2 D

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 30 years old. With two children who are in school, Rosie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Rosie has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Yesica Maribel

texts.es:
Yesica tiene 33 años, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su pequeño hijo de 5 años. Juntos habitan en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, una ciudad muy comercial y productiva.
Yesica es madre soltera, a pesar de no contar con el padre de su hijo ella ha salido adelante con la ayuda de sus padres, ahora tiene su propio negocio, se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos, relojes y carteras, además da el servicio de asesoría contable; cuenta ya con varios años de experiencia con  clientela fidelizada. Gracias a estos negocios ella ha podido sacar adelante a su hijo y apoyar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
Yesica es clienta nueva para la institución, con este crédito ella podrá comprar más mercadería para surtir el negocio como relojes, carteras y demás, así podrá  mejorar sus ingresos ya que está en la defensa de su tesis en la universidad y se le van a presentar más gastos, desea incrementar para solventarse y poder graduarse como profesional.
Está agradecida por el apoyo que le han dado, por la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio y terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Yesica is 33 years old. She lives in her parents’ home with her young, 5 year old son. They live together in the city of Santo Domingo, a very commercial and productive city. 

Yesica is a single mother. Despite not counting on the father of her son, she has moved forward with her parents’ help. She now has her own business. She works selling cosmetics, watches and purses. She also provides accounting services. She has several years of experience with loyal customers. Thanks to these jobs she has been able to move forward with her son and support her parents with the household expenses.

Yesica is a new client for the institution. With this credit she will be able to buy more merchandise to restock her business with watches, purses and more. That way she can improve her income since she is defending her thesis at her university and more expenses will present themselves. She wishes to improve by supporting herself and to be able to graduate as a professional.

She is thankful for the support given to her, for the opportunity to grow her business and to complete her higher education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her business. In this way she can improve her income and then complete her education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric and thread, and to maintain her sewing machine.

loans.name: Andrea Estefania

texts.es:
Andrea tiene 19 años, vive junto con su madre y sus hermanos. Se dedica al cuidado de un niño en San Antonio de Ibarra, solo lo hace en las tardes.
Vive en la Merced de Cobuendo, que pertenece a San Antonio de Ibarra, en el sector las personas se dedican a la crianza  de animales y también a la agricultura. San Antonio es un lugar muy conocido gracias a la oferta de artesanías, esculturas, muebles y otros realizados en madera por artesanos locales, por esta razón es visitado por turistas locales y nacionales.
Ella ayuda a su madre desde muy joven en el cuidado del galpón de pollos que ella tiene, y por lo que tiene mucha experiencia, es por eso que desea iniciar con el mismo negocio de su madre, además tiene tiempo para hacerlo, y le gusta mucho este negocio. Para el galpón de pollos Andrea comprara pollos de 15 días de nacidos, los cría para después venderlos. Los compradores conocen que en su domicilio se vende pollos y ellos se acercan a realizar la compra ahí.
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de pollos, balanceado, morochillo, comederos, bebederos para iniciar con su propio galpón de pollos y así tener mejores ingresos, para colaborar a su madre en el sustento del hogar.
Andrea está muy agradecida con KIVA por el apoyo para emprender su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea, 19, lives with her mother and siblings.  She takes care of a child in San Antonio de Ibarra in the afternoons.  She lives in Merced de Cobuendo which belongs to San Antonio de Ibarra.  People here work in livestock farming and agriculture.  San Antonio is very well-known for its crafts, sculptures, furniture and other wood crafts made by the locals.  Therefore it is visited by local and national tourists.

Since she was very young Andrea has been helping her mother raise chickens, so she has much experience and wants to start her own chicken business.  She has the time for it and is very familiar with the business.

For her chicken coop, Andrea will buy 15-day-old chicks which she will raise and then sell.  Buyers know that chickens are sold at her house which is where they go to make their purchases.

The loan will be used to buy chickens, balanced feed, corn, feeders and drinkers to start her own chicken business and earn more income to help her mother support the household.

Andrea is very grateful to KIVA for their support in starting her own business.

loans.use: To start a chicken business to earn more income to help her mother and siblings.

loans.name: Mateo Pumacahua Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Wilfredo tiene 46 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir  con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank "MATEO PUMACAHUA" which is located in the district of Chinchdero in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Wilfredo, 46, who has a common-law wife and son.  He alternates his daily activities with his grocery store business.  He has been in this activity for several years thanks to the hard work that he puts into it daily.  He wants to continue his business to keep supporting his family.

The loan he is requesting is to buy rice, sugar and other goods.

The members in general are grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and other goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Medardo Noe

texts.es: Medardo tiene 47 años de edad quien vive en casa propia junto a su familia es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a laborar como jornalero y además también se desempeña como albañil, gracias a su sueldo es como él logra salir adelante y suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Medardo desea hacer un mejoramiento en su vivienda el cual consiste en encementar el piso del corredor de su casa ya que actualmente es de tierra y en épocas de lluvia le genera problemas de insalubridad, pero debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente está solicitando este crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y grava  y así poder habitar en un hogar más digno.
texts.en:
Medardo is 47 and lives in a house of his own with his family.
A hard-working man who works as a day labourer, he also works in construction, and this is how he manages to stay afloat and provide for his family.
Medardo wants to improve his house by laying a concrete floor in the corridor. At the moment, the floor is earthen and therefore very unhygienic when it rains.
Since he does not have enough capital, he turned to FUSAI for a loan in order to buy cement, sand, and gravel, so as to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy materials to lay a cement floor.

loans.name: Maria Orfelina

texts.es:
