María Orfelia tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su nieto del cual se hace cargo, en el distrito de Pomahuaca la cual es una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes, alimentos, útiles de aseo, golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, entre otros para aumentar el stock de su negocio y con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Orfelia, 52, lives with her grandchild, whom she raises, in the district of Pomahuaca.
The area, blessed with a warm climate, sees its residents engage in farming, animal husbandry, and trade.
Pomahuaca is located in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.
María Orfelia has a small grocery shop at her house.
She asks for a loan in soles to buy more merchandise: food, personal hygiene products, candy, and soft drinks.
The goal is to increase her inventory and thus her income, so as to improve her standard of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Aitilla

texts.ru: Айтилла, 48 лет, вдова, 2 детей. У нее среднее образование. В настоящее время занимается сельским хозяйством. Айтилла с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. В хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 30 овец. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Айтилла направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Aitilla is 48 and a widow with two children. She has a high school education and is currently working as a farmer. She is very responsible about her work and currently has five cows and 30 sheep. She has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase livestock for breeding. She intends to put profits from the loan toward further developing her business and buying furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. 

PMPC came to Maria as a rescuer, lending her money when she needed it the most. Now she has availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. Maria perseveres and always believes she can reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: June

texts.en:
June is a businessman from Tambulig-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 42 years old, married and has expertise in selling and farming. He runs a mini-grocery store and earns an income that sufficiently supports his family. 

June is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now he has applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds. As a result, he will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. June continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the ardent passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds.

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
Gelita is 66 years old and married with six children. Gelita works very hard to provide for them.

Gelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care products.

Gelita has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care products.

loans.name: Amparita

texts.en:
Amparita is 61 years old and widowed with eight children. Amparita works very hard to provide for them.

Amparita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care products.

Amparita has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care products.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 28 years old and single.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Elena has been farming sugarcane for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa and root crops.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Mrs. Trang is 29 years old, married and has two children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard but lack of capital. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitatary latrine and she is able to repay the loan from hired labour and selling chickens, pigs, vegetables in her garden.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Samit

texts.en:
Samit lives in a remote area of Kampong Speu province’s Phnom Srouch district. She is 44-year-old and she is a mother of four children, only two of whom are in school. For her living, she does rice farming on four hectares farmland to support her family’s living condition for twenty-six years. Beside this, Samit is also a rice farmer and corn grower as well to supplement her income. 

This is the third loan cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid back her past loans successfully. The previous loans have helped her to improve her living standard. With this loan, she is going to use it to pay for her children’s school fee. She hopes this loan will help her children to continue their studying until graduate.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s school fees.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, chicken, noodles, coconut milk and eggs in a larger quantity

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to purchase paint, wood, nails, etc for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Ma. Cecelia has been in this business for 21 years. Ma. Cecelia earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase paint, wood, nails, etc for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment like fishing net, bamboo, plastic rope, etc for her fishing business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 19 years. Cecilia earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment like fishing net, bamboo, plastic rope, etc

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a remote area of Mondulkiri province, Kheng is a mother of a dependent child and her age is 47 years old. Nowadays, she grows potatoes and works on her co-villager’s farm for fee to support her family’s living. She has been with both businesses for ten years. The crops have grown not well and it is able to sell in a lower price than before are the main challenges for this business. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one cycle already and she has repaid back her past loan successfully. Kheng is the group leader of three members and she will manage her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and pay for labor fees to grow her crop well and gain more yields. She hopes that this loan will help to earn more income to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and pay for labor fees to grow her crop well and gain more yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle and their feed.

loans.name: Alexander Jonathan

texts.es:
Alexander, estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a que sus papás vivían en una situación de mucha pobreza y por eso siempre se dedico a trabajar; ahora está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Alexander, es empleado en una panadería desde hace 5 años, el trabajo lo aprendió por necesidad, ya que necesitaba una fuente de ingreso para poder sostener a su familia; el negocio donde trabaja está a 15 minutos caminando desde su casa.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar insumos y herramientas para iniciar su propia panadería.

Sus sueños son, tener su propia panadería y que sus hijos puedan estudiar para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Alexander went to school up to the sixth grade because his parents lives in a very impoverished situation and he always had to work. Now he is married and his spouse takes care of the home. 

Alexander has been an employee at a bread bakery for 5 years. He learned the work out of necessity because he needed a source of income to support his family. The business where he works is 15 minutes away from his house on foot.

The loan will be used to buy ingredients and tools to start his own bread bakery.

His dream is to have his own bread bakery and for his children to go to school so they can graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and tools to start his own bread bakery.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia de 42 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad a lado de su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad. Sonia desde hace varios años se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos en casa particular y gracias al sueldo que percibe es como ella logra solventar los gastos del hogar. Sonia con la intención de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder cambiar el techo de la vivienda el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones y en tiempos de lluvia le presenta filtraciones que dañan sus pocas pertenencias materiales. Por lo anterior con el monto otorgado comprara: lamina, polines y pines para poder cambiar el techo lo antes posible y así brindar a su familia toda la protección posible.
texts.en: Sonia is 42  years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and their 2 children, aged 6 and 3. For several years, Sonia has worked providing domestic services in a private home and thanks to her salary she is able to pay for the household expenses. In order to improve her living conditions, Sonia has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to change the roof on her house, which is in poor condition. When it rains, water leaks in and damages her few material belongings. To do this, she will buy sheeting, rods and pins to change the roof as soon as possible and thus offer her family all possible protection.

loans.use: to buy sheeting, rods and pins to be able to change the roof.

loans.name: Idalides

texts.es: Idalides de 41 años, es una ama de casa domiciliada en un barrio del municipio de Arjona en el Departamento de Bolívar,  ella es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad que necesitan mucho de su amor y cuidado, sin embargo su creatividad y habilidad para los negocios le permitieron elaborar y comercializar desde la comodidad de su hogar pasteles de carne y pollo y pasabocas.  Hoy en día cuenta con 10 años de experiencia y una clientela que cada vez es mayor a quienes también les ofrece productos para uso personal por intermedio de un catálogo.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para abastecerse de víveres y comprar una estufa industrial.  Esta inversión le permitirá elaborar sus pasteles y pasabocas más ágilmente. Su meta a largo plazo es adquirir su casa propia y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Idalides is 41 years old and is a homemaker living in a neighborhood of Arjona, located in the department of Bolívar. She is the mother of four minor children who need her love and care very much. Nevertheless, her creativity and talent for business have allowed her to prepare and to market meat and chicken pies and pasabocas (tasty snacks) from the comfort of her home. She now has ten years of experience and an ever-growing clientele, to whom she also offers personal use products from a catalog. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to stock up on supplies and to buy an industrial stove. This investment will allow her to make her pies and pasabocas more quickly. Her long-term goals are to buy her own house and to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to stock up on supplies and to buy an industrial stove.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun, 61, is a farmer living in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province and a married mother of five children. Growing rice and cassava has been her main businesses for 30 years. Meanwhile she is making a kind of traditional Khmer food, a roll made of hashed meat, wrapped and cooked in banana leaves, called “Sang Vak” to sell in order to earn supplementary income. 

Recently, her cassava crop has brought her less income than before because there is a decline in the price of the crops on the market and her crop produces outputs that are lower than expected.

Chhun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for eight cycles already. The past loan, which was repaid back successfully, has enabled her to buy household supplies and provide family members with sufficient healthy food. By the way, this time she is applying for a loan to build a proper house so that her family can live comfortably. She hopes to earn more income from her growing business to improve her standard of living so it is much better than before.

loans.use: to build a proper house so that her family can live comfortably.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Marilyn has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. 

Recently she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 83 years old. She is a widow with 6 children who lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. 

She is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC where she avails herself of all services it offers to members like her. Recently, she took a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and purchase of maintenance medicines.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a businesswoman from Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 24 years old, single and has anexpertise in selling. 

She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her parents. Janeth is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Janeth continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Sar is a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and the other one is too young to attend school. 

To make a living, she grows paddy rice and sells fish at the market nearby her house. She has been in these two businesses for eight years already. 

Now she cannot manage to sell as much fish as she did before and the income she earns is getting lower. Sar has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a cycle already and she fully repaid her past loan. The previous loan was really helpful to her as it enabled her to better support her family’s needs and children’s studies. 

She is now applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to repair the broken agricultural tools and to buy fish for resale. She hopes that the businesses will grow well and they earn her good income to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to repair the broken agricultural tools and to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Katherine Liseth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 21 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Katherine, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada pero aun no tiene hijos. Su marido  maestro contratista.
Doña Katherine es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar,  ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella sale a visitar a sus clientes  en cualquier momento que este desocupada, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva 4 años en este negocio el cual lo comenzó con el primer crédito y está muy contenta y agradecida ya que así  le permiten ganarse algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios como la atención médica que le dan en la fundación. Sus sueños son tener su primer bebé.
texts.en:
The 21 de Octubre loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial history and for its crafts which are known at a national and international level. It is the home of the famous "Panama" hats. 

Katherine lives in this place. She is 24 years old and married, but does not have any children yet. Her husband is a contracted teacher. 

Katherine is a woman who likes to work to cover some household expenses. She works in sales; she sells all sorts of clothing and she sells from door to door. She goes out to visit her customers at any time that she is not busy, she leaves her merchandise on credit and collects every two weeks. She has been in this business for 4 years, which she began with her first loan and is very happy and grateful since it has allowed her to earn something herself.

This loan is to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in the loan group for 4 years and she likes it for the benefits, such as medical attention, which the foundation provides. Her dream is to have her first baby.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Bovel district of Battambang province, Yen, 62, is a married mother of six children. To make a living, she grows rice as her primary source of income. She has been in this job for 10 years. Moreover, she sells grocery items to supplement her income. 

She lacks capital to support her rice farming business. Thus, she has formed a group of three members to take out a loan. This is her first time working with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, Yen will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds, organic fertilizers and organic pesticide, which are expected to help enrich the soil and prevent pests. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living standard and support her children’s studying.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, organic fertilizers, and organic pesticide

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 21 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive don Carlos, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 18 y de 3 meses de edad, también tiene dos hijos de una relación anterior de 4 y 3 años los mismos que viven con la mamá pero también depende de él. Su mujer es ama de casa.
El señor Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta salir adelante gracias a lo que él sabe, el  tiene un taller de  ebanistería, allí fabrica mueble de toda clase y todo lo que se pueda realizar con la madera, elabora sus obras por pedidos de sus clientes que saben del buen trabajo que realiza, el también entrega a ciertos lugares donde los venden al publico pero esto muy poco ya que mas trabaja por pedidos directamente con sus clientes, el lleva más de 15 años con esta actividad la cual le sirve para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pinturas y otros materiales para fabricar sus muebles. Lleva 3 ciclos en el grupo de crédito y le gusta la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener siempre trabajo y que no les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 21 de Octubre loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial history and for its crafts which are known at a national and international level. It is the home of the famous "Panama" hats. 

Carlos lives in this place. He is 32 years old, in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has two children, 18 and 3 months old. He also has two children from a previous relationship, ages 4 and 3, who live with their mother but also depend on him. His wife is a homemaker.

Carlos is a very hard-working man who likes to get ahead thanks to what he knows, in a furniture-making shop. There, he makes all sorts of furniture and everything that can be made from wood. He makes his products to his customers' orders, who know the good work he does. He also delivers to certain places where they sell to the public, but this is very little, since mostly he works by direct order from his customers. He has been doing this work for more than 15 years which serves him to get ahead.

The loan is to purchase wood, paint, and other materials to make furniture. He has been in the loan group for 3 loan cycles and he likes it because of the help he gets with the loans. His dreams are to always have work and that his children don't lack for anything.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint, and other materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Munojot

texts.en:
Munojot is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She lives in a big city with her family. She is divorced and has two children. She is a worker at a supermarket as a trade official. She does her job very well and is satisfied. She is a responsible, gentle, and patient person. 

Her teeth are hurting. She needs the services of a dentist. She is asking for financial support from IMON and Kiva lenders to treat her teeth at a dental clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her teeth at a dental clinic

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал, 36 лет, не замужем, есть 2 детей. У нее среднее образование. На протяжении 6 лет занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 8,900 сом (KGS). Нуржамал решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для дальнейшего разведения. Свои доходы Нуржамал планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий ее семьи.
texts.en: Nurzhamal is 36, unmarried, and has two children. She has a high school education and has been raising livestock for six years. She has two cows and fifteen sheep on her farm and her monthly income is 8,900 som (KGS). Nurzhamal decided to apply for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock for breeding. She plans to invest her income in developing her business and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Guignia Esmerida

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 21 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Esmerida, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su marido es albañil. 
Doña Esmerida es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para colaborar con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, aguas, colas, helados y cervezas, trabaja todos los días y en ocasiones su esposo le ayuda con el negocio, lleva más de 8 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida honradamente.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, colas, aguas, helados y otros productos. Está desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos se ayuda para mejorar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir cada vez mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The 21 de Octubre loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial history and for its crafts which are known at a national and international level. It is the home of the famous "Panama" hats. 

Esmerida lives in this place. She is 49 years old, married, and from this relationship has four adult children. One of them still lives with her. Her husband is a construction worker.

Esmerida is a woman who likes to work to help with the household expenses. She has a grocery store in her house. There, she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, water, soft drinks, ice creams, and beer. She works every day and sometimes her husband helps her with the business. She has had this business for more than 8 years, which allows her to make an honest living.

This loan will be used to stock her store more. She will purchase rice, sugar, soft drinks, water, ice creams and other products. She has been in the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because with the loans, she helps herself to improve the business. Her dream is to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soft drinks, water, ice creams, etc.

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 21 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 4 años la cual está en jardín de infantes. Su marido es albañil. 
Doña Johanna es una mujer que  le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante su hogar y a su hija ya que lo que hace su marido no alcanza, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres días por semana y también vende en su casa, ella aprovecha las horas de la mañana que su pequeña esta en el jardín ya que ahí se le hace más fácil salir a vender, deja a crédito y cobran cada ocho  días, es 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad la cual la mejora con la ayuda de los créditos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otras prendas. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The 21 de Octubre loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial history and for its crafts which are known at a national and international level. It is the home of the famous "Panama" hats. 

Johanna lives in this place. She is 20 years old, married, and from this relationship has a 4-year-old daughter who is in preschool. Her husband is a construction worker.

Johanna is a woman who likes to work to get her household and daughter ahead since what her husband makes is not enough. She works in sales, she sells all sorts of clothing and she sells from door to door. She goes out three days per week and also sells from her house. She takes advantage of the morning hours since her little one is in preschool then and that makes it easier to go out and sell. She leaves the products on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this work for one year, which she improves with the help of the loans. 

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and other clothing. She has been in the loan group for 4 loan cycles and she likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dream is to give her daughter the best.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts and other clothing.

loans.name: Liliana Cecibel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 21 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y de 1  años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su marido es albañil. 
Doña Liliana es una mujer que  le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y la crianza de sus pequeños, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas de catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres días por semana y también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le da algo que les ayuda a salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en su trabajo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y zapatillas de catalogo. Lleva 14 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 21 de Octubre loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial history and for its crafts which are known at a national and international level. It is the home of the famous "Panama" hats. 

Liliana lives in this place. She is 25 years old, married, and from this relationship has two children, ages 8 and 1. The older one goes to school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Liliana is a woman who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses and raising their little ones. She works in sales, selling all sorts of clothing and sandals from catalogs. She sells from door to door. She goes out three days per week and also sells in her house. She leaves the items on credit and collects weekly. She has been doing this work for 3 years, which gives her something that helps them get ahead since her husband doesn't earn much in his work.

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and sandals from catalogs. She has been in the loan group for 14 loan cycles and she likes it because the loans help her get ahead. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts and sandals.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun is a farmer living in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is a 46-year-old mother of two children. She has been growing rice as the main source of her income for 25 years already. In order to earn additional income, she also raises pigs. Her rice crop has been destroyed by insects, which has created a serious problem for her farming business. This has reduced her yield so that she only earns about 31,100 KHR per day to support her family. 

Sokun is leading a group of two members to take out a new loan. This will be her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid her past loan. The previous loan helped her to earn a good income to improve her living conditions and to better support the family’s needs. Sokun, the group leader, will use her loan portion to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizers to increase the crop products. She will also use part of her loan to buy pig feed. She hopes to earn more income to improve her family's standard of living even more.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizers, as well as pig feed

loans.name: Upendo Oysterbay Group

texts.en:
Lydia is in her late 30s, single, and has one child.  She has been selling charcoal for two years and works from 8 AM to 9.30 PM daily. She earns a small monthly profit.

Lydia requested her twenty second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her charcoal stock and to start selling fabrics. She used the profit to take care of her child and herself, to repay loan, and to cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal  and to increase her fabrics stock.  She dreams of building her own house.

Lydia will share this loan with her loan group Upendo Oysterbay, which consist of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell and to increase fabrics stock.

loans.name: Sreyourn's Group

texts.en:
Sreyourn, 29, who is a farmer living in Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, is a married mother of two dependent children who are underage for school. She has been growing cassava for seven years to earn the main source of family’s income. Sometimes, she works as a paid worker to earn supplementary income. 

Now, she lacks capital to support her business. Sreyourn is requesting a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which is the second time for her. The past loan, which she fully repaid back, has benefited her to renovate her house to be more comfortable. Anyway, the new loan that she is leading a three-member group to get will be used to pay for the plowing fee and buy organic fertilizers to enhance the productivity of her crop. She hopes to earn more income to improve her family's living and ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and buy organic fertilizers to enhance the productivity of the crop.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar de 39 años de edad se dedica a producir café con diferentes sellos de certificación como ser: comercio justo y Rain Forest el cual comercializa atreves de COCAFCAL de la cual es asociado, Oscar está casado con Zoila Esperanza  ya llevan 5 años juntos y tienen un hijo de 4 años, Ello luchan por mantener sus cafetales que son azotados fuertemente por las plagas, Oscar quiere mejorar sus cultivos y que sean del todo orgánicos para poder comercializar su café a un mejor precio y cuidar la biodiversidad de sus parcelas para darle en todo sentido una mejor calidad de vida a su familia la cual es su motivación para luchar cada día, está muy interesado en la producción orgánica para no dañar la naturaleza ya que piensa que hay que conservar la belleza de nuestras hermosas montañas para el futuro de sus hijos.
Con el crédito Oscar piensa replantar las parcelas que están más dañadas y darle el proceso de certificación orgánica desde el inicio a la plantación.
La certificación le permitirá incrementar su producción y obtener mejores ganancias para cambiar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar, 39 years old, works producing coffee under various certification seals such as fair trade and Rain Forest, which sells through COCAFCAL, of which he is a member. Oscar is married to Zoila Esperanza, they have been together for 5 years now and have a 4-year-old son. They struggle to maintain their coffee crop which is heavily battered by pests. Oscar wants to improve his crops and make them all organic to be able to sell his coffee at a better price and care for the biodiversity on his land to give his family, which is his motivation to struggle each day, a better quality of life in all ways. He is very interested in organic production so as not to damage nature since he believes that he has to conserve the beauty of our lovely mountains for the future of his children.

With the loan, Oscar plans to replant his plots which are most damaged and give them the organic certification process from the beginning of planting. The certification will allow him to increase his production and get better earnings, to change his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase organic coffee plants, organic fertilizer, organic pesticide, and other materials needed to convert his coffee crops to organic production.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La prestataria tiene 61 años y ha criado sola a 5 hijos, ya adultos. Hace 10 años que se dedica a la venta de frutas. En 2009, el menor de sus hijos enfermó gravemente, pero afortunadamente, recibió el tratamiento adecuado y apoyo de la organización Socios En Salud (SES) para recuperarse. En 2014 la prestataria recibió un préstamo para comprar insumos e incrementar sus ventas. Sus ganancias le permitieron mejorar la construcción de su casa. Ahora, después de haber pagado su préstamo en total, la prestataria quisiera un segundo préstamo para abastecerse de mercadería por varios días y tener mayor libertado para rotar sus puntos de venta de frutas.
texts.en:
The borrower, age 61, has raised five children, who are now adults, by herself. She has been selling fruit for ten years.

In 2009 her youngest child became gravely ill. Fortunately, the child received adequate treatment to recover and support from the 'Socios En Salud' (SES) [Partners in Health] organization.

In 2014 the borrower received a loan to buy supplies and increase her sales. Her earnings allowed her to improve the construction of her house.

Now, after having completely repaid her loan, the borrower would like a second loan to stock up on merchandise for several days. This way she will have a greater freedom to rotate where she sells the fruit.

loans.use: to buy more fruit for her stand.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Zulfiya is very pleased by getting loan; she has purchased a few livestock and on account of its milk provides her family. By increasing the head of livestock she got benefit. Also she commends her gratitude to Kiva lenders who supported her in difficult times. Zulfiya would like again to get a loan in order to purchase two calves yet, since she sold her cows. The profit that she received from the sale of cattle, part of she spent on the family expenses. In this time Zulfiya also hopes for your generosity and assistance. She loves her activity and does not want to lose it.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is very pleased by getting a loan; she has purchased a few livestock and on account of their milk, provides for her family. By increasing the head of livestock she got benefit. Also, she extends her gratitude to Kiva lenders who supported her in difficult times.

Zulfiya would like again to get a loan in order to purchase two calves, since she sold her cows. With the profit that she received from the sale of the cattle, part of it she spent on the family expenses. 

At this time Zulfiya also hopes for your generosity and assistance. She loves her activity and does not want to lose it.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Francis Edgardo

texts.es:
Francis es un agricultor de 35 años de edad dedicado especialmente a la producción de café el cual forma principal fuente de subsistencia, Francis Tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad bajo su cargo, Francis tiene más de 16 años de experiencia en la producción de café el cual comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, con las ganancias de su café el sostiene las necesidades de su familia, El quiere poder formar un pequeño patrimonio para el futuro de su hija.
Francis está interesado en entrar al programa de manejo y producción orgánica dirigido por COCAFCAL primeramente porque de esta manera asegura un mejor mercado para su café y además hace de su cafetal un cultivo más sostenible y amigable con el ambiente. 
Francis solicita un crédito para poder llevar a cabo los trabajos necesarios en la conversión a orgánico de su cafetal con las ganancias obtenidas por su café Francis tendrá más posibilidades de brindarle una educación de calidad a su hijo. 
Un préstamo ayudara a Francis a tener mejores mercados por su café por lo tanto a obtener mejores ganancias lo que le permitirá una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, además de brindarle una oportunidad para ofrecer mejores oportunidades educativas a su hijo.
texts.en:
Francis is a 35-year-old farmer who works specifically in coffee production, which forms his primary source of subsistence. Francis has a 6-year-old child in his care. Francis has more than 16 years of experience in coffee production which he sells through COCAFCAL, of which he is a member. With the earnings from his coffee, he covers his family's needs. He wants to be able to make a small legacy for his daughter's future. 

Francis is interested in entering the organic management and production program run by COCAFCAL, primarily because in this way he assures a better market for his coffee, and in addition he makes his coffee crop a more sustainable cultivation and environmentally friendly.

Francis asks for a loan to be able to carry out the necessary work for conversion to organic for his coffee crop. With the earnings he gets from his coffee, Francis will have more possibilities to offer his child a quality education.

A loan will help Francis have better markets for his coffee and to get more earnings which will allow his family a better quality of life, in addition to providing him an opportunity to offer better educational opportunities to his child.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers, organic insecticides, organic pesticides and other materials need to convert his coffee crop to organic.

loans.name: Penh's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kam Rieng distrit of Battambang province, Penh, 49, is a married mother of five children, three of whom are dependent on her. There is a child who is in school and needs better support for studying. 

She has been growing cassava as the main source of income for 10 years. She sometimes works on her co-villager's farm for a fee to earn supplementary income to support her family. 

Now, she lacks capital to support the cassava business; she leads a two-member group to apply for a new loan, which is the second time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan was completely repaid, and it enabled her to renovate and make her house more comfortable than before. 

Now, as the group leader, she will use her loan to pay for the plowing fees and buy organic fertilizers to increase the productivity of crop. She hopes to earn more income to renovate her house much better so that she can keep her family members healthy.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fees and buy organic fertilizers to increase the productivity of her crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of varieties of rice for her son's rice wholesale business.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a 35-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her family is poor, passing their lives hand to mouth.

Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies' and gent’s clothes. He has been running this business since 1994. It is his misfortune that he could not built up a good relationship among his customers, and this is the reason he could not better establish his enterprise.

Now, with the increase in their needs, she considers it necessary that the business should grow also. But the lack of capital is the major problem for her husband.

Therefore, Irshad took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan, her husband will purchase more varieties of clothes to sell.

Irshad thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Irshad is standing with raised hand in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes for her husband's clothing shop.

loans.name: Manuel Ardulfo

texts.en:
Manuel Ardulfo is a 47-year-old farmer who works growing coffee under various certifications such as fair trade and organic. Ardulfo has more than 27 years of experience in coffee production and 7 years working with coffee certified through COCAFCAL, of which he is a member. Ardulfo is married to Deisy Marina with whom he has three children, ages 15, 12, and 7. Ardulfo and Deisy work daily to be able to get their children ahead. They dream of their children being able to access a quality education and, above all, that they can have the quality of life they deserve. 

Currently, Ardulfo wants to convert his coffee crop to organic production. Organic products are a new concept in the region and they assure a good market for the coffee. Ardulfo wants to take advantage of his coffee plants being in terrible condition to replace them and start the seal with a completely new planting. 

Ardulfo asks for a loan to convert his parcel of coffee to organic production which will allow him to have more earnings for his coffee, in addition to an assured market for his harvest. With the earnings from his coffee, he hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

A loan will help Ardulfo to have more earnings for his coffee in addition to giving him the option of offering his children more opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer, organic insecticides and pesticides, purchase coffee plants and other materials needed to convert his coffee crop to organic.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
Zebo is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1996. She is living in a village with her family. She is married to a constructor.

She is a tailor. She sews traditional women's clothing. She is well known and has regular clients. She already has two years of experience serving women with beautiful dresses.

Her father is a pensioner. He is old and sick. Zebo is a careful daughter and wants to treat her father. But she has not enough money to pay for her father’s treatment. She appealed to IMON and asked a loan to treat her father at hospital. She hopes to be understood and supported.

loans.use: to treat her father at hospital

loans.name: Calle Santander 1 Panajachel Group

texts.es:
Linda es una mujer casada de 23 años de edad, ella vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Sololá, Linda tiene tres hijos de las edades entre 1 y 3 años.
Linda (en la fotografía es la que aparece de ultimo al lado derecho de la foto) es una mujer que lucha cada día para apoyar a su familia, pues desde hace dos años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, le gusta hacer esta actividad ya que lo hace desde la plaza de su comunidad, y esto le permite también realizar los oficios de su casa y cuidar de sus hijos con esta actividad ella contribuye con su esposo en complementar algunos gastos.
Linda con el afán de seguir comprando  y vendiendo ropa típica, ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, con este dinero ella estará comprando güipiles, cortes, fajas, y todo lo relacionado con la línea de ropa. Linda tiene el sueño de comprar más terreno para que sus hijos cuenten done construir sus casa.
texts.en: Linda is a married 23 year old woman. She lives with her family in a community of Solola. Linda has three children who are between 1 and 3 years of age. Linda (on the photograph the last one on the right side of the photo) is a woman who works hard every day to support her family, because for two years she has worked buying and selling native clothing. She likes this activity because she can work at the square of her town, and this allows her to work at home in household chores and take care of her children. She helps her husband with some expenses. In order to continue buying and selling native clothing, Linda is requesting a loan to invest in her business. With this money she will buy güipiles (traditional tunics), fabric cuts, woven belts and everything related to the clothing line. Linda has the dream of buying more land so that her children can build their houses.

loans.use: to buy güipiles (traditional tunics), fabric cuts, woven belts.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 39-year-old, poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good, and their living standards seem not fit for human beings. She wants to establish her house and change the living standards of her family. Her whole family depends upon a single earning person. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw, which is their single source of income. 

She wants to buy an additional rickshaw for her son, as well. He wants to assemble a new auto rickshaw from a maker. He has collected almost the full amount but is short of the total. 

Therefore, Shahida wants to receive a loan for her son so he can buy his own auto rickshaw. In this way, she will encourage her son so that he can drive his new rickshaw and can generate income for her family. 

Shahida hopes that her son will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Eulalia Martha

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 21 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Eulalia, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 11, 9, 2 y 3 meses la menor, los dos  mayores  estudian en escuela. Su marido  trabaja en el municipio local.
Doña Eulalia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para cubrir los gastos que demandan el hogar y la crianza de sus hijos, ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa, allí el vende bebidas como gaseosas, aguas, cervezas y bocadillos de picar, son muchas las personas que llegan hasta su local a conversar y distraerse un rato y consumir lo que ella vende, los días que más vende son los fines de semana y es cuando más ganancias le quedan, lleva más de 3 años con esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito es para comprar agua, colas, cervezas y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella se ayuda mucho. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
En la foto está la socia con su hija.
texts.en:
The 21 de Octubre loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial history and for its crafts which are known at a national and international level. It is the home of the famous "Panama" hats. 

Eulalia lives in this place. She is 29 years old and from this relationship has four children, ages 11, 9, 2, and the youngest is 3 months old. The two older ones go to school. Her husband works in the local government.

Eulalia is a woman who likes to work to cover the expenses required by her household and in raising her children. She has a small business in her house, there she sells drinks such as soft drinks, water, beer, and snacks. Many people come to the place to chat and entertain themselves for a while and to consume what she sells. The days she sells the most are the weekends and this is when she gets the most earnings. She has been doing this work for more than 3 years, which allows her to earn something herself.

This loan is to purchase water, soft drinks, beer and all that she sells. She has been in the loan group for more than 2 years and she likes it because, with the loans, she helps herself a lot. Her dream is that her children get a good education. With the member in the photo is her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase water, soft drinks, beer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El prestatario, de 48 años, está casado y tiene 5 hijos. Trabaja desde muy joven, y ha trabajado como ayudante de construcción y ayudante de cocina antes de tener su propio negocio de venta de comidas. Desde hace varios años que ha seguido tratamientos para una enfermedad compleja. Finalmente, con el apoyo de Socios En Salud (SES), logró curarse. Al poco tiempo, su hijo de 16 años también fue diagnosticado, por lo que SES le ha brindado apoyo nutricional, clínico, económico y socio-emocional. Su hijo también se ha recuperado. 
Desde hace varios años, el prestatario forma para del programa de Generación de Ingresos de SES. Ha utilizado dos préstamos recibidos para la compra de artefactos de cocina para un negocio de venta de comida desde su casa. Ya que el negocio ha ido bien, ha podido alquilar un local donde tiene clientela estable. Se trata de un negocio familiar en el que su esposa administra los ingresos y sus hijos apoyan en la cocina. Sus ingresos han logrado que el prestatario pueda pagar los estudios superiores de sus hijos y construir su casa. Ahora le gustaría implementar seis cuartos para alquiler por lo que le gustaría solicitar un préstamo para comprar materiales y completar las ventanas y los baños de esas habitaciones. De esta manera, además del servicio de restaurante, tendrá un servicio de hospedaje.
texts.en:
The borrower, age 48, is married and has five children. He has worked ever since he was very young. He has worked as an assistant in construction and as a kitchen helper before having his own business of selling food.

Several years ago he received treatments for a complicated disease. Finally, with the support of ‘Socios En Salud’ (SES) [ Partners in Health], he managed to get better. After a little while, his 16 year old son was also diagnosed. That is why SES has provided him with nutritional, clinical, financial, and socio-emotional support. His son has also recovered.

The borrower has been part of the SES program for the Generation of Income for several years. He has used two loans that he received to buy kitchen items for a business of selling food from his house. Because the business has gone well, he has been able to rent a place where he has regular customers.

It is a family business in which his wife manages the earnings and his children help in the kitchen. With his earnings the borrower has managed to be able to pay for his children’s higher education and to build a house.

He would now like to set up six rooms to rent. Therefore, he would like to request a loan to buy materials and to finish the windows and the bathrooms in these rooms. This way, in addition to the restaurant service, he will have lodging services.

loans.use: to set up rooms to rent.

loans.name: Ahsan Group

texts.en:
Ahsan is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family. Her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life.

Her husband owns an un-stitched clothing business, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently, he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that Ahsan is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs.

He will put a side some of the profit as savings to pay the electricity and gas bill. Ahsan hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's clothing shop.

loans.name: Moises David

texts.es:
Moisés David es un productor de café de 47 años está casado con Rosalina con quien tiene 3 hijos menores de 15 años el cultiva café hace ya más de 12 años y es su principal medio de subsistencia, actualmente el cultiva café bajo distintos sellos de certificación como ser comercio justo y Rain forest el cual comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, las ganancias sirven para mantener las necesidades de su familia , Moisés sueña con darles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades en cuanto a educación y calidad de vida.
Moisés quiere convertir sus cafetales a producción orgánica lo que le dará mejores oportunidades de mercado para sus cafés además de ayudar a hacer sus cafetales más sostenibles y amigables con el ambiente, la producción de cafés orgánicos es una nueva práctica en la región y es muy novedosa ya que ayuda a obtener mejores precios por café además de ayudar a conservar la riqueza natural de la región. 
Actualmente Moisés solicita un crédito para convertir sus cafetales a producción orgánica y aprovechando que sus cafetales están en mal estado por las plagas renovara el cafetal e iniciara la certificación con los cafetales totalmente nuevos.
Un crédito le ayudara a Moisés a convertir sus cafetales a producción orgánica lo que le dará mejores índices de producción, mejores ganancias por el café y los importante convertirá su cultivo en un cultivo 100 amigable con el ambiente.
texts.en:
Moisés David is a 47-year-old coffee producer who is married to Rosalina with whom he has 3 children younger than age 15.  He has grown coffee now for more than 12 years and it is his principal means of subsistence. Currently he grows coffee under various certification seals such as fair trade and Rain Forest, which he sells through COCAFCAL, of which he is a member. The earnings allow him to maintain his family's needs. Moisés dreams of giving his children better opportunities of education and quality of life. 

Moisés wants to convert his coffee crops to organic production which will give him better market opportunities for his coffee in addition to helping make his coffee plants more sustainable and environmentally friendly. Organic coffee production is a new practice in the region and it is very novel since it helps to get better prices for coffee in addition to helping conserve the natural resources of the region. 

Currently, Moisés asks for a loan to convert his coffee crop to organic production and, taking advantage of his coffee plants being in bad condition due to pests, he will replace his coffee crop and begin the certification with totally new coffee plants. 

A loan will help Moisés to convert his coffee plants to organic production which will give him better production indices, increased earnings for the coffee, and most importantly will convert his crop to a 100% environmentally friendly crop.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer, organic insecticides and pesticides, coffee plants, and other materials needed to convert his coffee crop to organic.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas es un grupo nuevo, que se formó con la unión de varias amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Itá, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rita, quien se dedica a vender carbón, ella por medio de su humilde trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna y tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carbón en cantidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo para ayudar a sus familiares.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas group is a new group. The group was formed by the union of several friends and neighbors in the city Itá. They are in the elimination of poverty program. They are struggling in order to be able to improve their living conditions.

Rita is one of the members. She sells charcoal. It is through this humble work that she earns a living in a decent way and has the means to be able to help her family and her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy charcoal in bulk. This way she will be able to continue with her sales as she is doing in order to help her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresita  es una persona muy trabajadora, trabajó más de 20 años como capataz de una estancia acompañada de su  marido, gracias a ese sacrificio pudo darle una vivienda digna y posibilidad de estudiar a sus hijos. 
Hoy  se encuentra viviendo en su casa en compañía de su nieta  realizando la actividad de cría de animales de corral y vacunos, a la vez están realizando faenamiento de animales vacunos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que siempre se ha esforzado y que lucha siempre.
Necesita el préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales, para la faena y venta. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Teresita is a very hard-working person. She worked for more than 20 years as a foreman on a ranch accompanied by her husband. Thanks to this sacrifice, she could provide her children with a dignified house and the possibility of education.

Today she is living in her house with her granddaughter, raising small animals and cows, while also working with the cattle. She is a very hard-working and determined woman who always has worked hard and who always struggles.

She needs the loan to purchase a larger quantity of animals for work and sale. She is grateful for this opportunity which she gets to be able to improve each day.

loans.use: to purchase animals to work and sell.

loans.name: Muazam

texts.en:
Muazam is a careful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is married to Olim and they have one child.

She is a cook. She has experience working at kindergarten. Since 2013 she has been cooking at a caterer called “SOMON.” She cooks delicious and tasty meals. She is well known and has regular clients. She tries her best to earn money and ensure her family.

Her husband does not work. He is sick and needs treatment. She appealed to IMON to get a loan to treat her husband in a medical clinic. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to treat her husband in a medical clinic.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 42-year-old married mother of five children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Irshad owns a small business selling ladies' ready-made garments from home. She purchases cloth from the market at a low price, sews it and sells it for higher prices in her community. The ladies of town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because people are demanding clothes related to summer weather.

Her husband meets all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings.

She has requested a loan so that she can buy more varieties of cloth for sewing into garments so she can fulfill the demand. Irshad wishes for the bright future of her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy variety of cloth for sewing then reselling to the hometown ladies.

loans.name: Anelfa

texts.en:
Anelfa is 41 years old and married with one child. Anelfa works very hard to provide for her family.

Anelfa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Anelfa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la ciudad de Carapeguá, es un grupo unido, donde todas ponen lo mejor de sí para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo y lucha en conjunto.
La Sra. Maria se siente agradecida e inspirada mediante el programa de comité de mujeres, por medio de las capacitaciones ella pudo trabajar en ventas de ropas, calzados que hace de forma ambulante y mediante eso ella pudo mejorar su calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas y calzados para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de mejorar.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Carapeguá, it is a close-knit group, where they all put their best into being able to help their loved ones through their work and struggle together.

Maria is grateful for and inspired by the women's committee program. Through the training, she was able to work in clothing and footwear sales which she does as a street vendor, and through this she was able to improve her quality of life.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of clothing and footwear to sell, so to be able to continue with her sales and satisfy her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to improve.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing and footwear for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras está luchando para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una de las integrantes, ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ser alguien en la vida.
La Sra. Perla es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, hasta tarde en la noche, es una mujer muy luchadora que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder surtir su despensa con bebidas, verduras, frutas, lácteos,  y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras group is struggling to be able to improve the living conditions of each of the members. They are putting forth their best effort to be someone in life.

Perla is a very hard-working and determined woman who has worked hard to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She has a store in which she works every day from very early in the morning until very late at  night. She is a very determined woman who works hard to be able to get ahead.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase supplies to be able to stock her store with drinks, vegetables, fruits, dairy products, and more, so as to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, vegetables, fruits, dairy products and more to stock her store.

loans.name: Willian Ufredo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 21 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive don Willian, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su mujer es comerciante.
El señor Willian trabaja como guardia de seguridad, pero realiza el crédito para que su mujer lo utilice en su labor, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale dos o tres días por semana  más que todo en las mañanas y fines de semana, en estos días el la acompaña ya que es cuando realiza los cobros, ella deja a crédito y cobra coda 8 días, ella lleva varios años realizando esta labor para sacar adelante su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
The loan group 21 De Octubre meets every other week in Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisan crafts that are recognized nationally and internationally. It’s home to the famous toquilla straw hats. Here lives Willian. He is 30 years old, has a common-law relationship, and in this relationship he has two children 5 and 2 years old. The oldest attends school. 
His partner is a merchant. Willian works as a security guard but is taking out a loan for his partner to use in her work. She works in commerce, selling all types of clothing door to door. She works two or three days a week, mostly in the mornings and weekends. On certain days, Willian accompanies her because it is when she makes collections. She allows for credit and charges every eight days. She has spent several years doing this work to forge ahead for her family. 
This loan is to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. She has been in this loan group from its beginning and she likes the help that they provide through loans. Her dreams are to forge ahead together with her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque operates a tricycle transportation service. He transports passengers from one area to the other. He is a 33 year-old married man with two young dependents. He resides in Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in this kind of business for two years now. He needs capital to finance his existing livelihood.

He is asking for a loan to buy tricycle parts like hub (the central part of a wheel) and steel plate. With the availability of these resources, Roque can provide quality services and also ensure the safety of his passengers. Thus, his income will improve and enable him to provide the needs of his children.

Roque is determined to improve his livelihood to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy tricycle parts like hub (the central part of a wheel) and steel plate.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt:
A senhora Hortência é operária agrícola de 37 anos de idade, mãe solteira de 03 filhos 1 já maior de idade  2 a estudar e vive na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cimento, pedra, areia, varões, chapas de zinco  para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa .
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar para oferecer um lar melhor  a sua família, e que com os empréstimos anteriores adquiriu um congelador, televisor e reforçou o seu negocio
Tem como desafios financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as mesmas e alcançar os seus objectivos
texts.en:
Hortência is an agricultural worker.  She is 37 and a single mother of 3 children, one of whom who is an adult and 2 of whom are in school.  She owns the home where she lives.  She tells us that with this loan she will purchase cement, stones, sand, bars, and zinc panels to continue construction on his home.  Her dream is to complete construction on furnish her house in order to provide a better home to her family. With the previous loans she purchased a freezer and television, and supported her business. 

Her challenges are that she has been working and will take more time to pay the loans and meet her goals.

loans.use: Purchase cement, stones, sand, bars, and zinc panels.

loans.name: Filipe

texts.pt:
O senhor Filipe de 27 anos de idade, professor, vive maritalmente e pai de 1 filho menor de idade não sustenta mais ninguém  vive na casa própria.
Com o empréstimo  irá comprar cimento, ferros, areia, pedra, para dar continuidade a sua obra.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, e fazer sua licenciatura oficializar  sua relação casando se.
Tem como desafios  falta de meio de transporte pessoal visto que vive em uma zona com dificuldades de transporte o que tem provocado atraso ao serviço  outros programas da sua vida.
texts.en: Filipe is 27 years old.  He is a professor who lives with his common-law wife and one minor child.  He owns his home and does not support anyone else.  With this loan he will purchase cement, iron bars, sand, and stones in order to continue construction on his home.   His dream is to complete construction, complete his college degree, and formalize his marriage.  His challenges are that he does not have a vehicle and lives in an area with poor public transportation. This has made him late to work and other places.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron bars, sand, and stones.

loans.name: Ma. Salome

texts.en:
Ma. Salome is a 47-year-old married woman with four children to provide for.

She is engaged in a corn production business to earn a living. She aims to increase her income so she decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for her corn farm so that she can produce a good quality of corn and can deliver more corn to her customers in the market. This will generate more income.

Ma. Salome's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La Señora Susana tienen  tres  locales de venta de todo tipos de Granos y especies en general se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 22 años, es una mujer muy conocida por el buen trato que siempre tiene.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se ha abierto camino y que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela y hoy día ya es muy conocida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar granos por cantidad para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Susana has three locations where she sells all sorts of grains and spices in general. She has done this work for more than 22 years. She is a very well-known woman for the good manner she always has.

She is a very hard-working woman who has made her way and has developed a very good customer base and these days is very well-known.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase grains in bulk to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grains to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo tiene 22 integrantes, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que quieren salir adelante por medio de su trabajo unido. Ellas se fijaron como meta el crecimiento de cada una de ellas no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
La Sra. Odulia es la presidenta del grupo, ella es Peluquera,  ella vive con sus  hijos, quienes son su motivo de lucha y esfuerzo, ya que quiere darles una buena calidad de vida. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
La Sra. Obdulia pide este préstamo para mejorar su hogar, ya que ahí tiene su salón de belleza, y de esa forma seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group has 22 members. They are very hard-working and determined women who want to get ahead through their collective work. They established as a goal the growth of each one of them, not only economically but also as a person.

Obdulia is the president of the group. She is a hairdresser. She lives with her children, who are her motivation to struggle and work hard, since she wants to give them a good quality of life. She is a very hard-working woman who tries hard to be able to get ahead and give her loved ones all that she couldn't have. 

Obdulia asks for this loan to improve her home, since she has a beauty salon there and in this way to continue giving good service to her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity which she receives to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to refurbish her house which is a beauty salon to be able to give her customers better service.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
El Sr. Dionisio tiene 56 años, está acompañado  hace 38 años con la señora Andrea, tienen un solo hijo ya mayor, que sacaron adelante por medio de su sacrificio.
El señor Dionisio tiene una propiedad de 15 hectáreas de tierra, tiene cultivo de mandioca que vende en cantidad en el mercado y también vende  en pequeña cantidad a los carriteros de la zona.     
El Sr. Dionisio solicita el préstamo para la compra de abono, limpieza de terreno, que le permitirá ofrecer productos de buena calidad y así disponer de un buen producto para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dionisio is 56 years old and has been married for 38 years to his wife Andrea. They have one son who is already grown, that succeeds by his sacrifice.

Mr. Dionisio has a property of 15 hectares of land, where he grows cassava that he sells in quantity at the market. He also sells it in small quantities to the carriteros of the area.

Mr. Dionisio is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizer and clearing land, which will allow him to offer products of good quality and therefore provide a good product for his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, and for spending on land clearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits for her son's fruits selling business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora and she proved that anyone can steer herself to the direction she chooses.

Today, she is living at Intramuros, Manila, separated and living with her two kids.

She didn't complete her studies and only graduated high school.  In 2005, she got involved in CCT and found hope to establish herself once more. She is 44 years, but she's handling two variety stores and a direct-selling business simultaneously.  

She wants to expand her business and she needs your help. She wants to provide greater stocks of grocery items for her store. With that, she would like to ask for a PHP 50,000 loan from you. Hoping a lot that you'd consider, Leonora ensures to be faithful in repaying and improving her attitude towards business. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to provide greater stocks of grocery items for her store.
