loans.name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 C

texts.en:
Tin (pictured right), the featured borrower, is 49 years old and married with five children. Two of the children help out with the duck business while the others are in primary school. Tin owns a farming business and raises livestock. 

Proximity's loan will help the family purchase supplies for their farm. If Tin has enough money, he wants to open a third business to raise fish, which is becoming a popular business trend in this region. Similar to other parents, he wants his children to be well-educated.

A CBO leader oversees the group of eight. The CBO leader and group members are pictured above, named Myint, Hla, Aung and Win. The fund will help all the members to purchase fertilizer and rice. 

Hta Ni Pat Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for their farm.

borrowers.first_name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 C

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. He is 45 years old, married and has three boys. Nobody works in their house except for him.

Taleh is a farmer. He has been in this work for one year and wants to earn good experience in this field. Now his monthly income is 400 AZN, but he wants to increase his earnings because the family’s expenses are higher and he is not able to cover them fully. Moreover, Taleh believes he can become successful by developing his business.

He needs to buy more seeds, plants and trees to grow the business. Please help Taleh and make his life easier.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, plants and trees to grow the business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Boane província de Maputo tem 32 anos de idade viúva mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua avo que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2014. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo com qual pretende adquirir material de construção como areia, cimento e chapas para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência de forma a dar melhor conforto a sua família.  
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência, mobilar e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos.
texts.en: Rosa was born in Boane, in the Maputo province.  She is 32 years old and a widowed mother of 2 young children who attend school.  She also supports her grandmother who lives with her. She began working with Hluvuku in 2014.  This is her 3rd loan and she plans to use it to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, and metal panels in order to continue building her home and provide more comfort to her family.  In the future, she plans to complete construction, furnish it, and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and metal panels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for a laundromat.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una de ellas pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Elsa es integrante de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura y por medio de su humilde trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante y es por ello que pone todo de si para poder crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros insumos para poder seguir con sus confecciones y seguir ganándose la vida de una manera digna.
texts.en:
This group is in the poverty elimination program; each one of them puts her best efforts into being able to improve and help their loved ones.

Elsa is a member of this group. She works in sewing and through this humble work, she earns her living in a dignified way. She is a very hard-working person who wants to get ahead and for this she puts her all into being able to grow.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase fabric, thread, elastics, buttons and other supplies to be able to continue with her sewing and to continue earning her living in a dignified way.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastics, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Soucoupapaye 2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 29 Novembre 2003. Ce groupe est composé de six femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce. Elles sont solidaires et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et âgée de 41 ans. Elle s'active depuis un an sur la vente de tissus teintés. Elle compte acheter quatre lots de 25 mètre chacun, des couleurs d'une valeur de 20 000FCFA, un Kg de ségéné, un Kg de soude, des bougies. Elle n'est pas la seule qui exerce cette activité mais elle est très douée dans la teinture ce qui fait que sa production ne traine pas. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider ses frères et sœurs dans le paiement de la scolarité de leurs enfants et participer à la nourriture.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" (village borrowing group) was inaugurated on November 29, 2003. The group is composed of six women who are small-scale retailers. They encourage each other and take out loans that they reimburse in a timely manner.

Madame Awa who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the representative of the group. She is single, aged 41, and has no children. For one year she has been selling hand-dyed cloth. She intends to buy four lots of cloth of 25 meters each, dyes costing 20,000 F CFA, a kilogram of "ségéné", a kilogram of caustic soda, and some candles (for wax). She is not the only one who works at this dyeing business, but she is very good at dyeing which means that her output does not take long to sell. The profit will be used to help her brothers and sisters pay school fees for their children and help pay for food.

loans.use: to purchase lengths of cloth to dye for resale

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Amanecer está en el ciclo 18 del programa de comités, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por el bien de sus familias, para darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Pablina ella  es cliente de la Fundación  y se dedica a la repostería  y también es cocinera en un supermercado, es una mujer muy sacrificada, que con lucha y esfuerzo ha logrado superarse y tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus reposterías, como ser azúcar, manteca, huevos, y otros productos al por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Amanecer group is in its 18th loan cycle in the committee program. They are in the poverty elimination program, struggling for the good of their families, to give them a better quality of life.

One of the members is Pablina. She is a client of the foundation and works making pastries. She is also a cook in a super market. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who, with struggle and effort, has managed to improve herself and have the means to be able to help her family and her loved ones.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase supplies to be able to continue making pastries, such as sugar, butter, eggs, and other products in bulk to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, butter, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Miseleman

texts.en:
Miseleman is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 3 years, where her primary customers are individuals. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. She hopes that in the future, she will have a comfortable life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of firewood

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a single woman. She describes herself to be honest and she operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Linda

texts.en:
Her name is Maria Linda, a hardworking woman from Tigbauan, Iloilo who raises five children with her husband Loreto, a laborer. Since her husband’s job is occasional and his income cannot suffice for their everyday expenses and children’s education, Maria Linda decided to embark on direct selling of Personal Collection products. She chose this business because it typically requires low capital to begin with. She will do everything to support the needs of her five children and push through their college education until its completion. 

Now Maria Linda aspires to improve her business with the aid of additional capital amounting to PhP 30,000. She will use it to buy more Personal Collection products that she can sell to her friends, neighbors and other network.  Her dream is to have a stable space or a showroom for her business someday. She also desires for a good future for her children and harmonious relationship among her family. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more Personal Collection products to sell

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is a married man, with 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, cooking oil,sugar, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, rice,cooking oil,sugar, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular. 

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living conditions. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Ubwuzuzanye Group

texts.en:
Claudine is a group leader; aged 34 years.She is married with 3 children aged between 12 and 10 years. The group is called UBWUZUZANYE means “WORK TOGETHER” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She has a shop and has been running in a business for 5 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man, with 2 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, rice,cooking oil,sugar, bread and other items, where he has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to have a big shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан, 55 лет, вдова, воспитала 3 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анаркан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 22 коровы, 100 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 22,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Она является лидером группы "Нури", в которой кроме Анаркан состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит улучшить материальное положение семьи.
texts.en:
Anarkan is 55 years old and a widow. She has brought up three children. Anarkan has received secondary education. As the main source of income for her faily, Anarkan raises livestock and grows farm crops, having launched this business 22 years ago by purchasing livestock for 30,000 soms (KGS). Thanks to Anarkan’s hard work, she now has 22 cows and 100 sheep. Her monthly revenue is 22,000 KGS, which is insufficient to provide for her family in a dignified way.

In order to develop her farm further, Anarkan has applied to the Bai Tusum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy calves to increase her headcount. She is the leader of the Nuri borrowers’ group, which includes two other members besides Anarkan. She plans to invest her resulting revenues in an additional increase of livestock, which will help improve her family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to buy some calves in order to help bolster her income.

loans.name: Kusi Ccoyllor Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KUSI CCOYLLOR, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Edelmira tiene 54 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales para su negocio.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos en general y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Edelmira is a member of the communal bank KUSI CCOYLLOR. The bank is located in the Vilcabamba district, in La Convencion province, in the department of Cusco. 
Edelmira is fifty-four years old, she is married with four children. She spends her days raising young animals. She raises her animals to later sell them to her customers. She has been running this business for quite a while, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day, since in this way she is helping her family get ahead. 
She is requesting a loan to be able to buy animals for her business. 
The members are all grateful and are committed to meeting the payment requirements. 
The member in the inset of the photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work obligations.

loans.use: to buy livestock for her business

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 32 years old, married, has three children. She lives in Tambulig-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities such as growing, caring for, and harvesting crops. She has earned a good income as well. Raquel has supported her husband doing this type of work. 

Like a farmer, Raquel has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Raquel hopes to purchase another plot of rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Marietta has been in this business for 15 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

In the future, Marietta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Adriana Eliza

texts.es: Adriana es una joven residente en la Provoncia del Carchi, ella vive con sus padres y 3 hermanos en el campo y sus ingresos los obtiene de la crianza de animales menores y adicionalmente los fines de semana le ayuda a su madre a vender comidas rápidas. Adriana comenta que apenas pudo terminar el bachillerato ya que tiene un problema de la memoria. Adriana solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos. Adriana espera mejorar su negocio para seguir adelante y lograr mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adriana is a young woman who lives in Carchi Province with her parents and three brothers. They live in the country, and she obtains her income by raising small animals. Additionally, she helps her mother sell fast food on the weekends. Adriana comments that she was barely able to complete high school, as she has a memory problem.

Adriana is requesting the loan money in order to invest it in the purchase of pigs. Adriana hopes to improve her business in order to make progress and be able to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
Basilio es un hombre de 34 años de edad vive en una comunidad llamado Santa Maria, tiene cuatro hijos todos viven con él.
Basilio vive en una zona donde se produce mucha verdura, pues viendo toda esta producción él desde hace doce años tomo la iniciativa de cultivar verduras, él cultiva muy a menudo, es por ello que ahora se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de papa y fertilizantes para poder cultivar en esta temporada.
Basilio espera conseguir el crédito para poder cultivar y mejorar sus ganancias para mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Basilio is a 34-year-old man, who lives in a community called Santa Maria. He has four children who live with him.

Basilio lives in a zone where they produce a lot of vegetables, and seeing all of this production, twelve years ago he decided to grow vegetables. He grows very frequently, so now he needs to ask for a loan to invest in the purchase of potato seeds and fertilizers to be able to cultivate in this season.

Basilio hopes to get the loan to be able to cultivate and increase his earnings to improve his house.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es:
Jose es una persona muy amable, él tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su hermosa familia en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Jose para generar sus ingresos económicos, se dedica a la agricultura la siembra una diversidad de verduras, esta actividad lo realiza en la misma comunidad donde vive, Jose por ser una persona responsable ha logrado prosperidad en la vida. Para Jose la agricultura es buena ya que genera ganancias, pero esto no es suficiente para volver a sembrar es por eso que él está buscando un préstamo de cinco mil quetzales que lo estaría invirtiendo en la compra de semillas y fertilizantes.
El gran anhelo de Jose es poder contar con su casa propia para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
José is a very friendly person. He is 27 years old and lives with his lovely family in a community in Sololá.

José, to generate his income, works in agriculture, growing a variety of vegetables. He does this work in the same community where he lives. José, being a responsible person, has managed to have prosperity in his life. For Jose, agriculture is good since it generates earnings but this is not enough to replant, so he is looking for a loan of five thousand quetzales which he will invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizers.

José's great desire is to be able to have his own house so his family can live better.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 49 years old, married and supports a family of six children. He has been selling bananas,tomatoes and avocados for the last 20 years earning KES.6,000 per month.

He has applied for KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more stocks of ripe bananas for sell to clients in the market and the surplus to buy a dairy cow for milk production . 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of ripe bananas for sell to clients in the market and the surplus to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 D

texts.en:
The Featured Borrower, Pyon (pictured left), has a six acre crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar. Pyon is 54 years old and married with two children.  One of his children is working in the city while the other is working on the family farm. Similar to many farmers in the area, Pyon's savings are running low before the harvest season. 

Proximity's loan will help him purchase the necessary farming resources he needs before the harvest.  He wants to expand his crop farm and buy his own farming machines to help him boost his income. 

Pictured above are the members of the Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 D, named Ohm,Than and Hte. A CBO leader oversees all the members and the fund will help each member purchase fertilizer and crop seeds. 

Hta Ni Pat Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary farming resources he needs before the harvest.

borrowers.first_name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 D

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Public Utility Jeepney or PUJ is the business of Lucrecia from Tigbauan, Iloilo. She owns two units of jeepneys that are being rented by two drivers in her neighborhood. At the end of the day, the drivers will pay their rental fees in fixed amount.  Her income usually sustains her daily expenditures as a widow with working children. But there are times when the drivers cannot remit their daily rental fee due to few passengers. This is especially true during school vacations. She cannot force the drivers because she understands that they too have no income. This situation affects her everyday consumption, and she has no choice but to squeeze her budget.

Her jeeps need to undergo its regular maintenance routine and she has to buy some spare parts to replace the worn out ones. She appeals for PhP 20,000 capital to meet this need. Part of the loan will be utilized for her cataract operation which has been long overdue. She still wants to enjoy her daily life and see all her children happy and successful. If God permits, she will buy additional jeeps for rent and employ some drivers in the near future. 

She remains faithful in attending the regular meeting of her co-fellowship members at CCT where she gains the patience and strength through sharing of life experiences and study of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepneys

loans.name: Jesus Humberto

texts.es:
Jesús está casado con Norma Iris desde hace 13 años con la cual procrearon 3 hijos, el tiene 36 años de edad, Jesús se dedica a la producción de café hace ya más de 10 años Jesús tiene su plantación de café certificada con sellos como ser: Comercio Justo y Rain Forest el cual comercializa atreves de COCAFCAL  de la cual es socio. 
El se ha dedicado toda su vida a la producción de café, Jesús y su esposa han luchado juntos por sacar adelante a su familia actualmente Jesús solicita un crédito que  le permitiría Convertir su finca a producción orgánica y renovarla por completo y de esta manera tendría mejores posibilidades de mercado para su café y además contribuiría a la conservación del medio ambiente.
Jesús sueña con que su familia pueda formar un patrimonio solido que les garantice una calidad de vida más adecuada y mejores posibilidades de educación para sus hijos.
El crédito ayudara a Jesús a invertir en la conversión a orgánico de sus cafetales y con las ganancias obtenidas por su café orgánico él espera poder tener los ingresos suficientes para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y además hacer un ahorro para ir formando un pequeño patrimonio.
texts.en:
Jesús married Norma Iris 13 years ago, with whom he has 3 children. He is 36 years old. Jesús has worked in coffee production for more than 10 years now. Jesús has his coffee plantation certified with fair trade and Rain Forest seals, which he sells through COCAFCAL, of which he is a member.

He has worked his whole life in coffee production. Jesús and his wife have struggled together to get their family ahead. Currently, Jesús asks for a loan that will allow him to convert his farm to organic production and replace it completely and, in this way, he will have better market possibilities for his coffee and, in addition, will contribute to the conservation of the environment.

Jesús dreams that his family will be able to form a solid legacy that will guarantee a better quality of life and educational possibilities for his children.

The loan will help Jesús invest in the conversion of his coffee plants to organic and with the earnings he gets from the organic coffee, he hopes to be able to have sufficient income to improve his family's quality of life and in addition be able to save to continue making his small legacy.

loans.use: to purchase the materials needed to convert his coffee plantation to organic such as organic fertilizer, organic pesticides and coffee plants, among others.

loans.name: Mauricio Adalberto

texts.es: Mauricio de 33 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad a lado de su madre a quien le esta inmensamente agradecido por haberle brindado su apoyo durante toda su vida. Mauricio desde hace tiempo se dedica a prestar sus servicios en la comuna de su municipio, y gracias a su sueldo devengado junto con las ganancias de la crianza  y venta de conejos que realiza su madre logra solventar los gastos del hogar. Mauricio con el propósito de mejorar su casa ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI  con el fin de cambiar el techo de su vivienda dado que con el que cuenta actualmente se encuentra en malas condiciones. Con el monto otorgado invertirá en: lámina, pines y polines.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 33 years old and lives in a house that he owns, along with his mother, to whom he is immensely grateful for having offered him support throughout his whole life. 

For a long time Mauricio has made a living providing services in the commune of his district. Thanks to the salary that he earns and the earnings his mother makes by raising and selling rabbits they are able to cover the household holds. 

With the goal of improving his house, Mauricio made the decision to ask for this loan from FUSAI. He will use it to change the roof of his home as the one he currently has is in poor condition. He will use the sum he is loaned to invest in sheeting, pine wood and poles.

loans.use: To buy sheeting, pine wood and poles to change the roof of his house

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a businesswoman who earns a living retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance.

Maria requested a loan, which she will use to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring, and harvesting. Dolores has supported her husband doing this type of work. She has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Dolores requested a loan, which she will use to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. She hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds

loans.name: Alegria Germania

texts.es: Germania esta casada, desde su niñez ha vivido en el campo donde los ingresos económicos se los obtiene de la crianza de animales y la agricultura, Germania y su esposo se dedican a criar chanchos y a sembrar productos que se dan en la provincia en la que habita, Germania tiene 2 hijos y 2 hijas, son 2 los que están estudiando. Germania  solicita el dinero para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos ya que tiene chancheras apropiadas donde  puede criar sus animales, ella cometa que es de este negocio de donde va sacando adelante a sus hijos, Germania tiene aspiraciones para futuro que son las de ver a sus hijos que culminen sus estudios y lleguen a ser profesionales para que tengan acceso a un trabajo que mejore la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Germania is married, and since her childhood has lived in the countryside where people get their income from raising animals and agriculture. Germania and her husband work raising pigs and growing products which work in the province where they live. Germania has 2 sons and 2 daughters, of whom 2 go to school. Germania asks for the money to invest it in the purchase of pigs, since she has appropriate pigsties where she can raise her animals. She says that it is with this business that she gets her children ahead. Germania's aspirations for the future are to see her children finish their education and become professionals so that they have access to work that improves the quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 57 years old and does farming. She is widowed and has three adult children. She has been growing cash crops for sell and has been in this business for 13 years. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loan successfully. 

She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm so as to get more farm produce for sell and be able to support her family. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm so as to get more farm produce to sell and be able to support her family.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a single woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells scrap metal and has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of scrap metal. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of scrap metal

loans.name: Olympio  School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Badru. He is the Director of Olympio High School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Nsangi in Wakiso with 720 students. Olympio High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank & a pump, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Olympio High School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Badru ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy carpentry materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, breezeblocks and to pay for work to be done.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a farm where he grows vegetables and has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with good weather. 

He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to increase the farming area within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Twubakane Group

texts.en:
Twubakane is a group led by Genevieve who is 39 years old. The group name means to develop themselves in English.  She sells food stuffs and has been in a business for the past 6 years. The group member sells different items and they all believe to improve their business though the loans. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, rice and cassava for sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice and cassava for sell.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
La socia Verónica pertenece al banco comunal LAS ORQUIDEAS,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana ,provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Verónica continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de chocolate en pasta, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia continua elaborando  y distribuyendo  a sus clientes que le solicitan, como amistades, familiares y clientes entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos.
Los socios en general agradecen  el crédito otorgado y por este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Veronica belongs to the communal bank "Las Orquideas" (The Orchids), which is located in the district of Santa Ana in the province of La Convencion and in the department of Cusco. Veronica continues to make a living with her business selling chocolate paste. The member is a responsible person. She continues producing and distributing her product to customers that ask for it, such as friends, family members, and other customers. It is through this business that the member moves her family forward. 

Veronica is requesting a loan to buy supplies. All of the members are grateful for the loan that they are receiving, and they promise to make their payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace hails from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She operates a habal-habal (motorcycle) transport services. She has been engaged in a motorcycle transport services for 10 years now. She is a 31-year- old married woman with 3 dependents, ages 2, 9 and 10 years old.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP to buy a chain, a tube and a wheel. With these, she would be able to maintain safety when traveling. Her income will improve and able to settle her finances.

She could now be able to provide for the needs of her growing children.

She dreams of having her own home and being able to manage her livelihood successfully.

loans.use: to buy a chain, a tube, and a wheel.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delia is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Delia has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to dry and sell.

Delia has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. Rosita is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, can goods, egg, etc.

Rosita has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, canned  goods, egg, etc

loans.name: Lorraine May

texts.en:
Lorraine May is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her business for her manicure and pedicure business.

Lorraine May has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her business

loans.name: Edelma

texts.en:
Edelma is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edelma is 41 years old and has one child in school.

Edelma has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to dry and sell.

Edelma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
Serapio tiene 56 años de edad y está casado desde hace 18 años con doña Maria Graciela han procreado 3 hijos juntos por los cuales han luchado todos estos años por salir adelante, el se dedica desde su juventud a la producción de café el cual comercializa atreves de la COCAFCAL de la cual es socio desde hace 5 años.
La producción de café bajo sellos de certificación orgánica y comercio justo son algo novedoso en la región ya que los sellos dan un valor agregado al producto, la comercialización es más fácil y además se protege la diversidad de la zona. 
Serapio solicita un crédito para convertir su cafetal a producción orgánica para lo que él necesita  replantar en su totalidad cafetal y aprovechando que las fincas están deterioradas por la edad y las plagas este es el momento oportuno, con la conversión a orgánico Serapio obtendrá mejores un precios por su café y asegura mercado para su cosecha.
Serapio solicita un crédito para comprar todo lo necesario en la conversión a orgánico de su cafetal, como ser: Plantas de café, Abonos orgánicos, insumos orgánicos, y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en: 56-year-old Serapio has been married to Maria Graciela for 18 years. They have had 3 children together and have always worked hard to support them. He has grown coffee since he was young, selling it through COCAFCAL, of which he has been a member for 5 years. The production of coffee with an organic and fair trade label is something new in the region and, as the labels add value to the product, it sell is easier to sell and it also protects the diversity of the area. Serapio is applying for a loan to convert his coffee plantation to organic production methods which means that he will have to replant all his plantation and, taking advantage of the fact that the estates are now ruined by age and pests, this would seem to be the perfect time to do this. By converting to organic production methods, Serapio will get better prices for his coffee and can be sure of having a market for his crop. he is applying for a loan to buy everything he needs to convert to organic production on his coffee plantation, such as coffee plants, organic manure, organic supplies, and he will also use it to pay labourers.

loans.use: to buy the materials required to grow coffee organically: coffee plants, organic manure, organic pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 28 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Mary Jane requested a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, chips, milk, coffee, eggs, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, chips, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, cheeses, meats, breads, sauces, condiments, cold cuts, napkins, and disposables.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anabella is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Anabella has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Anabella requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to dried and sell.

Anabella has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Anabella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dried and sell

loans.name: Annie Rina

texts.en:
Annie Rina is a married woman, 45 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Annie Rina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Annie Rina has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli works hard to support her family. Araceli is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Araceli has been in this business for 11 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is married with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melanie is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 11 years.  In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is called Naomi. She is 46 years old, married and has a family of 3 children. She does dairy farming and runs a grocery shop. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 and has successfully been trained on financial management and modern business skills to run small and medium businesses. 

The main purpose for applying for this Kiva loan is to buy more stock for her grocery shop and thus increase her income so she can provide better clothing and education for her children. Naomi is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the loan and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of groceries.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
The person in the photo is called Martin; he is 29 years old and single. He does dairy farming and sells avocados.

He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH E.A) in 2014 with an aspiration to be trained on better credit management and business skills.

He is applying for the loan to add more stock to his avocado business and enable him improve his living standards by buying more dairy cows.

Martin is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the loan and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To buy more stock of avocados for increased sales and more income to enable him buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is age 42 years old, and a mother of four children; two of them are in school. They live in a rural area of Kampong Speu province.

The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming for 24 years and work as a construction worker to earn additional income to support her family. Her rice crops have not grown well because of drought and insects; these are the main challenges for her business.

Now she lacks funds to support her children’s studying, so she is applying for a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay for her children’s school fees to get a high education.

This is Mom's third loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and the past loans have helped her to have better living conditions.

For this new loan, she hopes that her children will be able to continue their studying until they graduate and have good jobs.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s school fees to get a high education.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Huchuy Qosqo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HUCHUY QOSQO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes ella es separada tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “Huchuy Qosqo” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Calca in the province of Urubamba in the region of Cusco.

Lourdes is a member of this group. She is separated from her husband, is 46 years old and has three children. She has a business raising and selling animals. She has been running this business for some time and it is going well thanks to the hard work that she puts into it every day. She raises guinea pigs and chickens until they grow and fatten, and then sells them at various fairs. She wants to be able to continue working so she can keep supporting her family. 

She is asking for the loan so she can buy guinea pigs and other animals. 

All the members are grateful to those who have contributed to this dream and promise to comply with their repayment schedules.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and other animals

loans.name: Ana Dayci

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas de 16, 12 y 6 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y camarón en el mercado de su municipio y con las ganancias que obtiene  de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo  logran solventar las necesidades que se les presentan en su hogar. Ana quiere mejorar su vivienda pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo por eso solicita un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de hierro, cemento, láminas, polines, y pago de mano de obra para poder continuar la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio y brindar a su familia mayor comodidad y  una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and lives with her spouse and three daughters who are 16, 12 and 6 years old. She works selling fish and prawns at the market in her town and with the profits which she obtains from her sales and the help of her spouse they manage to afford the things they need which come up around the home.
Ana wants to improve her home but she does not have the necessary money to do so and for that reason she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy iron, cement, printed sheets and poles, and to pay laborers to be able to continue the construction of a bedroom and to provide her family with more comfort and better living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in: iron, cement, printed sheets and poles, and to pay laborers in order to be able to continue the construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda  runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like sugar, edible oil, bread, salt, noodles, assorted canned goods, matches,eggs, insect repellent, and toiletries. It has been more than 10 years now that she has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store. 

She is a 59-year-old married woman with six grown-up children. She hails from Getafe, Bohol.

Erlinda has requested a loan to buy beverages and assorted chips. These will help improve the content of her store and enable her to attract buyers. Thus, she would be able to pay her obligations and start to expand. She could then afford to purchase the healthy diet that is essential in her day-to-day activity.

She is hoping that she will be successful in managing her small livelihood and make it productive.

loans.use: to buy beverages and assorted chips.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 26 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Alma has been in this business for 9 years. 

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en:
Floramie is 31 years old and has six children. Floramie is married and has three children who are in school.

Floramie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Floramie requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Floramie has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Floramie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a selling sea cucumber business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fresh fish.  Nida is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more sea cucumber to sell for her selling sea cucumber business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sea cucumber to sell

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana is 52 years old and has five children. Taciana is married and has one child in school.

Taciana is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Taciana requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Taciana has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Taciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Frelyn

texts.en:
Frelyn works hard to support her family. Frelyn is married and has a business buying and selling fresh fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products for her business.

Frelyn has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Frelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
YASMEEN is age 30; she is a mother of five children and living in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a general store where he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store. His relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well.

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, YASMEEN requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.

YASMEEN hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. YASMEEN thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristy is 46 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Cristy has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Cristy has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru: Мээрим, 30 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. У нее - высшее образование, работает учителем в школе, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Мээрим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 коров, 11 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мээрим обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Мээрим является участником группы "Нури", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Мээрим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и приобретение автомобиля для семьи.
texts.en: Meerim is 30, married, and has four children. She has a university education and is a teacher at the high school. She also raises livestock to earn income for her family. Thanks to Meerim's hard work, she currently has eight cows and eleven sheep, earning 17,800 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her business, Meerim applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy calves to increase her livestock numbers. Meerim is a member of the "Nuri" group, which consists of two other people. She is planning to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock and to purchase a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy some calves in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Judy, 25 years old and a mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. She has benefited through the training, especially on how to manage a start-up business.

She operates a shop where she sells commodities like sugar, flour, salt, washing detergents and also milk products.

She is borrowing from Kiva to add more floor and sugar in her shop; that will increase her profit and enable her to cater for her basic needs, like clothing, and that of her child.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to add stock, thus more sales and profits to enable her buy clothing for her child.

loans.name: David

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 39 anos de idade, solteiro pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a hluvuku em 2011. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento e chapas de zinco. Para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência de forma a dar conforto a sua família. 
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade e concluir a sua obra de residência.
texts.en: David was born in Namaacha, Maputo Province.  He is 39 years old and a single father to 2 young children.  He also supports his mother who lives with him.  He began working with Hluvuku in 2011.  This is his 5th loan with Hluvuku, which he will use to purchase construction material such as sand, cement, and zinc panels to continue construction on his home and provide greater comfort to his family. In the future he plans to open an business selling staple goods and finish building his house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and metal panels.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana es una joven mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 4 años, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan casero. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, sensible, sincera, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por su intensa actividad económica y el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Fabiana es de tez trigueña, ojos obscuros, cabello marrón largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que trabajan y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan casero, como; Mollete - Es el pan corriente de harina, azúcar granulada y manteca, Pan de Arroz – pan con harina de arroz, Pan dulce - se utiliza uvas pasas, huevo, leche y azúcar, Rosca de maíz – a base de harina de maíz, Tortilla - masa de pan, primeramente aplanada, espolvoreada con azúcar y harina, obteniendo una especie de pan de hojaldre. Actividad que realiza de forma independiente en un cuarto habilitado para hornear en su casa. "existen muchas variedades de pan y trato de satisfacer a mis clientes según los ingredientes que encuentre…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede trabajar y cuidar a su hijo, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de diferentes tipos de harina por quintal. Su sueño es abrir una panadería grande en un lugar céntrico. Ella desea mejorar sus ingresos mediante la compra de harina de; maíz, arroz, trigo, y otras variedades por quintal. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Fabiana solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de harinas por quintal  para mejorar sus ingresos y cuidar a su hijo.
texts.en: Fabiana is a 25, single and has a 4-year-old son. Her work involves making and selling homemade bread. She is a good mother and an enterprising, sensitive, responsible and extremely hardworking woman. She runs her business in the southern part of the city, which is known for its busy economic activity and as the site of the biggest markets, countless shopping centres and shops. The area has a warm, subtropical climate with daytime temperature which vary between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade. Fabiana has light brown skin, dark eyes, long brown hair, which she wears tied up, and is short and slim. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and this is what she speaks with her family. In other situations and for her business, she speaks Spanish. She lives with her parents, who both work, and her son, who is not yet of school age. They live in their own home which is made from brick and cement and has a corrugated roof and a cement floor, drinking water, electricity and plumbing. Her work consists of making and selling homemade bread, such as: Mollete - the usual bread made with flour, granulated sugar and butter; Pan de Arroz (Rice bread) - with rice flour; Pan dulce - with raisins, egg, milk and sugar; Rosca de maíz (corn ring) - made with cornflour; Tortilla - bread dough, flattened, sprinkled with sugar and flour, to produce a kind of puff pastry. She makes her bread independently in a room in her house which has been specially converted for baking. "There are many varieties of bread and I try to satisfy my customers using the ingredients I have to hand" she says. The advantage of her business is that she can work and look after her son. The downside is the shortage of capital to buy different types of flour by the quintal (approximately 100lbs). Her ambition is to open a big bakery in a central location. She would like to boost her income by buying corn, rice and wheat flour, among others, by the quintal. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the year she has been working as a baker. And so, Fabiana is applying for a loan to buy different types of flour by the quintal so she can boost her income and take care of her son.

loans.use: to buy different types of flour by the quintal so as to improve her income and support her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sand, cement and gravel, and to pay for labor to be able to improve her home.

loans.name: Pacha Yllari De Huandar Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PACHA YLLARI DE HUANDAR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huandar, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana, la socia sigue con su  negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
Los socios en general  se sienten agradecidos  por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes  entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The members of this group belong to the communal bank "Pacha Yllari De Huandar". This bank is located in the district of Huandar, which belongs to the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

Roxana is one of the members. She continues with her business of raising and selling animals. She has been in this business for quite some time, and she does well as a result of the effort that she puts forth every day. The member is a responsible and diligent person. It is through this business that the member moves her family forward.

All of the members are grateful for the loan that they are receiving, and they promise to make their payments according to the established terms. Roxana is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs, among other things. The other members make a living with businesses selling fruit, selling animals, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, among other things.

loans.name: Qory Orcco-Pucyura Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal QORY ORCCO - PUCYURA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Pucyura  en la provincia  de Anta departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina es soltera  tiene 02 hijos y tiene 53 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva años en este su negocio administrándolo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de animales entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The featured member belongs to the QORY ORCCO - PUCYURA communal bank in Pucyura district in Anta province which lies  Cusco department.
53-year-old Paulina is single and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business raising small animals. She has worked in this business for a number of years and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She is a responsible and determined person and this is how she supports her family. She is seeking the loan to buy animals, among other things. Al the members are grateful for the loan and promise to repay it in full.

loans.use: to buy animals among other things.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 64 years old, residing at Dullan, Aloran-Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed only with one child, who is of adult age.

She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the said coop.

Recently, she's accessing another loan in the amount of PHP 35,000 for additional working capital for her existing business to purchase an additional stock of fruits & vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nga'raria Golden Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Hannah, 57 years old, married and a mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014, where she was trained on financial management and enterprise development.

Hannah does mixed farming to earn a living. She keeps dairy cows and also grows maize, beans, potatoes and vegetables.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy animal feed in order to increase her milk production; she hopes through this she will be able to provide a better diet and clothing for her family.

Hannah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to increase milk production, thus providing a better diet and clothing for her family.

loans.name: Dionisa

texts.en:
Dionisa is 58 years old, and she is married with six children.

Dionisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

Dionisa has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Dionisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es un hombre joven de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de arquitectura.
Él es inteligente, comprometido con sus estudios, dedicado, responsable y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad pública ubicada barrio de San Pedro que es considerado una zona patrimonial de segundo orden, ya que preserva lo antiguo en una mezcla con lo moderno, dentro de las tradiciones particulares de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Ramiro es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a su madre que trabaja vendiendo comida, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de energía eléctrica, agua potable, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. El cursa la carrera de arquitectura y se encuentra en 4 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta diseñar espacios, le gusta utilizar diferentes escalas manejando técnicas, herramientas y medios de expresión convencional y digital, su carácter es de servicio, “quiero ser un poeta que piensa y habla en el idioma de la construcción…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios, él trabaja administrando un garaje. La ventaja de sus estudios es que los realiza por la noche y puede trabajar de día, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una computadora portátil y materiales de estudio como; portaplanos, regla "T", estilógrafos, alcalímetro, lápices de grafito, cutter y otros. Su sueño es crear una empresa consultora en Gestión, asesoría, interventoría de proyectos de arquitectura y urbanismo, él desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil y material de estudio. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 año que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Ramiro solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil y material de estudio para terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Ramiro is young man, 22 years old, is single without children, and studying to be an architect. He is intelligent, committed to his studies, dedicated, responsible, and very hard-working. Ramiro studies in a public university located in the barrio of San Pedro which is considered a patrimonial zone of the second order, which has preserved the old along with the modern, in the particular traditions of the city. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day between 0 – 12 degrees centigrade.

Ramiro has a dark complexion, dark eyes and short dark hair. He is short in stature with a slender build. His native tongue is Aymara which he rarely speaks, because he is a student and lives in the city. He resides with his mother who works selling meals. They live in their own house and have electricity, water, gas, and a sewage system. 

Ramiro is in the fourth year of a five year program in architectural studies. He enjoys designing spaces, using different scales, manipulating techniques, tools and conventional and digital mediums of expression. His character is one of service: “I want to be a poet who thinks and speaks in the idiom of construction,” he commented.

Parallel to his studies, Ramiro works administering a garage. The advantage of his studies is that he can do them a night and work in the daytime. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase a portable computer and study materials such as instruments of the trade (T-squares, pens, grafite pencils, a paper cutter, etc.)

His dream is to create an enterprise to conduct management, assessment, and intervention in projects in architecture and urbanism. At present, Ramiro wishes to purchase a portable computer and required study materials. This is his first sequence of loans with this institution in the four years he has devoted to professional studies.

This is why Ramiro is requesting a loan, which he needs to complete studies for his professional career.

loans.use: purchase a portable computer and study materials to complete his professional training in architecture.

loans.name: Zhanyl

texts.ru: Жаныл, 52 года, вдова, воспитала 2 детей. У нее - высшее образование, работает директором школы, в качестве дохода для своей семьи также она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Жаныл, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Жаныл является участником группы "Нури", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы она планирует вкладывать в развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит увеличить доходы семьи.
texts.en: Zhanyl is 52, widowed, and has two children. She has a university education and is the director of the school. She also raises livestock to earn income for her family. Thanks to Zhanyl's hard work, she currently has six cows and twenty sheep. She earns 17,000 som (KGS) per month, which is not enough to provide her family with a decent living. In order to develop her business, she applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy calves to increase her herd. Zhanyl is a member of the "Nuri" group, which has two other members. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in developing her business, which will increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase calves in order to increase her income

loans.name: Jenny Lissette

texts.es:
Yenny, es soltera, vive con su madre, por el momento no tiene hijos, es propietaria de una tienda de productos de la canasta básica y además elabora tortillas para vender, su negocio nació por la necesidad de generar ingresos con los que costea sus gastos personales y apoya a su madre con los gastos del hogar, lo tiene desde hace un año y por el momento no representa dificultades para administrar su negocio.
Para ella es importante dar a conocer la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes, solicita un crédito que utilizara específicamente para comprar una vitrina y maíz, su negocio tendrá mejor vistosidad y contara con materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas, de esta manera mejorara la atención que brinda a sus clientes.
Las aspiraciones que Yenny tiene son obtener nuevos ingresos y tener un estilo de vida mucho más confortable.
texts.en: Yenny is single, lives with her mother and for now does not have children. She is the owner of a shop selling basic everyday products as well as producing tortillas to sell. Her business was born from the necessity to generate income with which to finance her personal expenses and support her mother with the expenses around the home. She has done it for a year and for now has no difficulties in administering her business. For her it is important to make the merchandise which she is offering her clients public. She is asking for a loan which she will use specifically to buy a shop window and maize so that her business has more visibility and she has raw materials to develop the sale of tortillas. In this way she will improve the service which she provides to her customers. Yenny's aspirations are to obtain new income and to have a much more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a shop window and maize so that her business has more visibility and she has raw materials to develop the sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Diana Marisol

texts.es: Diana es una joven empresaria de 22 años que con su entusiasmo y creatividad, ha logrado consolidar su expendio de carne de pollo en un sector del municipio de Chocontá.  Ella fue empleada en un almacén llamado Mis Antojitos en donde adquirió una gran destreza para las ventas y la administración en general, de este modo emprendió su propio negocio en el que ofrece pollo y también una gran variedad de productos elaborados con carne de pollo; jamón de pollo, salchichas, salchichón, así mismo ofrece queso criollo.  Diana identificó una oportunidad en su negocio y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en una vitrina mostrador y exhibir embutidos para comidas rápidas.  Esta inversión ampliará su línea de productos y  con ello nuevos mercados.  Su meta a futuro es cumplir con sus obligaciones financieras y continuar progresando en su negocio.
texts.en: Diana is an enterprising 22-year-old young woman who, with her enthusiasm and creativity, has succeeded in establishing her small chicken meat shop in an area of Chocontá municipality. She was an employee at a store called My Snacks, where she acquired great skill in selling and administration in general. That was how she started her own business, in which she sells chicken and also a great variety of products made with chicken meat: chicken ham, sausages, and salami. She also sells Criollo cheese. Diana identified an opportunity in her business and she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in a glass display case and exhibit sausages for fast food. This investment will expand her product line and with it open new markets. Her goal for the future is to meet her financial obligations and to continue making progress with her business.

loans.use: to invest in a glass display case and exhibit sausages for fast food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery work.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer de 57 años de edad, casada, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de edredones y frazadas.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza la zona “villa Avaroa” que se caracteriza por abastecer con 32 pozos de agua subterránea a la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura ambiente entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
