Delia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua nativa es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de cama, como; edredones, cubrecamas, sábanas y almohadas, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, visitando ferias, comercios y mercados, durante todos los días de la semana por la mañana y por la tarde. “anteriormente trabajaba en la mina extrayendo mineral, debido a mi salud cambié de rubro y paso a paso mi negocio se va estabilizando…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa de cama de invierno cuenta con gran demanda, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de edredones y frazadas de invierno. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa de cama, ella desea abastecer su negocio mediante la compra de variedad de ropa de cama de invierno como edredones y frazadas para estabilizar su negocio y consolidar su actividad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Delia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de cama de invierno para cubrir la demanda de temporada y consolidar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia, 57, is married and has grown children.  She operates a business buying and selling quilts and bed covers.  She is an enterprising woman, self-reliant, optimistic and very hard-working.  She operates her business in the Villa Avaroa neighborhood of Santa Cruz.  Thirty-two wells here supply water to the city from underground aquifers.  The climate is cold and dry with day-time temperatures that range from 0- to 12-degrees, Centigrade.  

Delia is brown-skinned and has long, dark hair that she wears tied in the back.  She wears traditional clothing (a sweater, over-garment and hat).  She speaks Aymará, her native language, and Spanish.  Delia and her husband have a house of their own.  The house was built with cement and bricks and has a metal roof and timber floors.  The house is plumbed and has running water, electricity and gas.  Delia's husband is a construction worker.

Delia buys and sells bedding: quilts, bed covers, sheets, pillows, etc.  She works as a street vendor, going from place to place, wherever she is most likely to find buyers.  She works most days, mornings and afternoons.  "I used to work in a mine", she tells us, "but had to stop to protect my health . . . I have my own business now and it is slowly growing".  There is a lot of demand for her quilts and other bedding this time of year (winter) and Delia is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business because she lacks the capital to do it without your help.  She has operated her business for 3 years and this is her first loan from us.  

For the future, Delia hopes to open her own bedding shop.

loans.use: to buy quilts and blankets for her bedding sales business.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru: Мукадас спокойная и милая девушка из города Кургантюбе. Она замужем и хорошая мать для своих несовершенолетных детей. Её муж находится на заработках в России. Мукадас занимается растениеводством. Выращивать растения –  для нее эта работа, такая же, привычная как для многих из нас. Мукадас очень много трудится. Увидев ее вы не скажите, что она такая сильная и терпеливая девушка. Не каждая женщина сможет  одна вырастит детей, работать по дому и заниматься растениеводством. Мукадас и в этом году также посадила несколько видов овощных культур. Но для получения хорошего урожая, ей необходимо приобрести минеральные удобрения для поддержания роста овощей. Для этого у неё нет денег и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Мукадас очень надеется на то, что ей окажут материальную помощь.
texts.en: Mukadas is a calm, sweet woman from Qurgan-Tube. She is married and is a good mother to her young children. Her husband works in Russia. Mukadas is a farmer and growing crops is the work she is accustomed to. She works hard and is a strong, patient woman. It's not all women who can raise children alone, work around the house and grow crops by themselves. Mukadas planted several kinds of vegetables this year, but she needs to buy fertilizers for a good harvest. She does not have enough money to buy fertilizers, so she asked for a loan. Mukadas hopes for financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is a bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1988. She is living in a remote town with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a builder. She is a teacher at secondary school. She teaches students very well and is well known among colleagues as one of the important teachers at school. She likes her activity and is satisfied with her salary. 

Her eyes do not see well. She needs to have a surgical operation on her eye. She appealed to IMON and KIVA to get a loan to pay for her surgery at a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for her surgical operation at a medical clinic

loans.name: Joaquín Armando

texts.es:
Joaquín Armando tiene 45 años y se dedica a la producción de café bajo distintos sellos de certificación tales como: comercio justo y Rain Forest, está casado con Ana Hayde con quien ah tienen 2 hijos bajo su cargo, ellos trabajan en conjunto para sacar adelante a su familia, ellos tienen como única meta darles todo lo mejor que este dentro de sus posibilidades a sus hijos.
Joaquín quiere entrar al programa de certificación orgánica que dirige COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, la producción de café bajo sellos de certificación es algo nuevo en la región y muy novedoso ya que permite obtener mejores ganancias por el café además de que ayuda a proteger la biodiversidad de la región. 
En estos momentos Joaquín quiere convertir 1 hectarea a producción orgánica  para lo que necesita comprar varios materiales como ser: plantas de café, abonos orgánicos, fungicidas e insecticidas orgánicos, pago de mano de obra con las ganancias extras de su parcela orgánica Joaquín espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Un crédito ayudara a Joaquín a convertir su parcela a producción orgánica lo que le permitirá tener mercados fijos para su café y a mejores precios, lo que le da sostenibilidad a su cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Joaquín Armando is 45 years old and works producing coffee under various certifications like Free Trade and Rainforest. He is married to Ana Hayde with whom he has two children who he is responsible for. They work together to get their family ahead. Their only goal is to provide the best that that they can for their children

Joaquín wants to join the organic certification program run by COCAFCAL of which he is a member. The production of certified coffee is something new in the region and novel in that it allows greater profits for the coffee and also helps to protect the biodiversity of the region.

At this time Joaquín wants to convert one hectare to organic production so he needs to buy a variety of materials such as organic manure, organic coffee plants, organic pesticides and pay for labor with the extra profits from his organic plot. Joaquín hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

A loan will help Joaquín to convert his plot to organic production which will allow him to have fixed markets for his coffee at higher prices and will provide sustainability to his coffee growing.

loans.use: to buy organic manure, organic coffee plants, organic pesticides and other materials needed to convert his coffee plantation to organic.

loans.name: Nga'raria Golden Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Antony, 35 years old, married and a father of three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014, where he has undergone various business training that have enabled him to manage his business and use his finances prudently.

He does mixed farming to earn a living. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy piglets in order to improve his farming. He hopes through the profit he will be able to pay school fees for his children and also improve his living standards.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to increase his flock to sell, thus being able to pay school fees,  among other things

loans.name: Ednalita

texts.en:
Ednalita is 60 years old, married.  She has five children.  Ednalita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

Ednalita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ednalita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Santa Rosita De Lima Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Grety continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de chompas entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican a la carpintería, compra y venta de ropa, tienda de abarrotes, venta de muebles, venta de tarjetas telefónicas.
La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
La persona que aparece con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
El socio que sale adjunto a la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Grety is a member of the Santa Rosita de Lima Communal Bank, which is located in the Wanchaq District in the Province of Cusco and the Department of Cusco.

Grety continues working in the business of purchasing and selling clothing. She is a responsible and persevering person, and she continues selling her merchandise to her customers on request. She is a responsible person; she wants to be able to continue working, and in this way, continue supporting her family. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of sweaters, among other items.

The other members work in carpentry, purchasing and selling clothing, a grocery store, furniture sales, and telephone card sales.  She is grateful for this process, which makes the loan possible for her; and she is committed to making her payments. 

The person whose face is covered is not a member of the communal bank, and the person in the attached photo asked to come late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, among other items.

loans.name: Señor De Ccoyllority De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa ella es casada tiene 65 años y tiene 10 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo  de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de llantas, negocio de venta de granos secos y negocio de crianza de animales.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Anta in the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.

The member is Luisa. She is married and is 65 years old. She has 10 children. She alternates her daily activities with the grocery store business. She sells various types of products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others. She is a responsible and dedicated person, and it is in this way that she moves her family forward.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice and sugar, among other items.

The other members sell vegetables, tires, and staple grains, and raise animals.

She thanks those who are a part of this dream through this medium and she promises to make her repayments within the established time.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar, among other items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 52 years old and has one child still in school.

Elizabeth has a personal products business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like body lotion, perfume, bags, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, perfume, bags, beauty soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more staple grains to sell

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
Isaías de 37 años se ha dedicado al cultivo de café desde siempre está casado con Alba Luz desde hace 7 años con la que ha procreado 4 hijos, juntos han luchado por darle lo mejor a sus hijos, Isaias tiene certificados sus cultivos de café con comercio justo y orgánico el cual comercializa atreves de COCAFCAL de la cual es asociado, Isaías anhela poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Isaías quiere hacer de sus cultivos 100% orgánicos porque tiene interés en producir mejor calidad para tener mejores ingresos y así darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos y que ellos puedan gozar de todas las oportunidades que el por situaciones económicas no tuvo y al mismo tiempo cooperar con el medio ambiente.
Un financiamiento ayudaría a Isaías a convertir su finca a producción orgánica y de esta manera lograr mejores mercados para su café.
texts.en:
Isaias is 37 years old and has always dedicated himself to coffee raising. He has been married to Alba Luz for seven years and they have four children. Together, they have struggled to offer the best for their children. 

Isaias has gained the recognition of Just Commerce and seeks Organic standing for his coffee crop. He sells his coffee harvest through COCAFUL, with which he is associated. Isaias hopes to be able to ffer his family a better quality of life.

Isaias wishes to make his crops 100% organic, resulting in a better quality harvest. And this should enable him to have a better income and, thus, provide his children with a better future. Isaias wants them to enjoy the opportunities that, due to his own poor economic situation, he never had. At the same time, he wishes to cooperate in improving the environment.

Financing will help Isaias convert his farm to organic production and in this manner, to achieve improved marketing for his coffee crops.

loans.use: purchase organic manure, coffee plants, organic anti-plague treatments, and other necessary materials for converting his coffee farm to organic.

loans.name: Santhiaba 1 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 23 Mars 2001. Ce groupe est constitué de femmes dynamiques qui exercent le commerce. Madame Diabou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire, âgée de 56 ans et mère d'une fille. Elle s'active dans la vente de jus naturel et de la glace depuis plus de cinq ans. Avec le crédit sollicité elle va acheter 10 sac de pain de singe et 20 litres de miel. Elle a des clients qui lui sont propre et fidèle. Les bénéfices vont servir à acheter de la nourriture et assurer la scolarité de sa fille.
texts.en: The ’banc villageois’ was created on March 23, 2001. This group is composed of energetic women working in commerce. Ms. Diabou, appearing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is the group's representative. She is unmarried, 56 years old, and the mother of a girl. She has been active in selling natural juice drinks and ice for over five years. With this loan requested, she is going to purchase 10 sacks of monkey bread [the fruit of the baobab tree] and 20 liters of honey. She has customers of her own who are loyal. The profits will be used to purchase some food and to ensure her daughter’s school fees are covered.

loans.use: to purchase 'monkey bread' and honey

loans.name: Osias

texts.en:
Osias is 62 years old, married, and has five children. To earn a living and to provide for his children's daily needs, he is engaged in a corn production business. He plants corn and sells it to the market after harvest. He also delivers orders to his loyal customers. As a father he wants to give his children a good life, so he decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for his corn so that he can produce a good quality of corn. If he can deliver more corn in the market, that will result in a larger income.

Osias' plan for the future is to save money to continue providing for his children's educational needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for corn production

loans.name: Niaguis Douma Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 10 Mai 2001. Ce groupé est composé de deux femmes qui exercent le commerce, elles sont solidairement liées et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Léontine qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 50 ans et mère d'une fille de trente ans. Elle s'active dans la vente de tissus teintés depuis plus d'une dizaine d'années. Elle compte acheter avec le prêt sollicité 35 pièces de tissus teintés et 50 pièces ensembles hommes. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge de la nourriture.
texts.en: The ’banc villageois’ was created on May 10, 2001. This group is composed of two women working in commerce. They are bound by solidarity and take out loans they pay back on time. Ms. Léontine, appearing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 50 years old, and the mother of a 30-year-old daughter. Ms. Léontine has been active in selling dyed fabrics for over fifteen years. With the loan requested, she intends to purchase 35 lengths of dyed fabrics and 50 men’s outfits. The profits will be used to help cover food expenses.

loans.use: to purchase dyed fabrics and men's outfits

loans.name: Fulgencio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em gaza tem 33 anos de idade solteiro pai de 1 filho menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em Maputo.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2014. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir um bem para sua casa como: cama.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e contrair matrimónio.
texts.en: Fulgencio was born in Gaza.  He is 33 years old and single.  He has one young son.  He also supports his mother who lives in Maputo. He began working with Hluvuku in 2014.  This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku, which he intends to use to purchase a bed for his house. In the future he hopes to finish building his home and get married.

loans.use: to purchase a bed.

loans.name: Ijobat

texts.en:
Ijobat is an honest woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1973 and is living in village with her family. She is married and has four children. She is one of IMON’s clients who participated at three day training to startup clients. After the training she decided to open a business in the field of agriculture. 

The standard of living and conditions in her area are accessible to keep livestock and do business. She wants to be a business lady. She appealed to IMON and asked a loan to buy livestock to start her business. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy livestock to start her business

loans.name: Msamaria Grp Group

texts.en:
Veronica, aged 33 years old, has blessed with two sons and one daughter who at school. For sixteen years, she has had a shop selling beers,sodas,water and spirits. Working from 08am to midnight daily and able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her second credit from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among MSAMARIA , five members group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She used the previous loan to grow her shop capital (bought more creates of beers,waters,sodas, juice and spirits). Veronica managed to repay back successfully her previous credit. She is really appreciate Kiva's support and wish to see more support from lenders. In the coming years, she would like to open a shop selling electronics items. 

She will invest part of this credit to buy drinks for her shop to resell.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her shop to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Niaguis Douma Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 10 Mai 2001. Ce groupe est composé de vingt femmes qui exercent le commerce et qui se soutiennent mutuellement et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Juliette qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 48 ans et mère de sept enfants dont quatre garçons. Elle s'active dans la teinture depuis très longtemps. Avec le prêt sollicité elle va acheter des produits pour faire la teinture. Elle n'est pas la seule mais elle parvient à écouler progressivement sa production. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge de la scolarité et de la nourriture de sa famille.
texts.en: The ’banc villageois’ was created on May 10, 2001. This group is composed of twenty women working in commerce. They mutually support one another and take out loans they pay back on time. Ms. Juliette, appearing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 48 years old, and the mother of seven children, of whom four are boys. Ms. Juliette has been active in producing dyed fabrics for a long time. With the loan requested, she intends to purchase products for her dyed fabrics. She is not the only one but manages to sell her output progressively. The profits are going to be used to help cover school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase products for making dyed fabrics

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 26 years old, married and supports a family of two children. She has been practicing farming for the last five years earning KES.12,000 per month. 

Everlyne has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erna works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Erna is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items like body lotion, perfume, bags, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Erna has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, perfume, bags, beauty soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to respond to her customers' orders

loans.name: Ivelene

texts.en:
Ivelene is 27 years old and has two children, both of whom attend school. She is married.

Ivelene is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ivelene has been in this business for nine years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old, married, and has six children.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 28 years old and married with two children who are in school, Analie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Analie has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Analie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Yony Arquimedez

texts.es:
Arquímedes es un caficultor casado con Mildred actualmente tiene 3 hijos bajo su cargo,  los cuales depende en un 100% de los ingresos que Arquímedes obtiene de sus fincas, los ingresos de Arquímedes dependen totalmente del café que produce bajo distintos sellos de certificación y que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, Arquímedes está decidido a convertir su producción a orgánica para lo cual la mejor opción es plantar de nuevo su cafetal.
El sueño de Arquímedes es darle a sus hijos un buen ejemplo de cómo trabajar las tierras respetando la vida de los animales y plantas es por eso que según nos cuenta no lo detiene nada para iniciar la conversión a orgánico.
El quiere convertir el 100% de sus cafetales a la producción orgánica y además de proteger la biodiversidad obtendrá mejores mercados y precios para su café.
Un crédito ayudara a Arquímedes para comprar todo lo necesario en la conversión a orgánico como ser; plantas de café, abonos orgánicos, insecticidas y fungicidas orgánicos. La producción de café orgánico le permitirá obtener mejores ganancias por su café y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Arquímedes and his wife, Mildred, have 3 children, all of whom live at home.  He owns a coffee-growing business and his family is 100% dependent on his income.  The coffee is subject to different certifications and marketed by COCAFCAL, an organization to which Arquímedes belongs.  

Arquímedes wants to switch to organic farming and is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the plants and supplies he needs: coffee plants, organic fertilizers, etc.  The investment will both open new markets for his crop and protect the region's biodiversity.  

Arquímedes wants to show his children that it is possible to work the land and still protect native plants and animals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his organic coffee business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Raziais 47, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store.  Due to his good behavior; he has built up very good relations among his customers. Due to good relationships his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and assures that she will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a third year student at the Medical University studying dentistry.  Her mother is a dentist. She looks after her mother and wishes to be dentist like her. 

She appealed to IMON to get a loan to pay her tuition fee of studies. She is willing to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: To pay her higher education costs for her studies in dentistry

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Thirty-six year old Jenalyn is a married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 12 while the youngest is 4 year old. Her husband works in a private company.
She is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari(variety) store. It sells a variety of commodities ranging from eggs, milk, noodles, bread, soy sauce, chips, tooth paste, shampoo, matches, cooking oil and soft drinks. 

Jenalyn has requested a loan to buy assorted goods like coffee, insect repellent,salt, and seasonings. It will attract potential customers and enable to boost its income.  In thus way, she could provide her family with good food and better shelter to live  with.

She  dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods like coffee, insect repellent,salt, and seasonings

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 58 years old, married with nine children.

Jovita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

Jovita has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jovita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Libertad

texts.en:
Libertad is 59 years old, married with five children.

Libertad works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

Libertad has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Libertad aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 51 years old and married with six children, two of whom in school, Elsie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc.

Elsie has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Elsie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: La señora Gladis siempre mantuvo la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida con trabajo y esfuerzo junto a su conyugue y así poder mantener a su familia y apoyar a su esposa con su negocio que pueda ayudar economicamente a sustentar a su familia de tres hijos pequeños que depende de ellos, su esposo cuenta con un trabajo en el cual en muchos de los casos tiene que realizar un viaje largo por el cual en ocaciones los trabajos de su esposo hace que le paguen despues de un mes o dos meses por lo que la mantención de sus hijos y otros gastos hace que tengan un ingreso mensual que apoye esa deficiencia de ingresos de su esposo y asi ayudar a su consumo familiar, la señora se dedica a la venta de chicharon de credo en la zona Pacta Alta, la señora se siente muy feliz de poder tener un negocio propio y actualmente con la demanda que cuenta busca préstamo y así aumentar sus ventas, al poder contar con el préstamo ella podrá incrementar sus ventas y asi tener mas ingresos que puedan contribuir a su mejora economicamente a su entorno familiar y asi seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Gladis always maintained the hope of improving her quality of life with work and effort with her spouse, and of being able to provide for her family and support her husband with her business that could help financially to sustain her family of three small children who depend on them. Her husband has a job in which he often has to take a long trip. Due to this, her husband's jobs occasionally pay him after one or two months. In order to provide for their children and for other expenses, they have to have a monthly income that supports this deficiency in her husband's income and thus helps with her family's consumption. She sells chicharron (pork cracklings) in the area of Pacta Alta. She is very happy to be able to have her own business and currently with the demand she has she is looking for a loan and to increase her sales with it. When she can count on the loan she will be able to increase her sales and in this way have more income that can contribute to her family's financial improvement. In this way she will continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies and cooking materials to increase her sales and improve her family's quality of life

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 52-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her son owns a clothing business, his practice is to buy clothing from wholesalers and sells it to the local people from his shop. He has good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his clothing to the other people which become the cause of his advertisement.

Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy more clothing to fulfill the demand.
She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment record. She has already been taking loans from BRAC and been using according to family needs. 

She hopes that the savings will much increase and she will arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. This time she want to help her son so he can buy new fashion and colorful cloth for reselling purpose.

Nasreen dreams for the bright future of her son, establishment of business and for a better living standard of her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new fashion and colorful cloth for her son's clothing business.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melodia works hard to support her family.

She has a welding shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from boarding house renting. Melodia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like iron, plane sheet, welding rod, etc for her welding shop business.

Melodia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like iron, plane sheet, welding rod, etc

loans.name: Jaquelyn Roxana

texts.es: Jaquelyn de 44 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, perfumes, talcos, entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres  hijos quienes estudian actualmente. Jaquelyn desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito a FUSAI que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, etc., ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su hijo lo que necesitan en el hogar.
texts.en: Jaquelyn, 44 years old, sells all kinds of personal products such as lotions, deodorants, creams, perfume, and talc, among other things. Her business is located in her place of residence and with the profits she obtains from her sales she is able to cover the expenses of her household. She lives in her own house with her partner and her three children who are currently students. Jaquelyn wants to expand her business, so she is asking FUSAI for a loan that will allow her to buy everything necessary such as perfume, nail polish, deodorants, etc., since she has a lot of customers because she provides her products at accessible prices. With the help requested, she will be able to obtain better profits, and in this way she will continue to give her children what they need at home.

loans.use: to buy perfume, nail polish, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Jikomboe Grp Group

texts.en:
Daniel is married and has got six children, three girls and boys who are still schooling. For eight years he has supported his family by running a pharmacy selling human medicines. He starts working from 07am to 04pm daily and is able to make a great profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his second credit request to be apportioned among JIKOMBOE, five members group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous credit, paid back in full, to buy medicines for his pharmacy. 

In the coming years, Daniel would like to open another classic pharmacy in another area. 
With this new credit request, Daniel will used to buy medicines for his pharmacy to service more people. He will be so thankful with someone will find a way to support his business and group.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his pharmacy to serve more people

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
For more than 10 years, Erlinda operates a sari-sari( variety) store. She sells merchandise like  biscuits, noodles, flour, sugar, powdered milk, shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs and soft drinks.  She is a 39-year-old married woman with three children ages 8, 5 and 2 year old respectively. She comes from Talibon, Bohol.  Her husband has an income that could help defray the families daily expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks and groceries.  These would attract more buyers to come and it would help augment her income. In addition to that, it boost the content of her store and cater the needs of her respective customers.  Erlinda could now start to settle her obligations and able to expand her existing business. Thus, she could continue provide the needs of her growing children including quality education.

Erlinda is very determined that in the near future, she will be successful in her chosen field.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to supply his the area with his motorcycle for more income gain.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is 67 years old and a widow whose husband has already passed away. She is with her two children now.

To be able to provide for the needs of her children, she decided to engage in hog raising.

Erminda aims to grow her income, and she has decided to borrow a loan to purchase feed and buy another pig.

Erminda's plan for the future is to save money to sustain her children's educational needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and buy another pig.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is 60 years old, married and supports a family of three children. She has been practicing farming for the last three years earning KES.15,000 per month. 

Teresiah has applied for her first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Hector Abraham

texts.es:
Héctor es un agricultor de 23 años, casado con Jeidy Marilu con quien han procreado un hijo, Héctor se dedica a la producción de café, el tiene 8 años de experiencia en el rubro y a adoptado el café como su principal fuente de ingresos, Héctor sueña con darles a sus hijos una educación de calidad que puedan tener las oportunidades que él no ah tenido y que crezcan con la calidad de vida que es digna.
La producción de café bajo sellos de certificación orgánica y comercio justo son algo novedoso en la región ya que los sellos dan un valor agregado al producto, además de ser cafés especiales , la comercialización es más fácil y se colabora con la conservación del medio ambiente. Héctor nos dice: “Lo mejor que le podemos heredar a nuestros hijos es un planeta sano y una buena educación” y es por ello que Héctor está motivado a trabajar sus cultivos como cultivos orgánicos. 
Héctor solicita un crédito para convertir 0.75 hectáreas de cafetal a producción orgánica para lo que él necesita  replantar en su totalidad cafetal y aprovechando que las fincas están deterioradas por la edad y las plagas este es el momento oportuno, con la conversión a orgánico Héctor obtendrá mejores un precios por su café y asegura mercado para su cosecha, con las ganancias de su café Héctor quiere ahorrar para la educación de su hijo. 
Héctor solicita un crédito para comprar todo lo necesario en la conversión a orgánico de su cafetal, como ser: Plantas de café, Abonos orgánicos, insumos orgánicos, y pago de mano de obra. 
El crédito le permitirá a Héctor tener la posibilidad de dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y brindar una buena preparación académica a su hijo.
texts.en:
Héctor, 23, and his wife, Jeidy Marilu, have one child.  Héctor has been a farmer for 8 years and coffee has become his major crop and main source of income.  Héctor hopes to give his children good educations so that they can have opportunities that he himself never had.  

Growing coffee according to certification guidelines is new here.  The certifications give added value to coffee and make marketing and selling coffee easier when they show a commitment to environmentally-sound practices.  "The best that we can do for our children is give them good educations and leave them a healthy planet", says Héctor.  He wants, consequently, to switch to organic farming and is applying for a loan that he will use to convert 0.75 hectares of exhausted land to organic coffee production.  The commitment will require that he replant the land.  The investment will both reclaim old land and ensure that he gets a higher price for his future crop.  The extra earnings, in turn, will allow Héctor to save for his children's educations.  

Héctor will pay for labor, organic coffee plants and other supplies for converting land to organic farming.

loans.use: to buy plants and supplies for his organic coffee business.

loans.name: Bella Celina

texts.en:
Bella Celina is  years old, married with one children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell recycle materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more recycled materials to sell.

Bella Celina has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell recycle materials for 23 years and also earns an income from tailoring and raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the labor and materials she needs to improve her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply to increase his income.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hard working mother residing in Talibon, Bohol. She is a 46 year old married woman with seven dependents. Her oldest child is 20 and the youngest is 8. She makes pots from cement and sells them to the locals in her place. She has been in the pottery business for 3 years now. Her husband earns a living by being a private driver.

She lacks additional funds to finance her ongoing source of income. She is asking for a loan to buy materials like cement and paint. These could help Corazon produce and sell more volume of pots. Thus, she will be able to cater for the orders of her customers and she will also be able to roll out her capital. With this, she could provide her children with healthy food and be able to support their basic needs.

Corazon hopes that her existing business will be properly manage and she would like also to expand her business for sustainable living in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement and paint for her flower pot making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional dry goods for her store for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing merchandise that will help her to expand her business to have a better income that will help the daily life of her family.

loans.name: Aruela

texts.en:
Aruela is 41 years old and married with four children who are in school, Aruela works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Aruela has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Aruela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Melogina

texts.en:
Melogina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melogina is 55 years old and has two children who are in school.

Melogina has a vehicle repairs business in the Philippines. Melogina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Melogina has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Melogina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 E

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Hla (pictured second from the right), is 36 years old, married, and supports a family of six (four children). All of his children are in school, and he wants to support them through school till they graduate.

Proximity's loan will help him purchase supplies for his crop farm such as fertilizer and crop seeds. Furthermore, Hla wants to expand his farm by the end of the year. He owns a few acres where he plants both rice and vegetables. He also wants to buy his own cropping machine so that it will make farming easier and more efficient. 

Pictured above are the members from Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 E, named Khin,Chin, Shwe, Aung and Aung. A CBO leader oversees all the members, and the fund will help each member purchase supplies for his farm such as fertilizers and rice. 

Hta Ni Pat Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his crop farm such as fertilizer and crop seeds.

borrowers.first_name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 E

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 52 years old and married with four children. Juditha works very hard to provide for them.

Juditha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Juditha has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Juditha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norma is 48 years old now.

Norma has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Norma has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Simeona is 53 years old and has nine children. Simeona is married and has three children who are in school.

Simeona is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Simeona requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Simeona has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Simeona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Muminamo

texts.en: Muminamo is a bright and gentle woman. She was in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in the district with her family. She is divorced and has two children. She works at a beauty and wedding salon. She decorates the bride. Her income is good to feed and ensure her children. Her mother is old and sick. She is willing to treat her in a hospital. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking financial support to treat her mother in a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her mother in a medical clinic.

loans.name: Santhiaba 1 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 23 Mars 2001. Ce groupe est composé de femmes dynamiques qui exercent l'activité commerciale. Madame Fanta qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 37 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont trois garçons et deux filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de produits divers depuis plus de sept ans. Avec le crédit sollicité elle va acheter beaucoup de marchandises cosmétiques à des quantité variées. Elle fait la livraison à domicile et elle à des clients qui lui sont fidèles. Les bénéfices vont servir à payer la scolarité et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was inaugurated on March 23, 2001. The group consists of dynamic women who practice commercial activities. 

Mrs. Fanta is the group’s representative. She is seen raising her hand on the right in the photo. She is a 37-year-old married mother to five children, three boys and two girls. She has been selling various goods for over seven years. 

She will use this loan to buy a large supply of diverse cosmetic products to sell. She offers home delivery to her loyal customer base. 

She plans to use her profits to pay her children’s tuition fees and healthcare costs.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marina has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell to her customers.

Marina has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is 50 years old and married with four children.

Miraflor works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

Miraflor has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling bamboo.

Miraflor aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Awa est celle qui est au milieu et a une main levée auprès de son sac de graine de néré. Elle est une veuve de, et a  5 enfants. Elle achète des graines de néré dans le marché local qu’elle transforme en condiment (Soumbala). Elle fait recourt a RMCR pour l’épanouissement de ses activités, elle achète les graines de néré quand c’est moins chère, les stocker et puis les transformer petit à petit en "soumbala" pour vendre. Elle a 07 ans d’expériences. En vue de développer  son activité et avoir plus de profit et pour mieux entretenir ses enfants, elle a pris un prêt selon le besoin.
NB:la personne supplémentaire est membre du groupe, c'est la dame arrêtée par derrière a coté de la fenêtre un peu masquée par les autres.Elle n'a pas reçu une partie du prêt cette fois ci.
texts.en:
Awa is the woman in the middle of the photo with her hand raised, standing next to a bag of locust bean seeds. She is a widowed mother to five children. She purchases locust bean seeds at market then transforms them into a common West African condiment known as Soumbala. Awa has turned to RMCR so she can develop her business. She purchases locust bean seeds when they are cheaper, stocks them then gradually transforms them in Soumbala, which she then resells. She has seven years of experience doing this. In order to develop her business, earn more profit and better meet her children's needs, she has taken out this loan. 

PS. The extra person in the photo is a group member. She's the one next to the window, a bit hidden by the other women. She is not profiting from the loan this time.

loans.use: to purchase locust bean seeds to transform and resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a tortilla griddle that will let him improve his mother's quality of life a bit

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 37 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, who are attending school. She is a housewife taking care of her adored family.  Her husband is the main income source in family. 

With her third loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her children’s educational fees. She insists that she will be a permanent customer as her only goal is to guarantee an excellent educational path for her children in a friendly environment.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Precille

texts.en:
Precille is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Precille has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Precille has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mariannie

texts.en:
Mariannie is 35 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mariannie has a business direct selling Personal Collection products in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from Personal Collection to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mariannie has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Personal Collection to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Jerome is 19 years old and is the fourth of six children in the family. His mother Merlinda, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Jerome is studying for an Associate in Computer Technology degree and is currently in his first year of this two-year course.

Merlinda is borrowing PHP 7,000 to pay tuition fees for her son Jerome for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

Jerome plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Miguela works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Miguela is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell to her customers for her fruit vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Miguela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 53 years old married with four children. She lives in a urban community within Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She owns and operates a small general store selling varieties of food items and household items, and has been doing this for four years.

Lydia requested a loan to buy frozen meats and drinks for her general store. She plan to use her profits to help covers for her family's weekly expenses and also meet her children school fees.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: A loan of $10000 helps Lydia buy chicken wings, minced meat, sausages, soup meat and canned drinks for her general store.

loans.name: Noong Het 16 Group

texts.en:
Thi, 37, has been married and become the mother of two daughters. Currently, she lives in an old Thai ethnic traditional house with her in-laws, her husband and her children. They mainly rely on agricultural production for a living with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice, breeding buffalo, pigs, chickens, ducks and fish.

Thi is a hardworking farmer and she has always tried to expand her animal husbandry. This is the fourth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish to develop fish farming. She hopes that with the training and counseling provided by the Program's staff, her investment will go smoothly and she will gain a good income to provide better for the family.

Thi dreams that she and her husband can build a new house and her children will have a more abundant life. In the picture, she is standing first on the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish to develop fish farming

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 32 years old and married with one child.

Rosana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

Rosana has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rosana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Elder Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio es un agricultor de 30 años dedicado hace ya más de 20 años a la producción de café con valores agregados como ser sellos de certificación(comercio justo y Amigable con los pájaros) y métodos de procesamiento especiales. Mauricio está casado con Indira, El sueña con poder tener dos hijos y poderles proporcionar todo lo necesario para que tengan vida digna.
La producción de café bajo normas de certificación es una novedad en el rubro del café ya que hace el cultivo más sostenible porque ayuda a obtener mejores precios por el café y hace el cultivo amigable con el ambiente, es por esta razón que Mauricio quiere certificar sus cafetales con el sello de certificación orgánico, la producción orgánica garantiza un mercado especial para el café.
En este momento Mauricio está solicitando un crédito para poder llevar a cabo las labores de conversión a orgánico, con las ganancias obtenidas por su café orgánico vendido en mercados especiales por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio el espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y hacer un pequeño ahorro para ir formando una base de patrimonio para su vida.
Un crédito ayudara a Mauricio a obtener mejores mercados para su café y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia así como también a prepararse para poder brindarle una buena educación a lo hijos que sueña tener.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a 30-year-old farmer who has produced coffee for more than 20 years, with added value such as certification seals (fair trade and bird-friendly) and special processing methods. Mauricio is married to Indira. He dreams of having two children and being able to give them everything necessary for them to have a dignified life.

Production of coffee under certification standards is a new development in the coffee industry, since it makes the crop more sustainable because it helps to obtain better prices for the coffee and makes the crop friendly to the environment. It is for this reason that Mauricio wants to get his coffee plantations certified with the organic certification seal. Organic production guarantees a special market for the coffee.

At this time Mauricio is asking for a loan in order to be able to perform the work to convert to organic. With the profits obtained from his organic coffee sold in special markets through COCAFCAL, of which he is a member, he hopes to be able to improve his family's quality of life and save a little to continue forming a base of wealth for his life.

A loan will help Mauricio to obtain better markets for his coffee and to improve his family's quality of life as well as to prepare himself to provide a good education for the children he dreams of having.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, coffee plants, organic pest control products, organic insecticides, and other materials necessary for his coffee plantation's conversion to organic

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Sheila signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Sheila is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en: Emelie is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 34 years old, married, and has a snack vending business in Bonifacio-Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month. Recently, Emelie availed a loan to purchase Nipa thatch for roofing. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase Nipa thatch for roofing

loans.name: Redgin

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Redgin works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Redgin, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 35000 to purchase fishing materials including a fish net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat for the maintenance for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials including a fish net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Virgen Asunta De Limatambo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal VIRGEN ASUNTA DE LIMATAMBO; este banco está situado en el distrito de Limatambo  en la provincia  de Anta departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luisa es casada  tiene 02 hijos y tiene 61 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años en este su negocio administrándolo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank Virgen Asunta de LImatambo, this bank is located in Limatambo district in Anta province, Cusco department. 

The member Luisa is 61 years old, is married and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her convenience store, and also her administrative business in which she has spent years. This is going well thanks to the security deposit she she puts against her business every day. The partner is responsible and persevering, which helps her move her family forward. 

The partner is seeking the loan to buy rice and sugar amongst other things.

The members in general feel grateful for the given credit and they promise to meet the established payments. 

The partner is in the attached photo, asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work reasons.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar amongst other things

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 57 years old, married, has 7 children of which 2 are at school-age and 5 at adult age. He lives in Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He owns and operates a rice field that gives him a lump income of 50,000 PHP per cropping period.

Through this business activity, Victor is able to provide the needs of his family, especially for their schooling. Recently, he availed himself of a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase rice seeds that will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is 34 years old, married, has 4 children of school age and lives in Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.

She is enthusiastic in her farming activity and nurtures her farm with passion. No wonder that through her farming activity, she gains income of 45,000 PHP per cropping period. Recently, she availed herself of another loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for land preparation and purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 59 years old and married with five children. Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Salvacion has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, detergent soap, candies, biscuits, etc. 

Salvacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Osvaldo Antonio

texts.es:
Osvaldo, es casado, en su hogar aún no hay hijos, vive únicamente con su pareja, es propietario de una pupusería, la cual está funcionando desde hace un año, aprendió a administrar un negocio con ayuda de su familia, su esposa trabaja junto a él para ir generando los ingresos que necesitan para subsistir.
Invertirá en quesillo, chicharrón, harina, bebidas, condimentos, etc., para elaborar la venta de pupusas, pretende fortalecer su negocio para atraer nuevos clientes y asegurarse de tener nuevos ingresos y así resarcir su deuda.
Osvaldo tiene como finalidad seguir trabajando para tener un negocio más grande y así compartir con su esposa un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Osvaldo is married, he lives together with his partner and they don't have kids. His is the owner of a pupusa shop, which has been open for a year. He learned to run a business with the help of his family. His partner works together with him to generate the income they need to survive. 

He will invest in cheese tortillas, pork rind, flour, drinks, condiments etc, in or to expand his sales of pupusas. He wants to strengthen his business to attract new clients and guarantee having new income and therefore reduce his debt. 

Osvaldo hopes as his end goal to have a bigger business and therefore have a more respectable life for him and his wife.

loans.use: To invest in cheese tortillas, pork rind, flour, drinks, condiments etc. to expand his sales of pupusas (corn tortilla)

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is a 46-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has had a weaving business in the Philippines for 18 years, 

Virgincita has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Yollanda

texts.en:
Yollanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years.  She earns additional income from operating a general store. 

Yollanda is requesting a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase ingredients for her food vending business. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 19-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. Her father is the family’s main source of income. Alaa' herself is pursuing her education at university.

Alaa' is in need of a loan from Kiva's field partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the tuition for her summer courses. She is planning for future work at a proper company to gain good experience in her field. She also wants to earn enough income to help her parents with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for her summer courses.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old, married and manages a farming business together with her husband. When they got married, they already managed a one-hectare rice field to earn a living.

Virginia wanted to nourish their crop but had insufficient funds to sustain it. She is now asking for an agricultural loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming. She hopes to achieve a better harvest to save funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. There she has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to cater to her tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 44 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Aileen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.  Aileen has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Alba Elizabeth

texts.es:
Alba, ha tenido un resultado positivo al invertir el crédito anterior en la venta de tortillas que posee, ya cuenta con empleados que salen a vender el producto, sus ingresos son más estables y su núcleo familiar se mantiene igual.
Está solicitando un crédito que en esta oportunidad lo invertirá en bloques, arena, cemento, hierro y además pagara mano de obra para mejorar el local en que trabaja, espera realizar sus actividades con mayor comodidad para ella y para sus.
texts.en:
Alba has had positive results after she invested her previous loan in the tortilla-selling business she has. Now, she has employees who go out and sell her product, her income is more stable, and her family nucleus remains the same.

She is requesting a loan which she will use to invest in cement blocks, sand, cement, iron, and to pay for the labor costs of improving the venue in which she works. With these improvements, she hopes to be able to perform her work with a greater degree of comfort.

loans.use: to invest in cement blocks, sand, cement, iron, and to pay for the labor of improving the venue in which she works.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Nen is a farmer lives in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province where she does her farming business and she is a married mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her. Nen has a child who is in school and needs her to support the studying. She has been growing dry season rice to earn the main source of family’s income. At the same time, she is weaving the mat to sell in market to earn additional income. Her 10-year-old rice farming business was threatened by the pests so that she cannot get good outputs from business. 

She is now requesting for a loan of 4,000,000KHR to save her endangered farming business. The loan will be used to pay for plowing fee, buy rice seeds, organic fertilizers and to buy fishing tackle so that she can perform the job better. She hopes to earn and save more money to improve the living standard and send her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fee, buy rice seeds, organic fertilizers and to buy fishing tackle so that she can perform the job better.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly, 56, is a farmer living in Kam Rieng district of Battambang province and a married mother of seven children, three of whom are dependent on her. Growing cassava has been her main business for ages, and it is the main source of her family’s income. Meanwhile, to earn additional income, she is a paid worker. 

Ly lacks capital to enhance her business and so is leading a group of five to take out a new loan. This will be her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); the previous one, which resulted in improved living standards and made her house more comfortable, has been repaid. Ly will use her loan portion to pay for her plowing fee and to buy cassava seeds so that she can increase her crop production. 

Ly hopes to earn more income to support her living conditions and buy more organic fertilizers to enrich her farmland.

loans.use: to pay for her plowing fee and to buy cassava seeds .

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sophea is 28 years old and a married mother of a dependent child who is in school. She has been growing cassava on a hectare area of farmland to earn the main source of income for eight years. In her spare time, she works on her co-villager's farm for a fee to earn additional income. As the cassava was unhealthy, it produced lower outputs with 20,800KHR of daily income. 

This is the fourth cycle that she applies for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For the past loan, which she repaid back successfully, enabled her to improve living standard and provide her family with proper clothes. By the way, the loan of 4,000,000KHR will be used to buy organic fertilizers to increase the crop products.  She hopes that her cassava farming business can produce more yields and earn more income to her to update the standard of living and buy additional plot of farmland.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to increase the crop products.

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre joven de 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de ingeniería comercial. 
Él es inteligente, comprometido, constante, sincero y muy responsable. Sus estudios lo realiza en una universidad ubicada en la zona de ‘Obrajes’ que es la cabecera de valle de Río Abajo y se encuentra a unos cinco kilómetros del centro de la ciudad, a 3.200 metros sobre el nivel del mar. En la zona están la Cárcel de Mujeres y la Universidad, una piscina y varias residencias diplomáticas. Cuenta con centros de salud y varias unidades educativas, entre otras.
Jose es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia inglés y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que trabajan independientemente, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado.
