Él estudia la carrera de ingeniería comercial y se encuentra en 4 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta la mejora continua tanto en el ámbito personal como en donde se relacione, su espíritu es emprendedor e innovador, fundamentalmente para los negocios, su carácter es de servicio, "estudiar este rubro me otorgó aptitudes que antes para mi eran desconocidas, también me entregó herramientas para mi superación personal y preparación laboral…” comenta. La ventaja de sus estudios es que ya se encuentra en los últimos años, la desventaja es la falta de capital para el pago del semestre completo. Su sueño es salir profesional para abrir su propia empresa de publicidad, él desea realizar el pago de las cuotas del semestre de su carrera por adelantado para conseguir un descuento. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 año que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su universidad por adelantado y recibir un descuento.
texts.en:
Jose is a 21 year old youth, he is single, without kids and studies commercial engineering. 
He is intelligent, committed, persevering, sincere and very responsible. He studies at a university located in the Obrajes zone which is at the head of the River Abajo valley and is 5km from the city centre, 3200m above sea level. In this zone there is the the women's prison, the university and several diplomatic residents. It has several health centres and education institutes, amongst other things. 

Jose is dark skinned, has brown eyes, black hair, short stature and is thin. His mother tongue is Aymara which he no longer speaks because he studies English and speaks Spanish generally. 
He parents work independently, they live in their own house built of bricks and cement with an iron roof and wooden floor, they have running water, electricity and a sewage system. 
He studies commercial engineering and is in his 4th out of 5 years. He enjoys helping people which he wants to carry on doing. He has an enterprising spirit, which is key for business. 

The advantage of his studies is that he is already doing well, the problem is the lack of money to pay the full semester. His dream is to start his own publicity company, he wishes to pay the semesters fees to carry on moving forward and to receive a discount. 
This is the first loan he has taken with the uni in 4 years. For the reason he is asking for a loan to pay his fees to receive a discount.

loans.use: to pay his university fees to move forward and receive a discount

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 29,500.00 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers for her vegetables vending business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 63 years old and married with four children. For the past five years she has operated a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Asuncion requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, detergent, soap, noodles, etc. to sell. She is working to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her sari-sari

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops to get a better harvest for family use and to sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Barrio Las Abas Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad apacible con orígenes en la cultura mazahua viven las integrantes del grupo Barrio Las Abas, todas ellas caracterizadas por su amor al trabajo en equipo. Su localidad está muy retirada de la ciudad por lo que es indispensable conocer los horarios de transporte de lo contrario se debe recorrer muchos kilómetros a pie. Las actividades que rigen la economía local son la agricultura y la cría de animales. 
   Todo el grupo se encuentra satisfecho ya que sus miembros podrán invertir en cada uno de sus negocios. Ellos son Leonor, María Angélica y Lucia quienes invertirán en una tienda de abarrotes mientras que María del Carmen, Ma. Francisca, Ma. Aurelia y Laura, en ganado ovino.
   Por su parte Doña Alejandra tiene trece años dedicados a la cría de ovejas con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos familiares. Junto con su esposo José Luis quien trabaja en la construcción mantienen a sus cuatro hijos estudiantes. La principal motivación para que decidiera realizar dicha actividad es que en su comunidad es sencillo cuidar el ganado gracias a la abundancia de alimento animal. Una vez que los borregos obtienen el peso ideal los vende con las personas dedicadas a cocinar un platillo muy tradicional: la barbacoa. Actualmente cuenta con dos ejemplares, no obstante no le son suficientes ya que la demanda crece gradualmente y necesita tanto ampliar su corral como comprar más alimento. “Realmente estamos muy agradecidas porque gracias al préstamo vamos a comprar más borregos y lograr nuestro sueños” comentó Doña Alejandra quien comparte su actividad con otras integrantes. 
    Ahora bien, la experiencia, el buen trato y el mejor manejo de sus ganancias han logrado que no tenga ningún inconveniente con su negocio. Aprovecha, por ejemplo, el pasto que crece en el campo y todas las tardes lleva a sus animales a que coman de él.
   *La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras debajo del quiosco municipal. Doña Alejandra es quien porta el sombrero.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Barrio Las Abas” live in a quiet community with origins in the Mazahua culture; the members are characterized by their love of teamwork. Their village is located in a remote area far away from the city so it is essential to know the bus schedule, otherwise, the villagers have to walk a lot of kilometers. The principal local economic activities are agriculture and animal husbandry.

The whole group is very grateful with the loan because its members will be able to invest it in their businesses. Leonor, Maria Angelica and Lucia will invest in a grocery store while María del Carmen, Ma. Francisca, Ma. Aurelia and Laura, will invest in sheep.

Alejandra, another member of the group, has been dedicated to sheep farming for thirteen years in order to support the expenses of her family. Together, she and her husband, José Luis, who works in construction, support their four children, all of whom are in school. Alejandra’s main motivation for dedicating herself to sheep farming is that in her community is easy to take care of the cattle and sheep thanks to the abundance of the food needed for these animals. Once the sheep gain the ideal weight, she sells them to people who cook a traditional dish called “barbacoa.” Currently, Alejandra has two sheep but they are not sufficient because the demand is gradually growing and she needs both expand the sheep yard and buy more food for them. "We're really grateful because thanks to the loan we will buy more sheep and achieve our dreams," said Alejandra who shares this activity with other group members.

With her experience, and better management of her business and earnings, Alejandra has not had any problem with it. For example, she takes advantage of the grass that is growing in the land and every afternoon takes her animals to eat from it.
   
* The photograph was taken on the stairs at the bottom of the local kiosk. Alejandra is the woman wearing  a hat.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Cerenia

texts.en:
Cerenia is 56 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Cerenia works very hard to provide for them.

Cerenia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Cerenia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, cereals, soft drinks, biscuits, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Noong Luong 29 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thien, 29, is a Thai ethnic woman who has been married and the mother of two sons. She lives in a Thai ethnic traditional house with her in-laws, her husband and her children. Mrs. Thien and her husband are the main work labor who earn income for the family. They work at farming and breeding with several activities such as cultivating rice, breeding buffalo, pig, chicken and fish. Despite hard work, their income is unstable and limits their spending. For that reason, Mrs. Thien has tried to expand and increase production. 

This is the fifth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish to develop fish farming. She hopes her investment will bring good income and gradually improve living conditions for her family. Mrs. Thien dreams for a more abundant life for her family and a brighter future for her children. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish to develop fish farming

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 41 years old. He is married and blessed with two children; both are in school.

He has borrowed a loan to buy food to sell at his hotel hoping this will generate income.

He has been in business for five years.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to pay school fees and expand the current business.

loans.use: to purchase food

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon is 57 years old, married and supports a family of 2 children. He has been practicing farming for the last 3 years earning KES 12,000 per month. 

Zablon has applied for KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 41-year-old single woman. Her father represents the main income source for the family in order to fulfill their family needs and always be ready to meet their demands. As for her, she produces homemade foods to help him. Today, in order to pay her sister's study fees, she is applying for a new loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to help her sister and ensure her a suitable educational path.

loans.use: to pay her sister's study fees.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is a clever woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1963. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has three children. She has four years of experience working at a trading center as a cleaning woman. She does her job very well and gets employee satisfaction from her duty. She is sick and feels bad. She is asking financial support from KIVA lenders to pay for her treatment at a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her treatment at a medical clinic

loans.name: Druscilla

texts.en:
Druscilla is 53 years old and married. She supports a family of four children.

She has been operating her salon for the last 10 years, earning KES 8,000 per month.

Druscilla has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production as well as add more stock of hair products.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to produce enough food for the family.

Druscilla's future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and more stock of hair products.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 32 years old, married to Rachael, and supports a family of three children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport for the last seven years, earning KES.4,600 per month.

Charles has applied for his first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for additional income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to produce more food for the family. His future hope and plan is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for additional income gain.

loans.name: Winfrida

texts.en:
Winfrida is 38 years and she supports seven children. She has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns her KES 6,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops so she can get a better harvest for family use, and the surplus she will sell in the market. 

She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to pay school fees for her children. Her hope is to educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus for in the market.

loans.name: Resse

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Resse works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Resse is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Resse has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. Ashot is a pedagogue with many years of experience in this field and now he also works at the school as a teacher of mathematics. He also has pupils who attend private courses at his house, getting prepared for the entrance exams.

Ashot likes his occupation and his pupils as well; he is eager to give knowledge and help them if they have any hardships in their learning process. Ashot is married and he lives with his wife, son and daughter (she is also a pedagogue).

Ashot asks this loan as he wants to buy a computer, accessories for it, and also professional literature in order organize his private courses properly and be more interesting for his pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it, and also professional literature in order organize his private courses properly and be more interesting.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional varieties of fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old, married with two children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, candies, eggs, etc. to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, candies, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Vannra

texts.en:
Vannra, who is a farmer living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, is 29-years-old and she is a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and the other one is too young to attend school. Cassava growing has been her main business for eleven years already. She is also growing paddy rice to supplement the family’s income. As the crops price declined, she can earn little income than before. 

This is Vannra's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and the loan that she is applying for will be used to pay for the plowing fee and to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizers to apply to her farmland, which are hopefully expected to increase the crop products. She hopes to earn more income to maximize the business and to provide better health care to her children.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizers to apply to her farmland.

loans.name: Sophol

texts.en:
Sophol is a 29-year-old married factory worker with a grown-up child. She resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has worked in the factory since 2007. Her husband is 27 years old and he is factory worker as well. Together, they can make around 14 USD per day. 

Now Sophol would like to request a loan to buy more farmland for her mother to cultivate rice. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy more farmland and gain more rice crops. In the future, Sophol is going to save money to open a small tailor shop, build a proper house and support her child to go to higher education.

loans.use: to buy more farmland for her mother to cultivate rice

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.ru:
На фотографии Нигинамо и ее дочка. Нигинамо 41 год. Она мать одиночка. У нее двое детей. Ее дочке красавице 17 лет, а сыну 11 лет. Нигинамо очень ответственно относится к воспитанию детей и образованию. Она одна зарабатывает и обеспечивает детей.
  Ее дочка имеет проблемы со здоровьем. Ей необходимо сделать операцию. Нигинамо накопила денег, но еще не хватает $650. Уже назначена дата операции и Нигинамо надеется, что сможет получить финансовую поддержку, чтобы не перенести операцию. Поддержите Нигинамо и ее дочь.
texts.en:
This photograph shows Niginamo and her daughter. Niginamo is 41 years old. She is a single mother. She has two children. Her beautiful daughter is 17 years old, and son is 11 years old. Niginamo treats her children's upbringing and education very responsibly. She is the sole income earner and provider for her children.

Her daughter has health problems and needs to have a surgery. Niginamo saved money, but is short $650. The date for the surgery has already been set, and Niginamo hopes that she will be able to obtain financial support prior to the surgery date. Please support Niginamo and her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's surgery

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old married father of two children who has been running his cafe since 2011. He is well known in his region for his good reputation and hard work. Ali is his family's sole breadwinner, and he is working hard to develop his business to make sure he can take care of his family's increasing needs.

Ali is acquiring a 1,500 USD Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a hockey table for his cafe, which will increase his business income and attract more customers. He is planning to continue developing his business in a well-managed way so that in the future he can open his own amusement center.

loans.use: To buy a hockey table for his cafe

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru: Башорату 57 лет. Она замужем за шофера. Башорат всю жизнь посвятила семье, детям. Башорат много лет хотела открыть свой маленький бизнес. Долгое время ей этого не удавалось. Теперь она поставила себе цель и во чтобы не стало добьется своей цели. Башорат нашла помещение,  поставила стеллажи, купила не много продуктов и открыла магазин. Магазин находится возле ее дома, и первые клиенты были ее соседи. Башорат поняла, что ее магазин нужен соседям ее бизнес не будет убыточным. Башорат обратилась за финансовой поддержкой, чтобы купить больше продуктов питания (молочные продукты, напитки, масло, сахар…), увеличить ассортимент товара и в будущем превратить свой маленький магазин в полноценный супермаркет.
texts.en: Bashorat is 57 years old. She is married to a driver. Bashorat has devoted her whole life to her family and children. She has been wanting to open her own small business for many years, but was unable to do so for a long time. Now she set a goal for herself and will achieve it no matter what. Bashorat found a space, put up a shelves, bought some products and opened her store. Her store is located near her house, and her first customers were her neighbors. Bashorat understood that because her neighbors need her store, the business will not lose money. Bashorat requested financial support to buy more food products, such as dairy products, beverages, butter and cheese, expand her product selection and, in the future, turn her small store into fully-functioning supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase food products for her store

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos is 56 years old and he lives with his wife and his son (he is a military serviceman by contract) in Kapan city of Syunik region. Sos used to work in different workshops and did different work.

Now he works at the city’s combine as a welder and at the same time he keeps a lot of chickens on his farm and cultivates beans, greens, cucumbers and tomatoes on his plot of land. He also has nice win yard. He sells all his farm products, such as poultry, eggs and his land’s goods (beans, greens, cucumbers and tomatoes) at the city’s wholesale market during the week.

Now Sos has some plans connected with his agricultural activities and he hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders; so with this Kiva loan he wants to build a concrete water tank, repair his land’s pipeline and to repair the fence of his vegetable garden.

loans.use: to build a concrete water tank, repair his land’s pipeline and he also wants to repair the fence of his vegetable garden.

loans.name: Chanda's Group

texts.en:
Chanda, a farmer living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, is 27 years old and she is a married mother of a dependent child who is under the age of school.

To make a living, she grows rice and works as a tailor to earn the main sources of the family’s income. Additionally, her husband is working as a taxi driver to earn supplementary income. These days, it is difficult to her to make good income from her taxi-driving business as the fuel price is high while the crop production is low because of drought.

She leads a group of two members to take out a new loan, which will be her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).The previous loan, which was repaid back completely, enabled her to support her family’s needs better.

As the leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to increase the productivity of the crop. She hopes to earn more income to buy an additional plot of farmland to get more yield and to buy a new car to support the taxi-driving business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to increase the productivity of the crop.

loans.name: Sattor

texts.en:
Sattor is a conscious man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1963. He is living in small and remote town with his family. He is married to Zuhro. They have three children. Zuhro works at a medical clinic in their area. 

Sattor is a farmer. He does a business keeping and selling livestock. He has been keeping livestock and selling them for about five years now. His wife supports and helps him in his activity. He buys forage for the livestock from rural and domestic animal markets. Also he mows hay on his neighbour’s and friend’s land to feed his livestock. 

For the past two years he has had a blood pressure problem and each year he needs to get treatment at a medical clinic. This year he does not have money to pay for his treatment. He appealed to IMON asking for help to get treatment at a regional medical clinic. He hopes to be supported and awaits the kindness of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to get treatment at a regional medical clinic.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул женщина, которую все очень любят и уважают. Она добрая и честная женщина. Сафаргул всегда помогает своим соседям и близким людям. Когда её просят о помощи она никогда не откажет никому. Сафаргул заботливая жена и любимая мать. Её муж работает таксистом, и чтобы помочь мужу обеспечить семью, она занимается животноводством. Сафаргул имеет хороший опыт в этой сфере деятельности. На данный момент у неё не осталось  ни одного скота, и она намерена приобрести несколько голов телят. У неё есть собственный капитал, но этого не достаточно. К тому же Сафаргулу нужно купить корм для скотов. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить несколько голов телят и корм для них. Сафаргул ждет Вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Safargul is a woman, who is very loved and respected by everyone. She is a kind and honest woman. Safargul always helps her neighbors and relatives. She never refuses anyone, when she is asked for help. Safargul is a caring wife and a loving mother. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and, to help her husband provide for the family, she is involved in animal husbandry. Safargul has good experience in this business area. Currently, she does not have anymore livestock, so she intends to buy several calves. She has her own capital, but not enough of it; besides, Safargul needs to buy animal feed. This is why she requested a loan to buy several calves and feed for them. Safargul awaits Your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy several calves and feed for them

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun and his family, being thankful for the first Kiva loan, greatly hope their request for the second loan will be again accepted.

Sasun and his family live in Kadjaran city, which is in Syunik region. Sasun’s elder son and daughter are school-aged and their smallest son is two years old. Sasun works at the Kadjaran city’s copper-molybdenum mine and does different construction work by order. His wife does not work and she cares of their children, especially their smallest son who again needs to pass medical treatment.

Sasun needs this loan amount in order to pay for his small son’s treatment. He is thankful beforehand to each of the Kiva lenders for being so kind and helping him with his problem.

loans.use: to pay for his small son’s treatment

loans.name: Maguy

texts.en:
Maguy is a 22-year-old Lebanese single woman, living with her mother and two siblings. Her mother and brothers coordinate together in order to fulfil their family needs and improve their lifestyle. As for Maguy, she doesn’t work as she is only focusing on her studies.

Today she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her university fees.

This will make her very happy that she will able to pursue her education suitably and secure a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Josmita, the lady standing in the middle in the photo, is a 36-year-old woman living with her husband, parents-in-law, and two children in a small village in Dhenkanal district in Odisha, India. 

She has a goat farm in which she currently has ten goats. She purchases goat kids and sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. It takes 8 to 9 months for her to raise and sell them. She goes out in the morning to leave the goats grazing in the fields and returns by noon. She then helps her husband with his farming activities and then resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her children assist her in selling and maintaining these goats. 

In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to build a toilet for her house. She says that all the earnings are used to meet the household expenses and the amount that is left after all the expenses is not sufficient to build a toilet.

Therefore Josmita, along with her other group members, is requesting for a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a latrine pan, bricks, sand, cement and all other required materials that will be used to build a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase a latrine pan, bricks, sand, cement and all the other required materials that will be used to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sebbrey's Group

texts.en:
Aged 44, Sebbrey resides in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has four dependent children who are in school.

To support her family’s living, she grows cassava to earn the main source of the family’s income; she has been in this job for 26 years. She is also growing soybeans to earn supplementary income. The lessening of crop prices is the main challenge she faces.

She now forms a group of three to get a new loan, which will be her second cycle, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Based on the past loan, she improved the living standard much better.

For this new loan, Sebbrey will pay for a plowing fee, buy cassava seeds and to buy organic fertilizer, which are expected to increase the productivity of the crop.

She hopes to earn more income to enlarge the cassava farming and to support her children’s studying.

loans.use: to pay for a plowing fee, buy cassava seeds and to buy organic fertilizer, which are expected to increase the productivity of the crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Muhayyo

texts.ru: Мухайё ровно 40 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее семья проживает в маленьком городке Кургантюбе. Мухайё с мужем и детьми занимаются земледелием. В этом году они посадили КУКУРУЗУ. Этим семейным бизнесом они живут и существуют. Мухайё сама обратилась за кредитом, потому что МДО "ХУМО" упрощает процесс кредитования и предлагает более выгодные условия. Мухайё на заемные деньги планирует приобрести минеральные удобрения, чтобы получить качественный урожай и арматуру, чтобы оградить и разделить по частям поле для удобства работы. Мухайё верит, что ее поддержат, и выражает благодарность.
texts.en: Muhayyo is exactly 40 years old. She is married and has three children. Her family lives in a small town of Qurgan-Tube. Muhayyo, her husband and children are involved in farming. This year they planted corn. This business provides for their living. Muhayyo requested a loan herself because MLO Humo simplified the lending process and offered better conditions this year. Muhayyo plans to use the loan to buy mineral fertilizers in order to get a quality harvest, and equipment to fence off and separate the field to make work more convenient. Muhayyo believes that she will be supported and expresses her gratitude.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to get a quality harvest, and equipment to fence off and separate the field to make work more convenient

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Puspanjali, the lady standing first from left is a 24-year-old woman. She lives with her husband who is a mason and a two-year-old daughter. She started a snack and tea stall in her house, which is located quite close to the market in Dhenkanal district. She cooks and sells local snacks and tea in the mornings and evenings, the general hours for such a business.

Pushpanjali, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 30,000 INR in order to purchase a hand pump and a water purifier for her house. This will help her in getting continous water supply and safe drinking water to consume. She is in dire need of a purifier because she wants to prevent her small daughter from getting water borne diseases.

She hopes for a bright future for her only child.

loans.use: to purchase a hand pump and a water purifier.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg-A Group

texts.en:
The lady standing to the extreme left is Jashoda who is 40 years old. She is the featured borrower of Maa Tarini SHG-A who hails from a small village from Dhenkanal district. 

Jashoda, being a industrious lady, works really very hard in order to earn her living. She works as a farmer on her small piece of land. She lives with her husband and two daughters. Two years ago, her husband lost his right leg in an accident. For this reason Jashoda is undergoing a lot of hardships as she is the only breadwinner for her family. She does not possess a toilet in her house and as a result she and her entire family depend upon the open field for defecation and urination. The toughest part is that her husband is unable to move alone and Jashoda helps in taking him out to attend nature's call.

Therefore Jashoda, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a commode, steel pipes, shower, bricks, sand, cement and iron rods to build a toilet.

Jashoda aspires to purchase a sewing machine and start her tailoring business and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a commode, steel pipes, shower, bricks, sand, cement and iron rods to build a toilet.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
As a married parent with grown up children, Esther works hard to support her family. She has a cosmetics business in Teshie, Accra.

She is borrowing GHS 2,000 from ID-Ghana to purchase cosmetics to sell to customers.

Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from ID-Ghana. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money toward her growing family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Indumati, shown in the photo standing first from left, is a 46-year-old woman who is married and has two children who are in college. She lives in a small village in Dhenkanal district in Odisha, India.

Indumati produces and sells flowers in the community where she lives. She learned this line of work from her parents, who dedicated themselves to this trade for many years. Indumati’s work enables her to generate the necessary income for sustaining her family. She says that she enjoys her work because it is honest labor and it helps her feel useful in her community. Indumati has more than 20 years of experience in this trade. 

She decided to organize a group so that she and her fellow group members could help one another and improve their standard of living. They are requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Indumati will use her portion of the loan amount in order to install a new commode as her old commode is not in a proper condition to use and she will use the remaining portion of the loan amount to purchase a hand pump.

Indumati aspires to become a famous florist in her locality and gain name and fame.

loans.use: to install a new commode and to purchase a hand pump.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a 56-year-old married woman. She is running a business selling milk with her husband (also shown in the photo). She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.

Malika ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures.

Therefore, Malika has requested 35,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Huma

texts.en: Huma is a 25 year old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. Huma fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 41 years old and lives with her husband and youngest daughter (her two elder daughters are already married) in Tandzaver village of Syunik region.  Before, Anna used to work at the school as a teacher of physical education but now her only occupation is farming and agricultural work.  

On her farm, Anna now has cows, calves, a heifer, chickens and a horse. She also has a cute vegetable garden where she cultivates beans, potatoes, cucumber and tomatoes.  All her farm products (milk, meat, eggs and also vegetables) Anna sells right from her farm to her regular customers. This loan will be very helpful for Anna as she needs money to buy diesel fuel in order to organize hay mowing activities and also she will buy fodder for her all farm cattle.

loans.use: buy diesel fuel & cattle fodder

loans.name: Rayan

texts.en: Rayan is a 27-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband.  They have no children.  Her husband is the main income source for the family.  He is a soldier in the Lebanese Army.  As for Rayan, she is focusing on her university studies. Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her summer courses university fees. She states that with her Kiva loan, she will be able to pursue her education suitably. And as she plans to reach higher educational levels, she is eager to request additional Kiva loans to realize this.

loans.use: pay her university fees

loans.name: Arkadik

texts.en:
Arkadik is thirty years old, and he lives with his wife and three children, two daughters and a son, in the village of Tsaghkunk in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. He works at a private company, but his main occupation is farming through which he manages to sustain his family’s needs.

On his farm Arkadik has cows, calves, heifers, sheep and a lot of chickens. His wife takes care of their family and their house perfectly. She not only helps her husband around the farm but also makes very tasty cheese, curd and macun (a sweet paste and national dairy product) from their cows’ milk to sell. From his farm Arkadik also sells meat, eggs, potatoes and carrots.

With this loan of 700,000 AMD through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon Arkadik will buy diesel fuel for his farm equipment and fodder for his cattle. As he says, he finds farming to be a perfect way to have fresh food for his family and a good source of income.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel for his farm equipment and fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her child's educational fees.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 54 years old and lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. Martin is married and has three daughters -- two of them are married and live with their families and his youngest daughter works as a teacher at the local school. 

Martin and his wife have been running a business for 5 years, selling fruits and vegetables.   He sells potato, tomato cabbage, cucumber, garlic, onion, greens, and also apricot, apple, watermelon, plum, etc.).  He sells from a rented space in one of the central streets of the city. 

Martin buys his stall’s products from the farmers of nearby villages and chooses only fresh tasty products that attract his customers from the distance. This couple works from early morning till late at night without holidays in order not to lose any of their customers. 

Martin now needs this Kiva loan, as he wants to enlarge the assortment of his vegetables and especially fruits that are of great demand in this summer season.

loans.use: buy fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Lai is 34 years old and is a married mother of two dependent children who are in school. To make a living, she has been growing rice as the main source of income for 16 years.  She is weaving scarves to earn additional income as well. The main challenge she faces is getting lower-than-expected crop products, which result from drought. 

This is Lai's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She will use it to pay for plowing fee, buy fuel and organic fertilizers to enhance the productivity of her crop. She hopes to earn more income to update her living standard much better than before.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & pay plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Sasmita, 28, standing to the left in the photo is from Dhenkanal district. She is a very humble and ambitious lady. She is currently engaged in dairy farming and owns two cows.

Sasmita has a 5-year-old daughter who is in primary school and her husband works as a peon in a nearby private school. The area where Sasmita resides does not have access to clean drinking water. Many times, dirt and insects were found floating in the supply water.

Therefore, Sasmita and her group member are requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Sasmita will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a water purifier and provide safe drinking water to her family and prevent them from catching deadly diseases.

Sasmita has a dream to provide good education to her only daughter and see her someday become a pilot.

loans.use: to purchase a water purifier.

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Catherine, who is 34 years old, lives in a house with her husband and children. Catherine is a young woman who works day to day to improve herself and get ahead.  She is helping her household expenses through the profits of her business of cassava and corn dough sales, which she does in nearby markets. 

Previously, Catherine asked for a loan which allowed her to invest in her business and increase her sales by a good percentage, as her number of clients increased considerably.  That is why today she dedicates a hundred percent of her time to this occupation. 

Due to her good experience and with the goal of continuing to invest in her business, Catherine has taken the decision to ask for a new loan from ID-Ghana, which will allow her to buy a larger amount of corn and cassava dough to increase her sales and income and meet the demand of her clients.

loans.use: buy corn & cassava dough

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen  is a 31 years old, married woman. Her husband (the man shown with her above) operates a construction business, which is the primary source of their income. Parveen 's husband is responsible for building the roofs of houses. In this way, he is able to earn a sufficient income to provide for their family. However, in order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. For the growth of her husband's business, Parveen has requested a Murabaha loan of 40000 PKR. This will allow him to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so he can meet his customers’ demands without any delay.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so her husband can meet his customers’ demands without any delay

loans.name: Noong Luong 28 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoan, 30, is a Thai ethnic woman who has been married and the mother of a boy at the age of 11. They live in a small village where people mainly rely on agriculture for a living. Like other villagers, Mrs. Ngoan and her husband work very hard at farming and breeding with several activities, such as cultivating rice, raising cow, pig and chicken. This is the fifth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food for the pigs. Despite plenty of difficulties ahead, she believes that with the continuing support from the Program, her investment will go smoothly and bring good income for her family. 

Mrs. Ngoan dreams that her child will study well, enter a good college and have bright future. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has sold fresh fish to local residents for 7 years. She is a 36-year-old married woman with four dependents. Her oldest child is 13 and the youngest child is 7. They reside in Talibon, Bohol.

She  is asking for a loan to buy additional  fish to sell which will increase her volume and improve her daily earnings. She would be able to provide her family with healthy diets, better shelter, and education for her children. 

In the future, she  plans to improve  her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional  fish to sell.

loans.name: Walter Ernesto

texts.es: Walter tiene 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia y humilde desde hace varios años, junto a su compañera de vida que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de empleada doméstica. Walter posee una pequeña panadería donde elabora y comercializa pan francés, es muy reconocido por sus vecinos como un hombre honesto y trabajador. Walter está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: harina, huevos, leche entre otros productos para la elaboración del pan y compra de 2 bicicletas para la distribución de pan a lugares donde no alcanza a llevar sus productos, ya que es su fuente de ingresos y desea mejorarla cada día cumpliendo además con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan.
texts.en:
Walter is 31 years old. For the last several years, he has been living in his own humble home with his life partner, who works as a cleaning lady.
 
Walter owns a small bakery, where he makes and sells French bread. He is regarded as an honest and hard-working man by his neighbours. 

Walter is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy flour, eggs, and milk, among other products, to make bread and to buy two bicycles with which he will distribute his products to places where people have not access to them yet.  

This business is his source of income and wants to improve it each day by meeting his customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make French bread and to buy two bicycles to distribute his baked goods.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en: This nice and cheerful woman’s name is Meri. She is 29 years old and lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She is married and a mother of two pretty children. Meri’s husband is a builder but with Meri he is also engaged in farming. On the farm, Meri has cows, calves, lambs and sheep. With the help of her husband, Meri sell a lot of meat (beef and mutton) to the city butchers. She also sells her farm’s milk, macun (a national dairy-product) and curd. Meri greatly wants to make her farm bigger and richer with cattle. She requests this loan as she wants to buy one more cow, one more calf, and also fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow, one more calf and also fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Noeun's Group

texts.en:
From the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Noeun is 56 years old and a married mother of four children, one of whom is still in school. She is also the leader of this group of five that has applied for a 5,000,000 KHR loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia. This will be her first loan with the organization, and the loan will be apportioned among its members.

To make a living Noeun has sold groceries for ages, and it is the main source of the family’s income. For additional income she and her husband grow cassava, and sometimes her husband drives a motorcycle taxi.

Noeun’s grocery store has become depleted, so her sales have gone down. She will use her portion of the loan to buy more groceries to resell and organic herbicide to protect her cassava crops. She hopes to earn more income to enhance the family’s living standards and support her child in their studies until graduation.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell and organic herbicide to protect her cassava crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Nazrana

texts.en:
Nazrana, 41 years old, is shown in the photo with her husband, who runs a small shop repairing home appliances. He makes enough to provide for his family. 

For her husband's business, Nazrana has applied for a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR to buy various wires, switches, batteries and tools. These purchases will enable him to cater to more customers. Nazrana is optimistic about her husband's future earnings.

loans.use: to purchase various wires, switches, batteries and tools.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma  is a 35-year-old married woman has raised animals for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 4 children who is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR. She and her husband intend to purchase  goats and calves to meet customer needs. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats and calves.

loans.name: Zeba

texts.en:
Zeba  is a 23-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has been a tailor for many years to support her husband (also shown in the photo). She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the educational needs of their children. That is why she started a home-based tailoring business to support her family. 

She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She requests 20,000 PKR  to purchase thread, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces to fulfill customers' orders. 

 Zeba  hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase thread, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces.

loans.name: Zaynabbibi

texts.ru: Зайнаббиби ответственная, усидчивая и пунктуальная девушка. Ей 35 лет и она все еще не замужем. Зайаббиби живет с родителями в районе Шахритуз. У нее медицинское образование, по специальности она фармацевт. У неё есть своя аптека в районе. Зайнаббиби принимает и проверяет рецепты, выдает на их основании лекарственные препараты, консультирует посетителей аптеки по части правильного и безопасного приема лекарств, ведет учет рецептов, следит за запасами товаров, а также занимается решением жалоб посетителей аптеки, касающихся выдачи лекарственных препаратов, выдаваемых на основании рецептов. Она ответственно относится к своей работе, так как ошибка в выдаче лекарства может вызвать серьезные нарушения здоровья пациента или даже его смерть. Сейчас Зайнаббиби нужно купить новые лекарственные препараты, но у неё нет достаточно средств, и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. У них в районе мало аптек и Зайнаббиби срочно должна приобрести все необходимые лекарства для больных. Она очень просит ей помочь.
texts.en: Zaynabbibi is a responsible, diligent and punctual young woman. She is 35 years old, and she is still not married. Zaynabbibi lives with her parents in the Shahrituz district. She has a medical education and is a pharmacist. She owns a pharmacy in the district. Zaynabbibi accepts and checks prescriptions, dispenses medicine according to prescriptions, consults pharmacy patrons on the correct and safe way to take medicine, keeps inventory of prescriptions, watches after the product stock, and also takes care of resolving customer complaints regarding dispensing of prescribed medicine. She treats her work responsibly because a mistake in dispensing medicine can lead to serious health implications for patients and even death. Now Zaynabbibi needs to buy new medicine, but does not have enough money, and this is why she requested a loan. There are very few pharmacies in the district, and Zaynabbibi urgently needs to buy all the necessary medicine for patients. She really needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase new medicine for her pharmacy

loans.name: Khosiyatkhon

texts.ru: Эту жизнерадостную и веселую женщину зовут Хосиятхон. Именно она хранительница домашнего очага, создательница уюта в доме, хозяйка и просто прекрасная женщина. Хосиятхон имеет двоих детей. Муж с сыном находятся на заработках на чужбине. Она с дочкой справляются со всеми домашними делами. Хосият понимает, как им родным тяжело зарабатывать и дома занимается животноводством. Сейчас у нее 4 голов скотов. Хосият хочет расширить деятельность, путем увеличения поголовья скота. Она обратилась, за кредитом с надеждой на то, что сможет приобрести пару телят и реализовать план. Сейчас Вы можете поддержать Хосиятхон в совершении ее идеи.
texts.en: The name of this joyful and happy woman is Khosiyatkhon. She is precisely the keeper of the household, creator of comfort at home, homemaker and a wonderful woman. Khosiyatkhon has two children. Her husband and son are working abroad. She and her daughter handle all of the household work. Khosiyatkhon understands that it is hard for her family to earn a living and is involved in animal husbandry at home. She currently has 4 heads of livestock. Khosiyatkhon wants to expand her business by increasing her livestock headcount. She requested a loan with the hope that she will be able to buy a couple of calves and accomplish her plan. Now You can support Khosiyatkhon in achieving her ideas.

loans.use: to buy a couple of calves in order to expand her business

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from the village Lchashen, which is in the Gegharkunik region. She had repaid her second Kiva loan and hopes that she will have one more pleasant partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon. 

Liana, with the help of her husband, manages a farm and agriculture is the main source of income for her nice family. On her farm Liana has cows, sheep and chickens and she sells her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), curd, cheese and eggs to her neighbors and some regular customers. 

Liana has mastery in land cultivation and she manages to have good harvests of potatoes and greens. As she mentions, farming is very hard work, especially for a woman, but she manages to have fresh and tasty food and products for her lovely family. She is asking for this loan now as she wants to enlarge the number of her farm cattle with one more cow and also to buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: buy a cow and cattle fodder

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 51-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman and she has sold dried fish for 20 years and earns about 5,300 PHP per month. 

Cecilia’s plan in the future is to send her four children to school. She hopes that if her children earn a degree, they could have a better standard of living. She and her husband work hard but their capital is not enough and she needs a loan to buy dried fish, gasoline, and a battery for their boat.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, gasoline, and a battery.

loans.name: Tazeem

texts.en:
Tazeem  is 48 years old.  She is a married woman doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 2 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. 

Tazeem has requested a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to  more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: buy goats & calves

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 53 year old, married woman and a mother of 3 children. One of her sons, also shown in the photo, is involved in tailoring work. He knows the techniques of stitching very well. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  For her son's business, Parveen has requested a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR  to buy a new sewing machine along with spools of threads in different colors, packs of zippers, buttons, etc., to sew more dresses on time. She is positive about her son's future earnings.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine along with spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers, buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen  is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over  time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and they make enough to meet the expenses of their 3 children.

Parveen has requested a Murabaha loan of 15000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to  maximum customers to generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Zamurid

texts.en:
Zamurid  is 54 years old.  She is a widow.  She is shown in the photo with her son.  

Zamurid deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

Zamurid needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a Murabaha loan of PKR 30000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: buy livestock & cattle

loans.name: Shereen

texts.en:
Shereen  is 34 years old.  She is a married woman and a mother of 3 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Shereen has gradually improved her business.  She has requested for a Murabaha loan of 35000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She is shown in the photo with her nephew.

loans.use: buy a buffalo

loans.name: Jormoh Group

texts.en:
Ernestina is a 44-year-old single woman representing the Jormoh Group. She is a trader and has sold soft drinks and bottled water for 7 years. 

Ernestina needs a micro loan  to buy more soft drinks and bottled water. Ernestina has been very committed and faithful to her repayment obligation during the first loan cycle with ID-Ghana. Ernestina intends to use the profit from her business to improve her standard of living and to expand her business. 

Ernstina thanks all of her Kiva lenders for their kind financial assistance that helps improve the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and bottled water.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia  is a 37-year-old married woman with 4 children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has raised animals for many years. Rabia works with her husband to support the needs of the family and requests 20,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase cattle to resell in the market. 

She plans to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase  cattle.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia  is a single woman who is shown in the photo with her brother. She is an energetic woman who has sold material for many years. She buys cloth in various fabrics, colors, and designs from the market at wholesale rates to sell to the people of her community. 

She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough money. She has requested  20,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of fabric in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a thirty years old married woan with four children who works hard to support her husband to provide their living needs.
Sahar is well known for her special talents and good reputation. 

Ten years ago, Sahar started a home-based tailor business which enables her to stay close to her family and fulfill their needs, as well as meet customers' requests.

Sahar had specialized vocational training and requests a YOUTH loan to make necessary home improvements and build a sewing room.

Her future plans is to move her business outside her house and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Luz Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LUZ DEL SUR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Ernestina continua con su negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua preparando platos como pollo al horno, sopas y carne con arroz para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite entre otros.
 Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “LUZ DEL SUR” communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. Ernestina, who is a member, continues with her business selling food. She has been working in the business for years and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She continues to make dishes such as baked chicken, soups and meat with rice for her customers who ask her for these. She wants to carry on working so that she can continue supporting her family in this way.

Ernestina is asking for the loan to buy rice, oil and other items. The group as a whole thank those who form part of this dream by doing this, and promise to fulfil their instalment payments in the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other items.

loans.name: Arfa

texts.en:
Arfa  is a 22-year-old married woman shown in the photo with her husband. She sells fabric and purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market to sell in her town. She has a strong customer base. 

Arfa  has requested 35,000 PKR to buy a variety of fabric in different colors to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Чамила очень признательна Вам за помощь. Благодаря вашей поддержке она смогла закупить миндаль и продать их с наценкой. Жизненные условия её семьи значительно улучшились. Теперь она в состоянии сама обеспечит своих детей. Чамила очень счастлива. Она все еще продаёт миндаль на рынке и сейчас параллельно хочет расширить растениеводческую деятельность. Прибыль, которую Чамила получила от продажи миндаля, она потратила на покупку семян  разных видов овощей. Так получилось, что у нее не осталось денег на покупку минеральных удобрений. Она снова обратилась за кредитом. Чамила верит, что с вашей поддержкой она снова добьется большого успеха.
texts.en: Jamila is very grateful to you for your help. Thanks to your support, she was able to buy almonds and sell them at a premium. Her family's living conditions have improved significantly. Now she is able to provide for her children herself. Jamila is very happy. She is still selling almonds at the market and now wants to expand her crop growing business in parallel. Jamila spent the profit she made from selling almonds on buying various vegetable seeds. It turned out that she does not have enough money left to buy mineral fertilizer. She is applying for a loan again. Jamila believes that she will once again achieve great success with your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршед спокойный и порядочный человек. Ему 37 лет. Он отец троих детей. Хуршед с семьей проживает в Душанбе
  Недавно у Хуршеда начались проблемы со здоровьем. Он прошел обследование, и теперь он должен лечиться, так как у него очень серьезные проблемы. На оплату лечения, приобретения медикаментов уходит много денег. Хуршед обращается за кредитом с надеждой, что скорее восстановить здоровье. Поддержите Хуршеда.
texts.en:
Khurshed is a calm and decent person. He is 37 years old. He is the father of three children. Khurshed and his family live in Dushanbe.

Not long ago Khurshed began to experience problems with his health. He was examined and now he must be treated since he has very serious problems. It takes a lot of money to pay for treatment and to buy medicines. Khurshed is applying for a loan with the hope that he will restore his health soon. Please support Khurshed.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment.

loans.name: Claudia  Paola

texts.es:
La joven Claudia Paola de 21  años de edad, vive con su mamá y sus hermanos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de cosméticos como lociones, cremas, brillos, bloqueadores, sandalias, ropa interior, etc. vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras.
Claudia Paola es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como lociones, cremas, sandalias y ropa, etc. para poder surtir su negocio, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente  subsiguiente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar sus ganancias para seguir estudiando en la universidad.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Claudia Paola is 21 years old and lives with her mother and her siblings in their own house. For five years she has made a living selling cosmetics such as lotions, creams, glosses, sunscreen, sandals, underwear etc. She lives in a village in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.

Claudia Paola is an enterprising woman with a desire to succeed and fight day after day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for this loan to buy products such as lotions, creams, sandals and clothing with which she will be able to stock up her business. With the support of this loan she will seek to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a returning client who is keen to work with Prisma.

She dreams of having a good business, of increasing her customer base, and also of improving her income so that she can continue studying at university.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, sandals and clothing etc. for her business

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea, la socia sigue con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo  diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, gaseosas  entre otros.
Las personas mayores de 65 años de edad  están excluidas del sistema financiero formal y gracias a los inversionistas de Kiva pueden lograr su financiamiento de tal manera la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido. 
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Andrea, a member who continues with her grocery store business. She has had her business for awhile, which is going well thanks to effort she puts into it each day. She continues to sell different types of products like rice, sugar, milk and candy, among other things, for all her clients that request them.

The member wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, soda and other items.

People older than 65 years old are excluded from the formal financial system; thanks to Kiva investors, they can get financing. The member promises to pay her dues within the established period. 

The members in the thumbnail photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy rice and soda, among other things.

loans.name: Los Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PERSEVERANTES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Jessica, la socia sigue con su negocio de  internet, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua prestando servicios de internet a sus clientes que le solicitan, la  socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una maquina.
El socio que sale a la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “LOS PERSEVERANTES” communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. Jessica, who is a member, is continuing with her internet business. She has had the business for a good while and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She continues to provide internet services for her customers who ask for them. She wants to continue working so she can continue supporting her family in this way. Jessica is grateful to those who form part of this dream by doing this and promises to fulfil her payment instalments in the agreed timeframe. 

Jessica is asking for a loan to buy a machine. The member who is in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late at the meeting because of work reasons.

loans.use: to buy a machine.

loans.name: Samuela

texts.en:
Samuela is a 52-year old married woman with 4 children (15 -22 years old). She  runs a sari-sari(variety) store to ell  vinegar, powdered milk, coffee, dried fish, medicines, soap, shampoo, matches, and soft drinks.  Her husband is a tailor.

Samuela has requested  6,000 PHP to purchase Pepsi, liquor, and groceries.  She wants to  enhance  her stock and attract customers to shop and purchase. 

She will improve, settle her finances, and continue to send her children to school.

She is determined to expand her livelihood to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase Pepsi, liquor, and groceries.

loans.name: Jormelina

texts.en:
Jormelina is 30 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is currently in school.

Jormelina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jormelina has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jormelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell to her customers.

Josefina has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Ханифа трудолюбивая женщина, уроженка Кубадиянского района. Ей 53 лет. Ханифа много лет назад потеряла мужа и одна воспитала своих детей. Ханифа занимается животноводством и этим обеспечивает семью. В этом деле ей помогают её дети. Несмотря на все трудности жизни, она смогла остаться сильной женщиной. Ханифа обратилась за кредитом, для того чтобы провести свадьбу сына. В Таджикистане по традициям жених и его родители должны дать невесте приданое. К сожалению, у Ханифи недостаточно денег, чтобы купить сундук с приданным для своей будущей невестки. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку, а на остаток суммы она намерена, купить маленького телёнка.
texts.en: Hanifa is a hard-working woman and a native of the Qubadiyon region. She is 53 years old. Hanifa lost her husband many years ago and raised her children on her own. Hanifa rears animals and in this way provides for her family. Her children help her with this business. Despite all the difficulties in her life, she has been able to remain a strong woman. Hanifa has applied for a loan in order to hold her son's wedding. In Tajikistan according to tradition the groom and his parents must give a dowry to the bride. Unfortunately, Hanifa does not have enough money to buy a chest with dowry gifts for her future daughter-in-law. She hopes for your support, and intends to use the remaining sum to buy a young calf.

loans.use: to hold her son's wedding and to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 64 years old, married, and supports a family of eight children. He has been practicing construction for the last 20 years, earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Charles has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to improve his dairy farming. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Гулноза. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Сыну Мехрочу 15 лет, а дочке Шохине 17 лет. Дети подросли, и Гулноза может заниматься другими делами. Она решила начать новый бизнес и помочь мужу обеспечить семью. Гулноза нашла не большое помещение и сделала ремонт. Теперь, когда есть место для магазина, нужно купить продукты питания. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Гулноза надеется, что благодаря кредиту она приобретет продукты и откроет магазин.
texts.en: This woman is called Gulnoza. She is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. Her son Mekhroch is 15 years old, and her daughter Shokhina is 17 years old. Her children are growing up, and Gulnoza can do other things. She has decided to start a new business and help her husband provide for the family. Gulnoza has found a small place and renovated it. Now that she has a place for her store, she needs to buy produce. For this reason she has applied for a loan. Gulnoza hopes that, thanks to the loan, she will buy the produce and open her store.

loans.use: to buy produce and open a store.

loans.name: Niginapocho

texts.ru:
Нигинапочо 31 летняя жительница района Шахритус. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Нигинапочо с мужем занимаются сельскохозяйственными деятельностями. Муж работает на поле, а Нигинапочо на скотном дворе. Она ухаживает, кормит и поит скотин. Нигинапочо вместе с мужем продвигаются по жизни вместе ради семьи, ради детей.
  Нигинапочо обратилась за финансовой поддержкой, чтобы расширить животноводческую деятельность. У нее сейчас осень малое количество скотин и она надеется, что благодаря кредиту ей удастся увеличить поголовья скотин и расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
Niginapocho is a 31-year-old resident of the Shahrituz region. She is married and has two children. Niginapocho and her husband are engaged in agricultural activity. Her husband works in the fields, and Niginapocho works in the livestock yard. She looks after, feeds and waters the livestock. Niginapocho and her husband move forwards through life together for the sake of their family, for the sake of their children.

Niginapocho has applied for financial support to expand her animal rearing business. She has few livestock at present and she hopes that, thanks to a loan, she will be able to increase the size of her herd and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a couple of heads of livestock.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia continúa con su negocio de venta de mantas y mandiles de cholita. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de mantas y mandiles por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Su próxima meta es ampliar su negocio ofreciendo ropa de segunda mano, “cuento con clientes fijos, ahora quiero ampliar mi oferta y vender ropa de segunda mano, para llegar a nuevos públicos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la diversificación de mercadería. Su sueño es abrir un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para diversificar su oferta y llegar a nuevos clientes. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 11 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para diversificar su oferta y llegar a nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Virginia continues with her business selling blankets and traditional aprons ("cholita" aprons). She invested the loan she received in the purchase of blankets and aprons in bulk so she could provide for her clients that season. Her repayments were punctual because she did not have any problems. 

Her next goal is to grow her business, offering second-hand clothing: "I count on steady clients. Now I want to broaden my offering and sell second-hand clothes to reach new people," she says.
